She needs to do the autumn planting, but she does not have money to buy seeds, mineral fertilizer and fuel. She is requesting a loan of 7,500 somoni.

loans.use: to buy seeds, mineral fertilizers and fuel for a new sowing season

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es:
Teofila tiene 35 años de edad vive junto a sus dos hijos en el distrito de Buenos Aires, que pertenece a Morropon, ubicado en la región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella es muy conocida en la zona se dedica a la venta de chicha de jora, tamales y horneados de pavo, de esta manera ella contribuye con su esposo en los gastos de su hogar.

Son una familia emprendedora Teofila ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para arreglar el local donde se encuentra ubicado su negocio y así tener un lugar agradable donde acoger a sus clientes y de esta manera tener mayor clientela que le generara mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Teofila is 35 years old. She lives with her two children in the Buenos Aires district, which is in Morropon in the Piura region, on Perú's northern coast.

She is very well-known in the zone. She makes a living by selling chicha (a drink made from corn), tamales, and baked turkey. This is how she helps her husband with the household expenses. They are an entrepreneurial family.

Teofila has requested a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles to repair the location where her business is located so that she will have a nice place to meet customers. This way, she will have better customers, which will bring more income for her family.

loans.use: to repair the location where her business is located.

loans.name: Maria Aurora

texts.es:
María Aurora tiene 60 años de edad, vive junto su esposo e hijos en el distrito de Cayaltí, donde su población se dedica al cultivo de caña, arroz, comercio de animales menores y ganadería.

Ella se dedica a la venta de golosinas, frutas y gaseosas, su negocio está ubicado en su domicilio, María ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para compara golosinas y víveres para hacer crecer su negocio y así ofrecer más variedad para sus clientes y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
María Aurora is 60 years old. She lives with her husband and children in the Cayaltí district, where many residents make a living by growing sugar cane and rice, selling small animals, and raising cattle.

She makes a living by selling snacks, fruit, and sodas. Her business is located in her home. María has requested a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles to purchase snacks and supplies to grow her business. This way, she will be able to offer a greater variety of products to her customers and generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase snacks and supplies to stock her business.

loans.name: Tungalag

texts.en:
Tungalag is a 43-year-old married woman with one child. She lives in a Ger, traditional nomadic yurt, in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. Her husband works at a local company and her son is a primary school student. 
Tungalag has been operating a butcher shop at the local market for years and has regular customers. Mongolians' main food is meat and meat retailers have a high season around the end of the year. Tungalag is now requesting loan of 1,000,000 MNT to purchase a large amount of meat products to sell at her rental booth. She is a hard-working and positive woman.

loans.use: to purchase large amounts of meat products to sell at her rental booth

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson always thinks of his children's future. Despite of their way of living, Wilson works hard to be able to meet his family's daily needs, specifically his children's education and basic necessities.

He manages his rice field, and at the same time he runs his sari-sari store. Generated income from his retail store serves as his children's daily allowances in school. He dreams of his children finishing their studies so they will become professionals someday.

To make his goal realistic, he manages his farming and retail store well for continuous growth.

Thus, he is asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy canned goods, breads, soap, shampoo, and toothpaste. He hopes to achieve his dreams soon.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, breads, soap, shampoo, and toothpaste.

loans.name: Cristobal

texts.es:
Cristóbal, está acompañado, tiene cinco hijos, que ya son adultos, su actividad económica es hacer viajes en microbús propio en el interior del país, es un servicio que ofrece desde hace varios años, su unidad de transporte la adquirió con sus ahorros de su anterior trabajo y esta solicitado un crédito para la reparación de su unidad de transporte ya que tiene algunos desperfectos, el préstamo le servirá para mantener en óptimas condiciones su microbús y dar un buen servicio a sus clientes.
 Su deseo es mantener la fidelidad de sus clientes, generar más ingresos, cancelar la deuda sin ningún problema y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Cristóbal has a partner and five grown-up children. He makes his living by carrying out journeys in his own minibus in the interior of El Salvador. He has offered this service for several years, having purchased his vehicle with his savings from his previous job. He is requesting this loan to in order to make repairs to his vehicle, which now has some problems. It will enable him to keep his minibus in optimal condition and give his customers a good service.

His wish is to remain loyal to his customers, earn more income, repay his loan without any problem, and to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to repair his transport vehicle.

loans.name: M. Aslam

texts.en:
M. Aslam is 38-year-old married man with four children. He is living in a populated area and he knows the requirements of people in this area.
He is a market vendor and sells seasonal vegetables from his place in a central bazaar and also from his home. M. Aslam has 15 years of experience in this field. He knows customers' needs and he has reliable providers. 
He chose this business because it is profitable and brings stable income. People use fresh vegetables every day and consider them healthy, and many national dishes are made of vegetables. He wants to increase the stock on a daily basis so that he could sell a maximum amount of vegetables till evening and could get maximum rewards for his efforts. 
M. Aslam applied for a loan to purchase more vegetables and thus increase his monthly turnover. This will be his first loan.

loans.use: A loan of $922 helps M. Aslam purchase more vegetables to sell his customers.

loans.name: Mohamed Hussein

texts.en: Mohamed Hussien is a 27-year-old single man. He finished at Admas University College in 2012.  He is employed by the Ministry of Education and he needs a laptop for his work . He requested a laptop from Kaaba and now he is waiting for it. Kaaba will provide the laptop as a loan, and Mohamed will pay monthly repayments.

loans.use: To buy a laptop for work purposes.

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en:
This is Epifania, 63, a resident of Malibay, Pasay, Philippines. Single, she is working hard to provide her everyday expenses.

Epifania operates an internet café business. Services like this become a need as customers’ demand increases. Her main patrons are students, who require her services for school requirements. She has customers who need to rent computers for business purposes, like writing a resume, or for office documentation, as well as customers who would just love to surf the net and visit any social network.  She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in profit every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional computer parts and accessories needed in her business.

Epifania hopes that her business will just continue to expand, and wants a simple life. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional computer parts and supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
This is Elvira, 51, a resident of Cabrera, Pasay, Philippines. She is married and she has children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. She works hard to provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Elvira operates the buying and selling business of her family. What she basically does is to buy general merchandise from wholesalers and sell it with a little profit. Her products are men's and women’s clothes and other products of the like. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy RTW products and merchandise items like polo shirts for men and women, socks and shirts to expand her product inventory.

Elvira dreams that her business will grow bigger and hopes to have a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for RTW products and merchandise items like polo shirts for men and women, socks and shirts to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en:
Bilal, who is 28 years old, is a married youth client from Iraq. He has two children, and lives with his family, which is composed of four members. 

Bilal and his brothers provide the family's income. Bilal owns a small shop where he sells women’s outfits. He established his business in 2008, and has gained good experience in this field through previous work at a similar shop, as an employee, until he established his own business. He now has hired an employee, and has gained an excellent reputation, thanks to the good quality and the affordable prices of his products. 

Bilal is requesting a youth loan of USD 2,400 which will be used to expand his shop and to install an external ceiling. 

He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits, so that he will be able keep providing his family with a better income.

loans.use: to expand his shop and to install an external ceiling

loans.name: Fadel

texts.en:
Fadel is from Iraq. He is a hard working client of 67 who is married and has two children. Fadel and one of his children provide the family income together. 

Fadel owns a small grocery store where he sells canned food, snacks, soft drinks, detergents, and shampoos. He has been practicing this business since 2004 and since then, he has been providing his family with the profit he gained from this grocery store. Fadel is a well-known person in the neighborhood, and has earned the respect of many. 

Fadel is requesting a loan of 3,000 USD to buy a motor generator, a refrigerator, and to install new shelves in his grocery store. 

He is aiming to grow in this field so that one day he may open a bigger supermarket and provide his children a good career.

loans.use: to buy a motor generator, a refrigerator, and to install new shelves in his grocery store

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 33-year-old housewife. She lives with her husband, two daughters, and a son in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. 

Since 2007, her husband has had a general store, and he works very hard to meet his family needs. He needs additional capital for the growth of his business. His wife, Nasreen, has requested a loan from KIVA partner BRAC Pakistan. 

With the loan money, her husband can buy a variety of goods for his general store, to satisfy his clients more professionally as well as to increase his savings for the better future of his children.

Nasreen and her husband are very hopeful that the loan will be a lucky and productive one for their family.

loans.use: to pay for goods for their general store.

loans.name: Abdul Hussain

texts.en:
Abdul Hussain is from Iraq. He is a youth client of 28 years old, who is single and lives with his parents and his brother. Abdul Hussain and his brother provide the family income together.

Abdul Hussain is a photographer and owns a studio. He specializes in taking pictures of events, weddings and other occasions. He established his business in 2011, and has grown rapidly with experience. Now, he has a hired an employee, and his reputation has spread all over the neighborhood.

Abdul Hussain is requesting a youth loan of 2,400 USD. The aim of this loan is to buy a new video camera and some other necessary items. He is aiming to grow his business, open a bigger studio one day and improve the quality of his income.

loans.use: to buy a new video camera and some other necessary items.

loans.name: Raksmey

texts.en: Raksmey is 25 years old. She is married and lives in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than two years, earning approximately $5 per day. Her husband, who is with her in the picture, runs the business of buying wax to resell. He makes an income of $8 each day. To improve her husband’s business, Raksmey is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase more wax for resale. By doing so he would be able to generate more income for the family. In the future, she would like to expand the business and rebuild her house if possible.

loans.use: to purchase more wax for resale

loans.name: Samnang

texts.en:
Samnang is 29 years old. She is married, and resides with one child in Takeo Province, Cambodia. 

She has been working in a garment factory for more than two years, earning approximately $5 per day. Her husband, who is joining her in the picture, runs a business buying junk materials to resell and breeding pigs. He makes an income of $6 each day. 

In order to improve her family’s livelihood, Samnang is requesting a loan of $1350 to purchase piglets and fodder for breeding. By doing so, she would be able to expand the business and generate more income for the family. In the future, she would like to build a new house and send her child to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and fodder for breeding.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Munaypata - 26 Group

texts.es: El banco de emprendimiento NUEVA ESPERANZA MUNAYPATA – 26 está compuesta por ocho integrantes seis mujeres y dos varones  todos ellos se dedican a distintas actividades, la presidenta del banco es la señora Flora tiene 42 años casada con dos hijos que son de las edades de 12 y 8 años, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de limpieza, detergentes en distintas ferias de la ciudad de la Paz, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la señora Flora va a usar este préstamo para compra de detergentes y variedad de productos de limpieza por mayor para surtir su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es incrementar su mercadería, la señora Flora enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia diaria y va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir surtiendo su mercadería y así de esta manera genera más ingresos económicos, se siente feliz ya agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado a ella y a sus compañeras de grupo que en muchos casos sacan a delante a su familia.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "Nueva Esperanza Munaypata - 26" consists of eight members, six women and two men. All of them engage in different activities.

The group president is Sra. Flora. She is 42 years old, married, and has two children (ages 12 and 8). Flora sells cleaning products and detergents at different fairs in the city of La Paz. This will be her first loan cycle with Emprender. Sra. Flora will use her loan to buy detergents and a variety of cleaning products in bulk so that she can restock her business. Her reason for requesting this loan is to increase her inventory of merchandise. Sra. Flora faces challenges in her business, such as the daily competition. She will use her profits to continue stocking her business with merchandise and, as a result, will generate more income.

Flora is pleased and appreciates the support that Emprender has given to her and her fellow group members, since it has helped their families get ahead on several occasions.

loans.use: to buy cleaning products.

loans.name: Yesenia Bethy

texts.es:
Yesenia es una mujer de 22 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona con sus padres y hermanos,ella es muy trabajadora, entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Yesenia no ha podido estudiar una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, Yesenia trabaja como vendedora y brinda atención al publico en una tienda de repuestos de computadoras de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Yesenia se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada realizará la compra de una refrigeradora, la cual le ayudará a mantener en buen estado sus alimentos, así pues Yesenia seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su propio negocio comercial.
texts.en:
Yesenia is a 22-year-old woman. She is single and lives in the city of Ica, in the district of Parcona, with her parents and siblings. She is very hard-working and enthusiastic, with a great desire to get ahead in life. Unfortunately, because of the lack of economic resources and the need to work, Yesenia has not been able to study for a professional degree. 

On her own initiative, Yesenia works as a saleswoman, providing customer service in a shop in her city selling computer parts and supplies. She works every day for approximately 10 hours, and she believes that it is going well for her because of her dedication and effort. 

Yesenia is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help provided, she will be able to buy a refrigerator, which will help her to maintain her food in good condition. Yesenia will keep working and striving to achieve her great dream of having her own shop.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is 31 years old, married and has three children. He is the only provider of the family. 

Ali owns a general store, where he sells basic electrical supplies such as bulbs and other supplies such as duct tape. He has been in this field since 2011, and has been gradually expanding his experience. 

Ali has an excellent reputation, and has earned the respect of his neighborhood. Ali is requesting a loan of $3,000, which he will use to renovate his general store and install a rolling shutter and signage to attract more customers. He is aiming to expand his business and increase his profits so that he may provide his children with a bright future by educating them and giving them the best of everything.

loans.use: to renovate his general store and install a rolling shutter and signage.

loans.name: Zeid

texts.en:
Zeid is an Iraqi youth client who is 29 years old, married, and has three children. Zeid lives with his parents and helps his father in providing the family income. 

Zeid owns a grocery store where he sells all the basic needs of a family like dairy products, snacks, canned food and detergent. He established his business in 1999 and has gained much experience in this field. Thanks to his special customer service, Zeid's reputation grew and he became well-known in the neighborhood. 

Zeid is requesting a youth loan of 2,000 USD to buy a refrigerator and to increase his inventory. Zeid is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so that he may continue providing for his family’s needs and improving their living standards.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and to increase his inventory

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.ru: Гульмире 32 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. У Гульмиры - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Гульмира занимается животноводством, стартовав 12 лет назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Гульмиры, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 дойные коровы, 1 теленок, 6 коз, 20 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 8,000 сом (KGS). Гульмира входит в группу "Тамара", в эту группу входят еще 2 человека. Гульмира является вторым членом группы. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гульмира обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Гульмира планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на строительство нового дома.
texts.en:
Gulmira is 32 years old, married, and with her husband is raising two children. Gulmira has a high school education. As a main source of income for her family, Gulmira is engaged in raising livestock, having started 12 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 5,000 som KGS. Thanks to her hard work, Gulmira currently has on her homestead: three dairy cows, one calf, six goats, and 20 sheep. Monthly income consists 8,000 som (KGS).

Gulmira is a second member of the "Tamara" lending group, which has two other people. With the aim of further developing her homestead, Gulmira turned to the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 30,000 som (KGS) to buy calves for increasing the headcount of cattle.

Gulmira plans to invest income from the loan in further increasing the quantity of domestic animals, and plans to save money for building a new home.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Anakan

texts.ru: Анакан 45 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. У Анакан - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Анакан занимается животноводством, стартовав 15 лет назад, с покупки скота на 11,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Анакан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 10 овец и 1 теленок. Ежемесячный доход составляет 7,000 сом (KGS). Анакан входит в группу "Тамара", в эту группу входят еще 2 человека. Анакан является третьим членом группы. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Анакан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Анакан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на покупку автомашину.
texts.en:
Anakan is 45 years old, married, and together with her husband is raising two children. Anakan has a high school education. As a main source of income for his family, Anakan is engaged in raising livestock, having started 15 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 11,000 som KGS. Thanks to her hard work, Anakan currently has on his homestead: one dairy cow, ten sheep and one calf. Monthly income consists of 7,000 som (KGS).

Anakan is the third member in the lending group "Tamara", with two other people. With the aim of further developing his homestead, Anakan turned to the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy calves for increasing the headcount of cattle.

Anakan plans to invest income from the loan in further increasing the quality of domestic livestock, and plans to save money to buy an automobile.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Babirye

texts.en:
Babirye, together with the husband, operate a retail shop in a rural trading center where they sell all household use items, like soap, salt, and sugar (to mention but a few). She is hard working and resilient.

She does small scale agriculture to supplement the income and also to put food on the table. 

They thank Ugafode for giving them a helping hand and supporting their venture. 

In the photograph is Babirye and her husband.

loans.use: To buy items to sell (sugar, soap, rice)

loans.name: Koem

texts.en:
Koem is 36 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been selling vegetables for more than five years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband who is joining her in the picture runs a delivery service. He makes an income of $4 daily. 

To improve her family’s finances, Koem is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase an ice cream container to run a business selling ice cream. By doing so, she would be able to generate additional income for the family. In the future, she would like to expand the business and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase an ice cream container to run a business selling ice cream

loans.name: Ahmadjon

texts.ru: Ахмадчону 36 лет. Он миролюбивый человек с открытой душой. Ахмадчон верный муж и отец двоих детей. Дочери 15 лет, сыну 10 лет. Они оба ходят в школу. Жена помогает мужу в его деятельности. У Ахмадчона имеется земельный участок, где он сажает овощи и зерновые культуры. Растениеводство является не единственным источником дохода. Он строитель, в своем районе Хуросон помогает соседям строить дома и делать маленькие ремонты. Ахмадчон еще и планирует заняться ловом и продажей рыбы в будущем. Он имеет много планов и надеется преуспеть во всем. Но в данный момент Ахмадчон торопится к посеву майского урожая. Этот посев проводится в конце осени и собирается урожай в мае месяце. Так как в Таджикистане лето и осень длятся долгое время, и до декабря сохраняется теплая погода, у Ахмадчона есть шансы успеть реализовать посев. Но ему не хватает средств, чтобы купить семена пшеницы, топливо, минеральные удобрения и оплатить трактористу за обработку земли. Поэтому он обратился за кредитом и надеется на поддержку.
texts.en:
Ahmadjon is 36 years old. He is a peace-loving person with an open heart. Ahmadjon is a faithful husband and father of two children. His daughter is 15 years old, and his son is 10. They both go to school. His wife helps him in his activities.

Ahmadjon has a plot of land, where he plants vegetables and crops. Crop cultivation is not the only source of income. He is a builder; in his region he helps neighbors to build homes and to make small repairs. Ahmadjon plans also to engage in fishing and selling fish in the future.

He has many plans and hopes to succeed in them all. But at the moment Ahmadjon is in a hurry to plant the May crop. This planting happens at the end of fall and is harvested in May. Since in Tajikistan summer and autumn last a long time, and through December the warm weather lasts, Ahmadjon has a chance to realize a crop. But he does not have enough money to buy wheat seeds, fuel, mineral fertilizers and to pay a tractor driver to work the land. Therefore he applied for a loan and hopes for support.

loans.use: to buy wheat seeds and fuel, to pay for a tractor driver, and also to buy mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Mbagala Kuu Group

texts.en:
Regina, who is in her early 30s, is married with two kids; one is in school and the other is still a baby. For seven years now, Regina has been managing her family expenses by running a tailoring business where she sells and tailors clothes. Regina has got a clothes designing machine which is helpful to get extra orders. She starts working from 8.30 am and goes to 6.00 pm daily and is able to make a small profit per month. 

This will be her first loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. Regina will use this loan to improve her business by selling another type of clothes like Muslim-type dresses and fabrics. She dreams one day in future to have good business success so as to take out a bigger loan. 

She will share this loan with her loan group "MBAGALA KUU" which totals 16 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to improve her business by selling another type of clothes like Muslim-type dresses and fabrics.

loans.name: Maysara

texts.en:
Maysara is 41 years old. She is a hard-working woman. She has been busy with animal husbandry for more than two years. She sells cattle in the local market. She has been running her business for two years, and she has had many regular customers. 

She lives with her children in the house which was built with the great dedication of her husband. Her husband died some years ago. Her house is old, as it was built many years ago, and it needs some repairs. She does not have enough money to buy building materials and repair her house, as she is the only provider for her children. She is asking for a loan of 5000 somoni to buy building materials to repair her house. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy building materials to repair her house.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce  is married with one child, and her child doesn’t go to school.  She also takes care of an additional family member (her sister’s child). She has a business making jewelry.  

She has applied for a loan of 400,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more raw materials for making jewelry. She has been in this business for three years. She works in a shop six days out of every week, and sells to all categories of people on a retail basis.  Her major business challenges include transportation and lack of sufficient market. She aspires to owning a big factory making jewelry.   

She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees for her sister's child.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials for making jewelry.

loans.name: Irma

texts.en:
Irma, age 43, is from the village of Narazeni. She’s married with three daughters (20, 17 and 16 years old). Irma works as a cleaner at the local police office and public school. She gets monthly salaries there. Besides, Irma and her husband run a small-scale agricultural business and grow nuts on family-owned land.  They also breed one pig and sell piglets seasonally. 

Irma’s family lives in poverty, so they get a small monthly assistance from the local government. Irma’s daughter, Mariam, has recently graduated from hair stylist school and wishes to start working at the beauty salon. Unfortunately, the family is not able to buy needed accessories for Mariam. That is the reason why Irma is requesting the loan now. 

With the received amount, she will purchase hair salon equipment such as hair brushes, combs, hair clippers, scissors, a dryer and other supplies. Mariam will start working as a stylist and will generate income. The family will be able to get additional funds and improve their standard of living in future.

loans.use: to purchase hair salon equipment so her daughter can start working as a stylist

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita and her husband are farmers who live in Iraga with their children. They plant and harvest rice to sell and usually generate an income of about 10,000 PHP, which they use for daily meals and school fees for the children. 

Teresita would like to increase her crop production.  It is for this reason that she is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP.  She will use this loan to buy farm inputs such as insecticides and fertilizers.  

One day, she hopes to become a successful farmer and provide her family with a comfortable lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy insecticides and fertilizers.

loans.name: Shamsidin

texts.ru:
39 летнего фермера из района Хуросон зовут Шамсидин. В течение девяти лет он работает на грядке, сажает овощи и зерновые культуры на своем земельном участке. Ему помогает жена. А дети еще маленькие. Старший сын и дочь, которым по 8 и 10 лет, учатся в школе, а младшему сыну и дочери по 5 и 3 года. 
Шамсидин сейчас готовится к повторному посеву. Он уже начал собирать оставшийся урожай и хочет обработать землю и посеять пшеницу. Для реализации планов Шамсидин обратился за кредитом, чтобы купить минеральные удобрения, пшеничные зерна и топливо, а также оплатить трактоисту за вспашку земли. Шамсидин надеется и верит, что весной он соберет богатый урожай пшеницы и получит хорошую прибыль за свой труд.
texts.en:
This 39-year-old farmer from the Khuroson region is called Shamsidin. Over the course of nine years, he has been working in the garden, planting vegetables and crops on his own plot of land. His wife helps him. But the children are still small. His elder son and daughter, who are 8 and 10 years old, are students, and the younger son and daugher are 5 and 3.

Shamsidin is now prepareing for re-seeding. He already started to collect the remaining crop and wants to work the land and plant wheat. To realize his plans, Shamsidin applied for a loan to buy mineral fertilizers, wheat grains and fuel, and also to pay a tractor driver for tilling the land.

Shamsidin hopes and believes that in the spring he will have a rich harvest of wheat and will receive a good profit from his work.

loans.use: to purchase wheat grains, mineral fertilizers and a fuel-air mixture, and also for the payment of a tractor driver

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 39-year-old married father of two children, whom he works hard to provide with the best living.

Mohamad has worked in selling fresh chicken since 26 years ago. In June 2008, he opened his current business and he's working hard to develop it as much as he can.

Mohamad is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy a car locally known as Rapid, which will be used to transport his business goods from the market to his shop, instead of requesting help from others and paying extra charge for it.

Mohamad is well known in his region for the good quality of products provided and the competitive prices he sets. He hopes to keep on expanding his business and replying to customers' needs as much as he can.

loans.use: To buy a car specialized for transporting his goods

loans.name: Adel

texts.en:
Adel is a 59-year-old married father of five children. He has worked as a taxi driver since 1990. His business is his only source of income; that's why he works hard to develop it in a well managed way to keep it a good source of livelihood.

Adel has been an Al Majmoua borrower for four consecutive cycles; his previous loan was invested in renewing his current car to keep it in good condition to attract new customers.

His current acquired loan will be used in helping his son with his engagement expenses, which he will consider as his gift to his beloved son.

He is working hard to expand his business and hopes to buy a small bus which he will use in transporting students and customers from one place to another which will sure increase his income and develop his livelihood.

loans.use: To help his son with his engagement  expenses

loans.name: Aun

texts.en:
Aun is 39 years old.  She is married and resides with four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia.  

She has been selling fruit for more than five years, earning approximately $4 a day. Her husband runs a business, buying junk materials to resell.  He earns an income of $10 each day.  Two of her children are employed and they earn an income of $6 per day. 

To improve her husband’s business, Aun is requesting a loan of $1,200 in order to purchase more junk materials for resale.  By doing so, she would be able to generate more profit to financially support the family.  In the future, she would like to expand the business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees.  Moreover, she wants to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase junk materials for resale.

loans.name: Shoira

texts.ru: Шоира умная женщина с высшим образованием. Она более 10 лет предоставляет услуги портнихи, а также она уже несколько лет работает в государственной организации бухгалтером. Шоира замужем и имеет 2 детей. Она всегда старается для улучшения условия домохозяйства. Шоира всегда мечтала, чтобы ее дети жили в комфортабельном доме. Она имеет маленькую зарплату и это зарплата не хватает для того, чтобы сделать сбережения и отремонтировать дом. Шоира обратилась за займом в сумму 3000 долларов США для покупки строительных материалов, как цемент, древесина, краски и т.п. Она добродушная женщина и нуждается вашей финансовой поддержки. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Shoira is a clever woman with a higher education. For more than ten years, she has been offering services as a dressmaker, and also for several years has been working in a state institution as a bookkeeper.

Shoira is married and has two children. She always strives to improve the conditions of the household. Shoira always dreamed that her children would live in a comfortable house. She has a small salary and this pay is not enough to do savings and repair the house.

Shoira applied for a loan of US$3,000 to buy building materials, such as cement, wood, bricks and the like. She is a good-nature woman and needs financial support.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as cement, paint, and wood for home repairs

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is married with four children, and all her children go to school.   She doesn’t take care of additional family members. 

She has a business, a retail shop, and has been in this business for four years.  She has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, cooking oil, rice and beans.  She works in a shop, and works six days out of every week, selling on a retail basis.  Her major a business challenges include seasonality and ever increasing prices of commodities.  

She is aspiring to becoming a wholesaler, and also to educating her children up to university.  She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of it's being convenient for her. She resides in the family house, and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water.  Her monthly expenses include   school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more rice, cooking oil, beans, boxes of soap, cartons of salt and bags of sugar.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
This is Myrna. She previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase scrap materials needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would now like to apply for a 22,000 PHP loan. She will be incorporating the loan into her current revolving fund used to buy scrap and recyclable materials. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to cover her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Myrna dreams of having her own stall and hopes to have their own house. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, where she also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for recyclable materials needed in her business

loans.name: M. Irshad

texts.en:
M. Irshad is from the beautiful city of Pakistan. He is 30, and has a partner and four school-aged children, one of whom goes to primary school, and the other secondary school. He is a friendly, hard working, and honorable person. He owns a construction material shop in which he sales cement, brick, sand, concrete and provides sheltering services also.

Recently he purchased a lot of bricks and spent a great amount for it. He has been spending his savings for household expenses and now he does not have savings. He wants to buy other material such as cement and sand but he does not have funds. Therefore, M. Irshad requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that he could buy the remaining construction materials. M. Irshad thanks Kiva and their field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy building materials for resale.

loans.name: Yen's Group

texts.en:
Yen, 43, lives with her husband and five children in a rural village of the Ek Phnom district, Cambodia. She has five children, two of whom are still in school. To feed the family, Yen and her husband earn a living as farmers. They have been farming rice and sometimes she catches fish to supplement their income. She is able to earn about KHR 32,000 per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Yen has been with VisionFund for one cycle. She has used the loan to improve her family’s livelihood and keep her children in school. 

She is leading her group to apply for another loan with VisionFund. Yen is going to use her portion to buy more piglets for raising. She hopes to make more income, so as to make a living better and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy more piglets for raising.

loans.name: Temur

texts.en:
Temur is 37 years old, married with two children. He is an Internally Displaced Person and now lives in the town of Gori. The only income for the family is a small refugee pension that the family gets from the local government. The family lives in poverty and it’s hard for them to cover even costs for food. That is why Temur is requesting this loan now, to start up a business. He plans to purchase a secondhand car and serve the local people as a taxi driver.

 Temur hadn’t run any business since, but he hopes his initiative will be lucrative as there is high demand for taxi service on the market. Temur believes in his enthusiasm and wishes to improve the living standard for his family members.

loans.use: to purchase a secondhand car and start a taxi business

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina is 41 years old.  She lives in a small village in Tajikistan with her husband and two children. 
 
The only source of income for the family is from animal husbandry.  She feeds cattle for two or three months and then sells them in the local market.  It is hardly enough to provide food for the family. 

She wants to repair her house as her house is in bad condition.  She must repair all rooms of her house.  She lives in a mountainous region and that is why the weather is so cold during the winter period.  She must finish repairing the house for the winter.  She is asking for a loan of 1,500 USD to buy building materials such as cement, wood and nails.  She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as cement, wood and nails.

loans.name: Roselle

texts.en:
This is Roselle.  She is 29 years old and a resident of Cabrera, Pasay, Philippines.  She is a widow.  Her husband died just two years ago.  She has a child who attends elementary school.  At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses. 

Roselle operates a food stall.  She sells snacks like burgers, siomai (traditional Chinese dumplings served in dim sum) and fish balls (well-seasoned balls of ground fish and eggs and crushed crumbs simmered in fish stock). These are common snacks in the Philippines.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP. She will be utilizing the loan to buy burgers, siomai and fish balls.

Roselle dreams to expand her business and hopes to give her child a good future. She meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners and/or clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis.  A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners.  The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy fish balls, siomai and burgers needed in her food stall.

loans.name: Ren

texts.en:
Ren is a citizen from a rural area located in Kampong Cham Province’s Ponhea Krek District. Ren is a 43-year-old married mother of two children, both of whom are dependent on her and still in school. She has been selling grocery items, while her husband is a paid construction worker. The current business earns about KHR 34,000 per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Ren is just with VisionFund this cycle. She is asking for an education loan to pay for her daughter’s university tuition fee. Her daughter is majoring in English Literature. This loan will enable her to send her daughter to university and to keep her there. 

Ren hopes that her daughter will have a good and bright future from these academic studies and will earn a better living in the future.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter’s university tuition fee.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Loun's Group

texts.en:
Loun is aged 50 and widowed. She has four children. Living in a village of the Sangke district, Loun has been farming rice and raising pigs for 15 years. She is able to earn about 47,000 KHR per day to support her family’s need. 

This is the sixth loan for Loun with VisionFund. She completely repaid the past five loans, which have enabled her family to support her family. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to by pig feed and piglets for raising. She hopes to fatten her pigs so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and piglets for raising

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Emprendedoras, está en su primer ciclo, con muchas ansias de superación y de poder capacitarse para poder crecer y ayudar a sus familias.
Una persona destacada es la Sra. Eulalia, quien se dedica a la venta de ropas interiores, ella es una persona que tiene muchas ansias de poder crecer y dar a su familia todo lo que desean. Quiere salir adelante y es por eso que está esforzándose, pide de este crédito, ya que quiere poder comprar más ropas interiores y de esa forma seguir invirtiendo en su trabajo.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Emprendedoras communal bank is in its first cycle.  They have a great desire for self-improvement and to be able to train in order to be able to grow and help their families.

One notable person is Eulalia.  She sells underwear.  She is a person with a lot of desire to be able to grow and to give her family everything that they wish.  She wants to get ahead.  That is why she is putting forth great effort.  

She is requesting this loan because she wants to be able to buy more underwear.  This way she will continue investing in her work.

loans.use: to buy underwear to sell.

loans.name: 8 De Diciembre Group

texts.es:
Este grupo está en su ciclo número 16º  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y las aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa.
Una persona que trabaja y se esta esforzando por mejorar su vida es la Sra. Maria quien es la  Tesorera del grupo, y ella se dedica a la venta de comidas, ella misma maneja su negocio, por lo tanto el crédito que pide es para la compra de insumos para la elaboración de sus empanadas, Sándwiches, comidas en general, como ser carne, verduras, condimentos y demás, y así seguir trabajando por mejorar su vida y la de sus familiares.
texts.en:
This group is in its 16th cycle with the women’s committee program.  All of them work and help each other get ahead through effort, continual work, and by applying the vital habits of a successful woman.  

One person who is working and putting forth effort to improve her life is Maria, the treasurer of the group.  She sells food.  She manages her business herself.  Therefore, the loan she is requesting is to buy supplies to make her food like empanadas and sandwiches.  She will buy things like meat, vegetables, condiments, and more.  This way she will continue working to improve her life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, condiments, and more.

loans.name: Umeda

texts.en:
A wonderful woman by the name of Umeda lives in a house that is in bad condition. Her husband is a kind man who has a very small salary. They have four clever children. Her children want to live in the house that is in good condition but her income from fabrics sales is not enough for it. She must repair the roof of her house first and then repair all the rooms. She is asking for a loan of 7,500 Tajikistani somoni (TJS) to buy building materials to repair her house. 

In this way, she will be able to offer her family a better quality of life and moral stability that will allow them to progress. She awaits your support and mercy.

loans.use: To buy building materials to repair her house.

loans.name: Primavera Group

texts.es:
Primavera es un grupo formado por mujeres que quieren ir mejorando sus vidas, están en el primer ciclo, con muchas expectativas. Son de la ciudad de Santaní, de una zona bastante rural, y aun en crecimiento, que con el esfuerzo de estas señoras quieren ayudar a que crezca.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Romoalda, quien es una persona muy sacrificada, que día a día está trabajando por mejorar su vida y la de su familia, se está dedicando a la costura y con ello está ayudando a sus seres queridos. Pide de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas e hilos con lo cual podrá seguir con su trabajo y cumpliendo con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Primavera" is a group of women who want to improve their lives. They are in their first loan cycle and have hopes for great things to come.  They are from a fairly rural but growing area near the city of Santaní.  These women hope to contribute to the growth of their community through their efforts.

One of the members is Romoalda, a person who makes great sacrifices.  Day after day she is working to improve her family's quality of life.  She makes her living by sewing, and through this activity she is helping her loved ones.  She is seeking this loan so that she will be able to invest in thread and cloth, and thus be able to continue in her business and meet the demand of her customers.

loans.use: to buy cloth and thread.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Hacia El Futuro Group

texts.es: Abigail es integrante de Banco Mujer Hacia el Futuro, una mujer muy joven, con muchas aspiraciones y ganas de superarse, tiene 21 años y es soltera, vive con su madre, y es comerciante. Desde hace varios años tuvo la necesidad de ayudar a su mamá y hermanos a salir adelante, y fue cuando inicio su pequeño negocio, ella vende ropa para damas de manera ambulante en su comunidad y otras aledañas. Además Abigail estudia por las noches y está sacando su bachillerato por madurez. Este es el tercer crédito que solicita, y lo va a invertir en la compra de ropa para vender en esta temporada alta que se aproxima. Los créditos anteriores le permitieron consolidar su negocio y aumentar su cartera de clientes ya que tenía mas mercadería para ofrecer. Sus metas a futuro es tener una pequeña tienda y concluir sus estudios de secundaria y poder asistir a una universidad. Junto a ella integran el grupo 9 socias más que van a invertir en actividades comerciales y agropecuarias.
texts.en:
Abigail is a member of the Banco Mujer Hacia el Futuro.  She is a very young woman with great aspirations and a desire for self-improvement.  She is 21 years old and single.  She lives with her mother, and she is a merchant.  

Several years ago she needed to help her mother and siblings to get ahead.  That is when she started her small business.  She sells women’s clothing in an itinerant manner in her community and outlying areas.

Also, Abigail studies in the evenings, and she is getting her high school degree for older students.

This is the third loan that she is requesting.  She will use it to buy clothes to sell during this coming high season.  The previous loans allowed her to consolidate her business and increase her customer base because she had more merchandise to offer.

Her goals for the future are to have a small store, to complete high school, and to be able to attend the university.

Nine other members join her in the group, and they are going to invest in their commercial and agricultural business activities.

loans.use: to buy women's clothes.

loans.name: Sonja

texts.en:
Sonja is 40 years old, married, and a mother of two boys. Sonja works as a nurse in a clinic in her area. She lives in a minority community. Her husband only receives a social pension. The money they are generating monthly is barely enough to cover their daily expanses. 

As Sonja drives to work daily, her vehicle, which is old, is in need of a new engine, and she would like to replace it. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 500 EUR in order to address this issue and be able to purchase wood to use for heating this winter. 

This loan will help her be able to decrease the utility costs in the cold winter and avoid the expenses of taxi fees to get to work. Sonja sees this loan as a necessity in order to maintain her budget and keep her family comfortable and provided for. She hopes in the future to save money and offer a better life to her family.

loans.use: to change her vehicle's engine and purchase wood to use for heating this winter.

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en:
Mom, 21, is married and lives with her husband and one daughter in a village at Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She and her husband are rice farmers. She is able to earn about 30,000 KHR per day to feed her family. 

Mom is just with VisionFund this cycle. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to increase her crop yields and earn more income to better off her family’s living condition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Phearak

texts.en:
Phearak is 30 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Takeo province, Cambodia. She has been selling bun cakes for more than two years, earning approximately $10 per day. Her husband, who is joining her in the picture with her daughter, helps her run the business.

To improve her business, Phearak is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase materials to use for producing bun cakes to sell. By doing so, she would be able to get high profit margin. In the future, she would like to expand her business and send her children to a good school. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase materials for producing bun cakes to sell.

loans.name: Noern's Group

texts.en:
Age 43 years old, Noern is a married father of five children living in a rural village in the Moung Russey district, Cambodia. To support his family, Noern has been farming rice for ten years. The current business earns him about 74,000 KHR per day.
 
Noern is just with VisionFund this cycle. Now he is leading his group to apply for a loan. As the leader, Noern is going to use his portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for his farmland. He hopes to increase his crop yields and sell it for a good price to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for his farmland.

loans.name: Moises

texts.es: El señor Moisés es una persona trabajadora y responsable, vive en concubinato y tiene 4 hijos que están cursando el nivel secundario, a los cuales mantiene y ayuda en sus estudios con los ingresos provenientes de su trabajo como agricultor, pero los mismos son insuficientes para subsistir y cubrir todos los gastos, por lo que el señor Moisés requiere un crédito para mejorar  y ampliar sus plantaciones de cítricos y de esta forma otorgar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Señor Moisés is a hardworking responsible person. He and his partner have four children who attend secondary school. With his income as a farmer he supports his children and helps them with their educational expenses. However, the money he earns is not sufficient to subsist and cover all his expenses so he needs a loan  to improve and expand his citrus fruit fields. In this way he hopes to provide his family with a better standard of living.

loans.use: Improve and expand his citrus fields

loans.name: Javier

texts.es: El señor Javier vive en la población de chancadora, barrio villa Jordán, es soltero y se dedica a la elaboración de pan, en la casa que le dejaron sus padres como herencia al fallecer, actualmente tiene mucha clientela y el ambiente para la elaboración de pan quedo pequeño para todos los implementos que utiliza, por ello quiere ampliar su negocio y construir un cuarto adicional para el cual requiere un crédito de bs 10200 con el fin de cumplir sus objetivos propuestos.
texts.en: Señor Javier lives in the community of Chancadora in the Villa Jordán neighbourhood. He is single and earns his living as a baker in the house that his parents left him when they died. He now has many customers so the place where he bakes bread is no longer big enough to house all the tools he uses. For this reason he wishes to expand his business and build an additional room. Javier needs a loan of bs 10200 to achieve this objective.

loans.use: Expand his business

loans.name: Betty Nancy

texts.es: La señora Betty de 53 años de edad, se encuentra casada y sus hijos ya son adultos así que no dependen de sus ingresos, cuenta con un grado de instrucción de nivel primario pero tiene muchas ganas de superarse y salir adelante, se dedica a la producción de leche en su propia casa, y cuenta con 38 años de experiencia en el rubro, actualmente quiere adquirir cabezas de ganado lechero para incrementar su producción por lo que solicita un crédito de Bs. 10000.
texts.en: Betty is 53 years old and is married.  Her children are now adults and do not depend on their parents' income.  Betty completed primary school and now really wants to do better for herself and prosper. Betty works producing milk in her own home.  She has 38 years experience in this work. She now wants to buy more dairy cows in order to increase production.  To do this, Betty is applying for a loan of 10,000 Bolivianos.

loans.use: to buy diary cows in order to increase production.

loans.name: Dragana

texts.en:
Dragana is 38 years old and married with a 3-year-old son. She lives in one of the minority communities in Kosovo. She is a housewife, while her husband is working for the electric company with a very low salary.

Dragana has often tried to save money and plan ahead for the increasing costs that come with winter time, such as increases in electric bills and the necessity to purchase wood for heating, but she been unable to do so with only her husband’s income. 

Now Dragana is requesting a loan so she can purchase wood and coal in advance to prepare for the winter. Her goal is to find a job in a near future. She promises that she will pay her loan installments punctually. She wants to thank all of the lenders for their help.

loans.use: to purchase wood and coal in advance to prepare for the winter.

loans.name: Aun

texts.en:
Aun, pictured with her husband, is 46 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been selling cakes for more than ten years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband is a carpenter who makes an income of $4 each day. Two of her children are employed. They earn about $5 daily. 

To improve her husband’s business, Aun is requesting a loan of $1,300 to purchase more carpentry tools to use in his business. This money will help him obtain enough tools to use and produce furniture faster. 

In the future, she would like to expand the business and help her youngest child earn higher education. Moreover, she wants to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase more carpentry tools for her husband to use in his business.

loans.name: Sitha

texts.en:
Sitha is 34 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been working in garment factory for more than three years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband raises poultry. He makes an income of $5 daily. 

To improve her family’s finances, Sitha is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase more poultry to breed. By doing so, she would be able generate more income for the family. In the future, she would like to expand her poultry farm and help her children have higher education.

loans.use: to purchase more poultry to breed

loans.name: Nozigul

texts.ru: Нозигул молодая и целеустремленная женщина. Она родилась в 1991 года. Нозигул не замужем и живет с родителями и сестрой. Она уже в течении 4 лет занимается предоставлением услуги портнихи. Нозигул научилась шитью женской одежды у своей сестры. Ее сестра помогает ей введению бизнеса. Нозигул начала шить одежды на машинки своей матери. Постепенно после того как она начала зарабатывать деньги, она купила 2 швейных машинок. Она имеет своих постоянных клиентов. Нозигул хочет купить машинку для вышивки. Таким образом, она может привлечь больше клиентов. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 сомони для покупки вышивальной машинки. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Nozigul is a young and ambitious woman. She was born in 1991. Nozigul is not married and lives with her parents and sister. She has 4 years of experience as a seamstress. Nozigul learned to sew women's clothes from her sister. Her sister helped her to start her business. Nozigul began to sew clothes with her mother's sewing machine. Gradually, after she started to earn money, she purchased two sewing machines. Now, she has her own regular customers. Nozigul wants to buy an embroidery machine. With it, she would be able to attract more customers. She has requested a loan of 1000 Somoni to buy an embroidery machine. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy an embroidery machine for her sewing business

loans.name: Mamagul

texts.ru: Мамагул трудолюбивая женщина. Она родилась в 1977 года. Мамагул разведена и не имеет детей. Мамагул в 2007 году окончила Медицинский колледж. После окончания колледжа она поступила на работу в больницу. Мамагул имеет 6 лет стаж работы. Она имеет маленькую зарплату и это зарплата не хватает для проживания. Она хочет организовать бизнес скотоводством. Она будет откармливать скот дома, так как она имеет возможность дома. Мамагул запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки скота. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Mamagul is a hardworking woman. She was born in 1977. Mamagul is divorced and has no children. Mamagul graduated from the College of Medicine in 2007. After college, she went to work at a hospital. Mamagul has 6 years of experience. She has a small salary and the salary is not enough to live on. She wants to organize a livestock business. She will fatten the cattle at home, as she has ability to house the cattle at home. Mamagul has requested a loan of 5000 TJS for the purchase of cattle. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy cattle for organizing a new business

loans.name: Davlatmoh

texts.ru: Давлатмох родилась в 1971 года. Она разведена и имеет 2 детей. Она вместе со своими детьми живет на юге Таджикистана. Она не имеет высшее образование и не имеет никакого ремесла. Она работает уборщицей. Давлатмох работает уборщицей в 4 магазинах, где продают строительные материалы. Давлатмох является основной кормилицей семьи, так как ее дети не имеют постоянное место работы. Ее сын хочет уехать в Российскую Федерацию. Давлатмох запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 сомони для покупки авиабилета для своего сына. Этот займ поможет сыну Давлатмох найти работу, улучшить условию проживания и найти свой путь в жизни. Давлатмох и ее сын ждут вашу доброту.
texts.en: Davlatmoh was born in 1971. She is divorced and has two children. She and her children live in southern Tajikistan. She has no college degree and does not know a trade. She works as a cleaner. Davlatmoh works as a cleaner at 4 stores that sell building materials. Davlatmoh is the main breadwinner of the family, as her children do not yet have a permanent jobs. Her son wants to go to Russia. Davlatmoh has requested a loan of 1000 TJS to buy a flight ticket for his son. This loan will help her Davlatmoh's son find a job, improve his living conditions and to find his path in life. Davlatmoh and her son await your kindness .

loans.use: To buy an air ticket for her son to Russia

loans.name: Ariel Antonio

texts.es:
Ariel de 29 años de edad, casado con un hijo menor de edad, originario de Leon, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Se caracteriza por ser responsable y trabajador, con superación personal. Él desde muy temprano se levanta a  preparar la venta de todos días, con optimista y entusiasmo, actividad que la desempeña con mucho gusto porque es el sustento de su familia. Dentro de sus carencias económicas lucha día a día para brindarle un futuro mejor a su pequeño hijo.

Gracia a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de productos lácteos como leche, crema cuajada de forma ambulante y en su casa de habitación. El dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos. el objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos lácteos, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Ariel agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Ariel is 29 years old, married, and has a son.  He is originally from Leon, in the west of the country.  Ariel is responsible and hard-working and wants to do better. Ariel wakes up very early every day in order to prepare his sales.  He works optimistically and enthusiastically, and likes his work as, with it, he supports his family.  Ariel is fighting every day in order to earn the money to provide his young son with a better future.

Thanks to his efforts and his desire to get ahead, Ariel works selling dairy products such as milk and curd.  He is a street vendor and also sells from his home.  Ariel works around 12 hours per day, selling his products.  This loan will be used to invest in working capital and to stock up his business by buying dairy products so that, in the not-too-distant future, he can earn a higher income.  Ariel is grateful to Kiva lenders for supporting poor countries such as Nicaragua and for the help they provide to people with little money, so that they can have a decent job.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock up his business of buying and selling dairy products such as milk and curd.

loans.name: Oscar Armando

texts.es:
Oscar, tiene 40 años, vive en casa propia, él se dedica a cultivar granos básicos para generar los ingresos necesarios para los gastos del hogar, aprendió el oficio de su padre, desde hace  25 años se dedica a trabajar propio, ha optado por un crédito para poder invertir en insumos agrícolas comprara fertilizantes, abono, plaguicidas y semillas. Le servirá para ampliar más su negocio y  aumentar  los ingresos.
Anhela tener un negocio más amplio para mejorar su economía, producir granos de calidad, tener más clientes y cancelar el crédito.
texts.en:
Oscar is 40 years old and lives in his own house.  He works growing basic grains in order to generate the necessary income to cover household costs.  Oscar learned this trade from his father and has now been doing this work for 25 years.  Oscar has chosen to apply for a loan in order to invest in agricultural supplies, such as fertilisers, manure, anti-plague treatments, and seeds.  The loan will help Oscar to increase business and his income.

Oscar really wants a bigger business so as to improve his finances.  He wants to produce good quality grains, have more customers, and to pay off his debt.

loans.use: to buy fertilisers, manure, anti-plague treatments, and seeds.

loans.name: Carlota Eneyda

texts.es:
Carlota, ha decidido invertir en su tienda efectuará la compra de churros, sodas, dulces, lácteos  y granos básicos para mejorar e incrementar sus ingresos, mantener satisfechos a su clientes, atraer a nuevos a más clientes. Con el crédito anterior ella surtió su tienda, mantuvo la fidelidad de sus clientes, su economía mejoro. 
Se encuentra saludable y con muchos ánimos de seguir trabajando en su negocio, le satisface tener una economía que le permita cumplir con sus compromisos familiares.
texts.en:
Carlota has decided to invest in her shop by buying churros, fizzy drinks, sweets, dairy products, and basic grains so as to increase her income, keep her customers satisfied and to attract new customers.  Carlota used her previous loan to stock up her shop.  Her customers remained loyal and her financial situation improved.

Carlota is in good health and wants to continue with her business. She is satisfied knowing that she has the finances to be able to fulfil her family duties.

loans.use: to buy churros, fizzy drinks, sweets, dairy products, and basic grains.

loans.name: Jenneh

texts.en:
Jenneh lives and works in St. Paul. St. Paul is home to the oldest market in Liberia and is known for its fish, due to its location by the sea. St. Paul is a suburb located just outside Monrovia, past the Free-port. It is one of the poorer areas, and you will often find its residents living in sub-standard housing. 

Jenneh is 32 years old and married with two children, 8 and 14 years old. Both live at home and attend school. Jennah completed twelve grades. She runs a shop business selling used clothes. She describes herself as a serious business woman. She started her business seven years ago, using money given to her by her husband. 

Typically, she works from 7:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. from Monday to Saturday at her business. She transports her goods to her business by bus. She cites her greatest challenge as a small amount of capital. She is proud of her business because it supports her home.

Using the proceeds of this loan, she intends to purchase more used clothes for her business. In the future, she plans to build her house and educate her children. She sincerely thanks you in advance for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Jaliya

texts.en:
Jaliya has now identified goats at a low price that she wants to stock and sell during the festive season at a higher price. She is optimistic that she will make enough profits from the goats and therefore repay her loan well. 

Jaliya is thankful to Kiva lenders for the support they gave her the previous cycle. She was able to stock clothes that she sold at a profit.

loans.use: To buy goats

loans.name: Rabih

texts.en:
Rabih is a 46-year-old married father of two children. He works as a school bus driver, known for his patience and cautiousness in treating the students.

He has a big responsibility in his business, since he has to make sure that everything is going well with his bus and his health at the same time, because most parents rely on him for their children's safety.

Rabih is optimistic and he works hard to meet his children's needs.

He is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to pay for his children's school fees and materials, which is his main aim. This is his third loan cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower, with a good repayment history.

Rabih is still planning to buy another bus to expand his working zone and increase his income, but he'll wait to a suitable time when he finds himself financially capable of taking this step forward.

loans.use: To pay his children's school fees

loans.name: Liysem

texts.en:
Liysem is 40 years old. She is widowed and lives with four children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a massage parlor for more than two years, earning approximately $8 daily. One of her children who works in a nail salon earns about $3 each day. 

Due to difficulty with her family’s transportation, Liysem is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase will help her reduce transportation expenses. In the future, she would like to run food store at home and help her children earn bachelor’s degree. Moreover, she wants to build a new bigger house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: La Banda Group

texts.es: El Banco de Emprendimiento LA BANDA está compuesto por ocho integrantes seis mujeres y dos varones que se dedican a distintas actividades, la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Juana tiene 28 años, casada con tres hijos, ella se dedica a la elaboración y  venta de empanadas, desde hace ya bastante tiempo en esta  ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos como harina,  huevo y azúcar para la elaboración de empanadas, la Sra. Juana es una cliente responsable quien trabaja con la institucion desde hace tiempo, la Sra. Juana va a utilizar los beneficios para mejorar su calidad de vida y la  de su familia, su deseo es crecer en su negocio para así generar más ingresos ya que este es la única  actividad que le permite mantenerse y mantener a su familia, la Sra. Juana se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
The “La Banda” communal bank consists of 8 members; six women and two men.  They are in a variety of lines of work.  

Juana, 28, is married with three children and works making and selling turnovers.  She’s been in this occupation for quite some time now.  On this occasion she’s asking for the loan to buy supplies like flour, eggs and sugar to make the turnovers.

Juana’s a responsible client who has worked with the institution for some time now.  Juana will use profits to improve her and her family’s quality of life.  Her wish is to grow in business to generate higher income since this is the only activity that makes it possible for her to support herself and her family.  Juana feels happy and grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Concepción

texts.es:
Concepción de 43 años,  es madre de 3  hijos; dos hembras y un barón. Concepción hasta ahora, está aprendiendo a leer, por medio de un programa de alfabetización,  está muy alegre porque ya puede firmar. 

Comenta que se decidió, a estudiar porque la ignoraron cuando en un banco,  pidió de favor le regalaran una firma, para retirar una remesa. Es una mujer que lucha siembre y no se da por vencida, los obstáculos, para ella son oportunidades en la vida.  De ella solo depende 1 hija, su esposo murió hace 20 años.

Tiene experiencia desde hace 20 años en la agricultura  y la adquirió cuando murió su difunto esposo, en un accidente de tránsito, ella quedo muy sola y empezó a trabajar muy fuerte,  cultivando  maíz, frijol y compraba cerdos para engordarlos y venderlos.  

Con el crédito comprara alimentación para los cerdos que ya tiene, que son 4 cerdas parenderas, y el resto lo invertirá  para reparar el chiquero de los mismos, porque por el momento los tiene amarados con lazo, porque se salen del toril donde estaban. La necesidad que será satisfecha, es que si no se le da el crédito, tendría que vender dos cerdas. Para mantener a las otras dos restantes.   

Comenta, que mientras Dios le de vida, ella seguirá luchando para alcanzar los sueños que tiene. Que es tener las 4 cerdas paridas. También ella desea ver a sus nietos solteros y preparados académicamente y con las ventas de los cerdos ella ira ahorrando para pagar el crédito y lo que le sobre tener la alimentación diaria.
texts.en:
Concepción is 43 years old, married and the mother of 3 children, 2 female and one boy.

Concepción today is learning how to read through a literacy program and is very pleased as now she can sign her name. She comments that she decided to study when a bank asked her to sign a form to release a remittance and then ignored her when she couldn't.

She is a woman who is always struggling and doesn't give up when she comes to an obstacle. For her they are opportunities offered to her life. Her husband died 20 years ago and one of her daughters is dependent on her. She has 20 years of experience in farming, which she had to learn when her husband was killed in an automobile accident. She was left alone and had to work very hard planting corn and beans and buying pigs to fatten and sell. 

Concepción will use the loan to buy concentrated feed for the 4 pregnant sows she now has. The rest she will invest in repairing the pigpen as she now has two of the pigs tied to stakes. They can escape the pen they are kept in. She needs to do this. If she can't get the loan she will have to sell two of the pigs in order to keep the other two.

She comments that as long as God gives her life, she will continue to fight to achieve the goals that she has, which is to see her sows give birth. Also she wants to see her single grandchildren properly educated. And with the sales of her pigs she will save to pay off the loan and moreover to pay for her daily food.

loans.use: to buy concentrated feed for her pigs and also to repair her pigpen.

loans.name: Ma-Water

texts.en: Ma-water lives in West Point, which has one of the busiest and well-known markets in Montserrado County. She is 50 years old, married and has four children between the ages of 19 and 31. Only one lives at home and attends school. For 10 years, she has been running a shop where she sells cold water, soft drinks, charcoal, beer, etc. A problem she faces is that in the rainy season, business is poor. She enjoys the interaction she has with her customers and the profit she makes. Providing food for her family makes her proud. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cold water, soft drinks, charcoal, beer, etc. for her business. Her dream is to own a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more cold water, soft drinks, charcoal, beer, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Dilfuza

texts.ru: Дилфузе 41 год, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывает 2 детей. С 2000 года Дилфуза начала заниматься торговлей женской и мужской одежды, стартовав с суммой в 50,000 сом (KGS), Дилфуза сумела развить свой бизнес с ежемесячным доходом в сумме около 20,000 сом (KGS). В целях расширения ассортимента товаров, Дилфуза обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS). Дилфуза планирует вложить доходы от бизнеса в дальнейшее увеличение ассортимента товара, а также в будущем хочет построить дом.
texts.en: Dilfuza is 41 years old, married, and, along with her spouse, raising two children. In 2000, Dilfuza began to sell women's and men's clothing. Starting with a sum of 50,000 som (KGS), Dilfuza was able to develop her business and now has a monthly income of about 20,000 som (KGS). In order to expand her product range, Dilfuza has asked the Microfinance Bank "Bai - Tushum and Partners" for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS).
