Dilfuza plans to invest the proceeds from the business towards further increasing the range of goods. In the future, she hopes to build a house.

loans.use: to buy wholesale men's and women's clothing to sell retail

loans.name: Reang

texts.en:
Reang is a citizen from a rural area located in Svay Reang Province’s Svay Chrom District, where crop farming is a common business to make a living. He is married and is the 60-year-old father of eight children, two of whom are still in school. To feed his household, he earns a living through farming rice and raising pigs. Having been in this business for 33 years, he is able to earn about US $9 per day to support his family.

Reang, who has never been with VisionFund before, is seeking his first loan. He is going to use this loan to pay the tuition fees for the four years of his son’s bachelor’s degree. This loan will enable him to send his son to university and to keep him there.

loans.use: to pay for his son’s education.

location.town: Svay Reang Province, Svay Chrom District

loans.name: Lorm

texts.en:
Living in a thatched roof house in a rural village of the Cheung Prey district of Kampong Cham province, Lorm is aged 52 years old and married. She and her husband earn a living through farming rice and they have been in this business for almost 33 years. With her current business, she is able to earn approximately 52,000 KHR per day to support her family.

Lorm, who has never been with VisionFund before, is seeking her first loan. She is going to use this loan for her children's education, by paying the tuition fees for the four years of her son’s bachelor degree majoring in Management. This loan will enable her to send her son to university and to keep him there. Lorm hopes that her children will have a good and bright future from these academic studies and earn a better living in the future.

loans.use: to pay the tuition fees for the four years of her son’s bachelor degree

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina lives and works in St. Paul.  St. Paul is home to the oldest market in Liberia and is known for its fish, due to its location by the sea.  St. Paul is a suburb located just outside Monrovia, past Freeport.  It is one of the poorer areas and you will often find its residents living in sub-standard housing. 

Regina is 42 years old, divorced, and has two children aged 26 and 28, who live on their own. For the past ten years she has been operating a small table market where she sells bitter ball (vegetable), peppers, onions, Vita (juice drink), and many other items. She started this business by selling dried fish in her community with the limited stock she could afford and she  learned this way of selling from her friends.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more bitter ball, peppers, onions, Vita, and many other items for her business. Her plan is to expand her business even more.

loans.use: to purchase more bitter ball (vegetables), peppers, onions, Vita (juice drink), and many other items for her business,

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Juan, es casado y vive con su esposa y sus hijos de diferentes edades y el ha decidido por optar un nuevo crédito para comprar insumos de agricultura (abono, fertilizantes, ect) y asi incrementar sus ingresos en el hogar y en el negocio.
El sueño es ampliar su negocio para incrementar sus ingresos y asi poder darles un estilo de vida diferente a su familia.
texts.en: Juan is married and lives with his wife and their children of various ages.  He has decided to request a new loan to buy agricultural supplies (manure, fertilizer, etc.) and thereby increase his income for his household and his business.  His dream is to expand his business to increase his income and be able to give his family a different lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Carlos Emilio

texts.es:
Carlos de 33 años,  es una persona que solo estudio hasta noveno grado, es casado, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y han procreado dos hijos.

Carlos se levanta a las 4:00 a.m. Junto a su esposa e hijos que asisten a la escuela. él se dedica a la agricultura, oficio que aprendió de sus padres; para llegar a la parcelas camina 1 Km.  y trabaja durante toda la mañana, mientras  su esposa durante la mañana ordeña y se dedica a  vender la leche y luego en el transcurso de la tarde el cuida los animales en los potreros que alquila.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar una vaca lechera y producir mas leche para la venta. Carlos planea comprar mas vacas, para producir lácteos como queso, crema, quesillo, etc y así poder incrementar más sus ingresos y darles una vida digna a su familia.
texts.en:
Carlos, age 33, only went to school until the ninth grade.  He is married.  His wife devotes herself to the domestic chores, and they have two children.

Carlos gets up at 4:00 a.m. together with his wife and children, who go to school.  He works in agriculture, a trade he learned from his parents.  In order to get to his land, he walks one kilometer, and he works during the entire morning.  He does this while his wife milks in the morning and sells the milk.  Then, when he returns in the afternoon, he takes care of the animals in the pastures that he rents.

The loan that he is requesting from the Fundación Campo is to buy a dairy cow and to produce more milk to sell.  Carlos plans on buying more cows in order to produce dairy products like cheese, cream, and string cheese, etc.  This way he will be able to increase his income and give his family a decent life.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow and to produce more milk to sell.

loans.name: Abrahan

texts.en:
Abrahan dreams of becoming a computer engineer but, without a degree, knows it may never be possible. Abrahan is currently attending the Universidad Juan Misael Saracho working towards his degree in computer engineering. He plans on graduating in April 2014, but he fears that he will need to defer his graduation without a loan from Vittana.

With this loan, Abrahan plans on purchasing his much needed textbooks and school supplies. With the proper books, Abrahan feels he will be able to study more effectively and earn better grades. In addition to his responsibilities at school, Abrahan currently works 30 hours a week as a computer technician to help cover his school and living expenses. With a career in computer engineering, he expects to earn $32 a day. 

Unfortunately, Abrahan's parents never had the opportunity to complete their high school education. Without the opportunity for a higher degree, his parents never had the chance to move up. Abrahan's father works as a driver and his salary is the family's primary source of income. Growing up, finances have always been tight. With three other siblings, Abrahan is unsure how he will be able to finance his education without help. Abrahan hopes to be able to contribute towards his family's income in the near future.

loans.use: to pay for books and school supplies

loans.name: Nieve

texts.en:
In the Dominican Republic, where Nieve moved from to the States eight years ago, she sold wholesale jewelry and handbags. After moving to New Jersey, she gained extensive sales experience working with Amway. 

Though Nieve may not have had a formal education, her skills and passion for business (as well as the urging of her family) led Nieve to open her own enterprise. She decided to sell wholesale beauty supplies to salons in the New Jersey area. Nieve already has a network of clients established, with several family members who own beauty salons. 

Nieve’s business offers a wide range of affordable products, such as hair dyes and shampoos, and convenient delivery for busy establishments. She has low operating costs, without needing a storefront and or having to pay rent expenses. Nieve’s clients have assurance in what they are buying, and are able to call or fax orders easily, which makes her service especially appealing.

As a mother of three boys, Nieve wants to set an example of empowerment for her children. They are all going to school and are each entrepreneurial in their own way—one makes T-shirts and the youngest, 15 years old, fixes bicycles to earn money.

In the future, Nieve would like to develop new beauty products, including specialty skin oils, but she would like to conduct market research and evaluate consumer needs first. The funds from this loan will be used to register Nieve’s business as a sole proprietorship and to help establish her wholesale start-up.

loans.use: To cover registration expenses for her wholesale start-up business

loans.name: Nyakariro Central Group

texts.en:
Aidah, aged 46, lives in a rural village in Nyakariro, Rukungiri District, and has four children, all of whom are dependents and still go to school. She and her husband are extensive, and sometimes she works for others for a fee. She has been in this business for over four years. The current business earns about UGX 40,000 per day to support her family.

This is a micro-business loan for Aidah's group, Nyakariro Central Group of ten members who are all predominantly farmers and small business people,  including both men and women. UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI) financial services have helped Aidah relieve her financial burden and improve her livelihood. Now requesting a loan, Aidah, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy more goats for fattening and then sell them at a higher price to earn some profit. She hopes this loan will help increase her business capital so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy goats

loans.name: Soknim's Group

texts.en:
Soknim, 36, lives in a rural area of the Tbaung Khmom district of Kampong Cham province, and she is married with three children, who are all still in school. The family’s main sources of income are from farming rice on one hectare of farmland and working for others for a fee in the local village. She has been in this business for over ten years. 

Soknim is just with VisionFund for this cycle. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to make more income so as to make a living better and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Mab

texts.en:
Mab is 43 years old and a rural villager, residing in Svay Chrom district of Svay Reang Province. He has two children. To overcome the daily financial burden in the family, he has been farming rice, raising pigs, and selling toys. Having been in this business for 26 years, he is able to earn about $33 per day, but he can save about $10 each day after expenses. 

This is the first microloan for Mab with VisionFund. Now he is requesting an education loan to pay his daughter’s university tuition fee. He hopes that this loan will provide financial support for his daughter, so she can focus on her studying and obtain a good job after graduation.

loans.use: to pay his daughter’s university tuition fee

location.town: Svay Reang Province, Svay Chrom District

loans.name: Amadeo De Jesús

texts.es:
Amadeo  de 63 años, es una persona que solo estudio hasta noveno grado y es  casado, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos. Ellos procrearon dos hijos, actualmente Amadeo, vive con sus esposa y dos nietos.
 
Se levanta a las 4:00 a.m. Junto a su esposa y nietos que van a la escuela,  quienes dependen de las actividades que él realiza. Él se dedica a la agricultura, oficio que aprendió de sus padres,  para llegar a la parcelas camina 800 mts  y trabaja durante la mañana, mientras a su esposa durante la mañana ordeña y se dedica a  vender la leche y luego en el transcurso de la tarde, él cuida los animales en los potreros que alquila, además cuida animales de otras personas y le pagan por ello

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar una vaca lechera y producir mas leche para la venta y así obtener más ingresos para el sustento de su familia.

Desea, adquirir un terreno,  donde tener los animales ya que alquila actualmente y le sale mas caro mantenerlos.
texts.en:
Amadeo is 63 years old and only studied up to the ninth grade.  He is married and his wife does domestic work.  They had two children.  Amadeo currently lives with his wife and two grandchildren.  He gets up at 4:00 a.m. together with his wife and grandchildren, who go to school. They depend on the work he does.  Amadeo works in agriculture, a trade he learned from his parents.  He walks 800 meters to get to the fields where he works during the morning while his wife milks the cows and sells the milk.  Later, during the afternoon, he takes care of the animals in the pastures he rents. He also takes care of other people's animals for which they pay him. 

He is asking Fundacion Campo for a loan to buy a dairy cow to produce more milk to sell thereby increasing his income to support his family. He wishes to buy some land to keep the animals because he currently rents the land and this is more expensive.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow and produce more milk to sell thereby increasing his income to support his family.

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es: La señora Rosmery tiene 37 años de edad y vive en la zona de Sumumpaya. Estudió solo el nivel primario y se dedica a elaborar quesillos para la venta. Actualmente necesita nuevamente capital de operación para la compra de cáscara de soya para el alimento de su ganado por lo que solicita un crédito de Bs. 10200 para seguir creciendo, mejorar sus condiciones de vida y tener su vivienda propia.
texts.en: Rosemery, 37, lives in the Sumumpaya region. She went to primary school and makes a living by making fresh cheese to sell. Currently, she needs working capital to buy soybeans to feed her cattle. She is requesting a loan of 10,200 BOB so she can keep growing and improve her quality of life and her home.

loans.use: to buy soybeans to feed her cattle.

loans.name: Lagina

texts.en: Lagina is 31 years old with two children. The elder one is studying in class I (grade 1). Both Lagina and her husband have received an education up to class VIII (grade 8). They live in a small town in Dhupguri. Lagina is a housewife and her husband provides the sole income for the family. By occupation, he is a mason. He makes foundations for houses. The materials required to make the foundation are expensive, so it was not possible for him to run the business effectively. Lagina decided to join BJS and take a loan so they can buy supplies for the business. Now with the help of Lagina, her husband will buy bamboo the other materials and can earn more money. They are thankful for BJS and Kiva for helping to improve their business!

loans.use: to purchase wood and bamboo for building house foundations.

loans.name: Halima

texts.ru: Человек с огромным сердцем доброты и прекрасной душой уже более 25 лет занимается выращиванием сельхоз культур. Халима в основном выращивает зерновых культур. Она имеет свою землю. Халима имеет дополнительный доход от скотоводства, так как доход от выращивания зерновых культур не достаточно для обеспечения 5 детей. Ее муж тоже занимается выращиванием сельхоз культур. Халима трудится упорно с раннего утра до позднего вечера. Ее муж и сын помогают ей по введению бизнеса. Халима нуждается финансовой поддержки, так как ее сын хочет уехать в Российскую Федерацию для того, чтобы найти работу и зарабатывать деньги. Халима запрашивает займ с ИМОН и КИВА на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки авиабилета. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Halima is a woman with a huge heart, an amazing kindness and a beautiful soul.  She has been involved in agriculture for more than 25 years, essentially growing crops on her own land.  She also derives an additional income from animal husbandry, because the income she makes from crop cultivation alone is not enough to provide for her five children.  Halima's husband is also involved in agriculture.  Halima works very hard, from early in the morning until late in the evening.  Her husband and son help her run the business.

Halima currently needs financial support, because her son wants to go to Russia to find a job and earn some money.  She is requesting a loan of 3,000 somoni from IMON and Kiva to buy a plane ticket for her son.  She is awaiting your kindness and generosity.

loans.use: to buy a plane ticket for her son, to go to Russia.

loans.name: Mirna Haydee

texts.es:
Mirna, está casada, vive junto a su esposo y sus hijos,  se dedica a siembra de maíz desde hace mucho trabaja a por las mañanas y luego se dedica a sus labores domesticas invertirá un poco en su negocio del cultivo de maíz, y con préstamo podrá comprar abono, fertilizantes, semilla y otros para la preparación de la tierra, espera obtener buenos ingresos, y  aumentar su producción.
El espera sacar adelante a su familia, cancelar sus deudas, está dispuesta a seguir luchando para que su negocio se mantenga activo y rentable.
texts.en:
Mirna is married and lives with her husband and children. For several years, she has made a living planting corn in the mornings and later in the day, she completes domestic work. She will invest a little in her corn planting business and with this loan, she will be able to buy manure, fertilizer, seeds, and other supplies to prepare the land. She hopes to make good income and increase her production.

She hopes to move her family forward and pay off her debt. Mirna is prepared to keep working hard to keep her business active and profitable.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizer, seeds, and other supplies.

loans.name: Freedom's 2 Group

texts.en:
Meet members of the “Freedom 2” group from Teshie-Accra, a town in the coastal region of Ghana. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to ID-Ghana, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of GHS 5,000 as a total amount for the group. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. They are into fish, cosmetics, maize, provision and slippers. 

Jemimah is the featured leader of this group. The 39-year-old is married with two adult children. Jemimah has been a businesswoman for ten years now. She sells maize. With her share of this loan, she will buy one big bag of maize and sell to customers. This is the seventh loan cycle with ID-Ghana and they repaid previous loans promptly without trouble.

loans.use: to buy one big bag of maize and sell to customers.

loans.name: Tonghour

texts.en:
Tonghour is a villager from Banteay Meanchey province's Ou Chrov district. He is a single man who strives for a living via working as an English teacher. It is an occupation that he has had for three years and it has returned him about $6 per day. 

Tonghour is a first-time borrower with VisionFund(Kiva’s partner). He is seeking a first-time loan to pay his school fees as he wants to pursue his studies toward a bachelor's degree in English literature. He hopes that he can obtain this bachelor's degree so he can get a good job after graduation.

loans.use: To pay his school fees

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Ou Chrov Dristrict

loans.name: Thy

texts.en:
A married mother of five children, Thy is aged 48, living in a rural village of the Moung Russey district, Cambodia. All of her five children are still in school. She has been farming rice while her husband is a teacher. Having been in this business for 20 years, she is able to earn about 50,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.  

Thy has been with VisionFund for four cycles. Now she is asking for another loan to pay for her daughter’s tuition fee at university, specializing in accountancy. Thy hopes to keep her daughter in school.

loans.use: to pay her daughter’s tuition fee at the university

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 33 years old and lives in Caldwell. She’s married and has a three-year-old child who lives at home and attends school. She has been selling red oil, charcoal, and soap in the market for 8 years now, and she enjoys the flow of her customers. 

Janet is requesting a loan to purchase more red oil, charcoal, and soap for her business. Her dream is to become an international business woman.

loans.use: to purchase more red oil, charcoal, and soap for her business.

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es:
Rigoberto de 60 años,  es una persona que solo estudio hasta noveno grado, es casado, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, procrearon tres hijos y actualmente viven con dos nietos. Rigoberto se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. Junto a su esposa  y nietos que asisten a la escuela.

Rigoberto,  se dedica a la agricultura oficio que aprendió de sus padres,  para llegar a la parcelas camina 1 Km  y trabaja junto a su esposa durante la mañana y luego la tarde trabaja jornaleando.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar  piedra, cemento, hierro, arena, etc. Para terminar la vivienda que esta construyendo, ya que en la que actualmente reside, ya no es habitable.

 Rigoberto, planea en un futuro comprar un molino, para  tener más ingresos para el sustento de su familia.
texts.en:
Rigoberto is 60 years old and is a person who only studied up to the ninth grade. He is married and his wife is a homemaker. They had three children and they currently live with two grandchildren. Rigoberto gets up at 5:00 am with his wife and grandchildren who go to school. 

Rigoberto makes his living in agriculture, and occupation he learned from his parents. He walks one kilometer to his plot of land and he works with his wife through the morning. During the afternoon he works as a day laborer. 

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy stones, cement, iron, sand, etc. in order to finish the home he is building. The house he is living in now is not habitable. Rigoberto plans to buy a mill in the future in order to make more income to support his family.

loans.use: to buy stone, cement, iron, sand, and other supplies to finish his home, which he is building because his current home is inhabitable.

loans.name: Mabb

texts.en:
Mabb is 44 years old. He is married and resides with three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. He has been buying recycled materials to resell for more than ten years, earning approximately $6 per day. His wife, who is in the picture, is a garment worker who earns an income of $3 a day. 

Due to lack of funds, Mabb is requesting a loan of $1200 USD to purchase timber to build a new house. This money will help him obtain a comfortable house for his family. In the future, he would like to expand his business and help his children achieve a higher education.

loans.use: to purchase timber to build a new house.

loans.name: Seang's Group

texts.en:
Seang, 62, is married with five children. Her family lives in a house with a thatch roof located in Moung Russey district, Battambang province. The main sources of her family’s income are from farming rice and selling snacks. She has been running her business for ten years, earning about 40,000 KHR per day. She is able to save about 20,000 KHR each day.

Seang received her first loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, three cycles ago; she has effectively used it to sustain her family’s business, support her family’s needs, and save some money from her earnings for the future. Now, she is leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yields to earn more income and make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: Luis, con 60 años de edad, es un hombre humilde y carismático, que se ha dado a conocer en el sector donde reside por el buen servicio que presta en su negocio; una tienda de abarrotes que inició hace aproximadamente 15 años, como una opción para generar los ingresos económicos que requiere para llevar el sustento a su hogar. Aprendió la actividad de manera empírica y poco a poco fue adquiriendo experiencia por el método de prueba/error; actualmente recibe la colaboración de su esposa y trabaja desde las 7:00 am hasta las 9:00 pm. Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de surtido al por mayor (mecato, galletería, dulcería, lácteos, productos cárnicos, entre otros), así tendrá más variedad de artículos disponible para satisfacer los gustos y necesidades de sus clientes, especialmente en la temporada de fin de año en la que se incrementan las ventas, logrando un beneficio económico para seguir sustentando las necesidades del hogar. “Mi edad no es un impedimento para seguir trabajando, pues todavía tengo la energía y la motivación para luchar por el bienestar de mi familia” manifiesta Luis; quien sueña con acreditar bien su negocio y hacerlo más rentable y perdurable en el tiempo, para que en un futuro le permita disfrutar al lado de su esposa, de una vejez más tranquila y con una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luis, 60, is an unassuming and charming man who has become known in his neighborhood for the good service that he provides in his business.  He has a grocery store that he started about 15 years ago in order to generate the income he needed to support his household.  He learned this business on the job, and he gradually acquired experience through trial and error.  Now he is supported by his wife, and he works from 7am until 9pm.

At this time, he is requesting a loan to stock up his store at wholesale, purchasing snacks, cookies and crackers, sweets, dairy products, meat products, and other items.  This way, he will have a greater variety of items available to satisfy the tastes and needs of his customers, especially at the end of the year, when sales tend to increase.  This will give him financial benefits so that he can continue to meet the needs of his household.  

"My age is not an impediment to continue working, as I still have the energy and motivation to strive for my family's well-being," states Luis.  He dreams of making his business more profitable and more well-known so that he can keep it going over time.  This way, in the future, he can enjoy time with his wife, a better quality of life, and a tranquil old-age.

loans.use: to buy products for his store at wholesale (snacks, cookies, sweets, dairy products, meat products, and other items)

loans.name: Kazem

texts.en:
Kazem is a 41-year-old married man who has been working selling mobile phones, accessories and recharge cards for five years. In 2012, he opened his current mobile shop, to improve his living and increase his income. Kazem also sells water, soft drinks, chips and chocolate to diversify his products and increase his income.

Kazem is working on expanding his business. He is acquiring a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, to buy a special blender and a balance to start whipped cream production, as an additional business.

Kazem is a hard working man who puts so much effort into pleasing his customers and developing his business. He has many future plans, and he will try his best to make them come true, through opening an international call center.

loans.use: to buy a special blender and a balance to start whipped cream production.

loans.name: Jose Wilfredo

texts.es:
José, ha optado por un nuevo préstamo para poder  iniciar la siembra de maíz,  ya que el comprara insumos agrícolas (fertilizantes, abono, etc.). Y así poder incrementar sus ingresos en el negocio y poder aportar más para los gastos del hogar. Con la inversión anterior él mejoro muchísimo su economía y ha podido salir de sus deudas.
Su familia ya tiene un nuevo miembro quien ha llegado en un momento adecuado ya que ellos se están superando económicamente.
texts.en: Jose has chosen to get a new loan so that he can start cultivating corn.  He will use the loan to buy agricultural supplies such as chemical and organic fertilizers.  This way, he will increase his income so that he can contribute more to the household expenses.  With his previous loan he improved his finances a lot, and was able to pay off his debts.  Jose's family already has a new member who has arrived at a good time, since they are doing well financially.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Mamuka

texts.en:
Mamuka is 30 years old, married, and lives in Batumi city with his large family: his wife, two children, two brothers, two daughter-in-laws, parents and two nephews. Mamuka’s father works as a construction worker, his young brother works at the factory where building materials are made and one of the daughters-in-law is an accountant. Mamuka is jobless at the moment and he doesn’t have his own source of income.
  
Mamuka is a very enthusiastic young man and wishes to be financially independent. He decided to start his own business with the help of a loan. He requested a loan from MFO Credo and the application was approved within the framework of a startup program that enables inexperienced borrowers to begin new businesses. Mamuka owns a commercial space, and with the loan, he will purchase essential equipment such as a vacuum cleaner, hoses and power washers. He will provide services to local community members and hopes to generate income. The new business initiative will significantly improve the living conditions of his family and give Mamuka financial stability. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to start up a car wash business.

loans.name: Chhun

texts.en:
Chhun is a mother of four children in her early 40s, who lives in Kampong Cham province where she does rice farming, which is the main source of her income. Her family also earns additional income via her husband's occupation working as a school teacher. 

From the current business, she is able to generate about 36,400 KHR per day to cover the daily cost of living. 

This is Chhun's first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is applying for a new loan in order to pay for plowing fees and buy potash for her farmland. Additionally, she will buy piglets for raising to gain additional income. Chhun hopes that she can gain triple her income from her business so she can improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for plowing fees and buy potash for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Valaga

texts.en:
Valaga is 42 years old and lives in Caldwell. She is married and has three children aged between 10 and 26 years old, who are in school and live at home. 

For the past ten years, Valaga has been selling charcoal. She started this business with money given to her by her eldest sister, and she learned this way of selling from her mother. 

Valaga is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal for her business. She hopes to improve her children's education and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Yon

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Bovel district of Battambang province, Yon is a 41-year-old mother of two children. Rice farming has been the only source for her family’s income to make a living for six years. Sometimes, they work for others for a fee to earn additional income. The current business earns her about 24,000 KHR per day.
 
Yon has been with VisionFund for three cycles. She has completely paid back the past loans, which have helped her to improve her financial burden. Now, she is applying for a loan to buy fertilizers, pesticides and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yields so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Sokchan

texts.en:
Sokchan, aged 54 and a mother of six children, is a resident from Kampong Cham province. For her family, one hectare of rice is the only source of income to support her living. She has been in this business for 34 years. 

This is Sokchan's first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is seeking a loan in order to buy potash for her farmland. She hopes that she can gain more yields from her crop so she can make more money to buy an additional plot of farmland to expand her agribusiness.

loans.use: to buy potash for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Da's Group

texts.en:
A resident from a rural village of the Moung Russey district, Da is a 45-year-old mother of five children, three of whom are still in school. The main source of family’s income is from rice, and Da has been in this business for twenty years. With her current business, she can earn about KHR 25,000 per day to spend on daily expenses.
 
This is the second loan for Da with VisionFund. She successfully repaid her first loan. Now, she is leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland, and she will use a portion to pay for labor and land plowing. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her income so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Ry

texts.en:
A farmer who resides in Sa Ang district of Kandal province, Ry is 43 years old, and a mother of four dependent children. For the sake of her family, she grows rice as the main source of income, and raises pigs for additional income. This business has returned her about US$8.10 per day. 

Ry is a first time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She decided to apply for this loan in order to cover the tuition fees for her daughter who wants to pursue a bachelors degree in finance and banking. She hopes that this financial support will enable her daughter to finish her bachelors degree and get a good job.

loans.use: to cover the tuition fees for her daughter, who is studying for a bachelors degree.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 44-year-old married father of three children. He has been working as a car mechanic for many years.In 2007, he opened his current workplace, and he is working hard on developing it. He is very talented and experienced in fixing car bodies and colors. 

He is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, to make necessary maintenance to his house through building an additional room to expand his family's living space, to improve their living.

This is his sixth cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower, and he has a good repayment history. 

In the future, he plans to expand his business through buying a special car painting oven which will improve his business quality.

loans.use: to make necessary maintenance to his house through building an additional room to expand his family's living space.

loans.name: Ulugbek

texts.en:
Ulugbek is 30 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and two children. He has had his own business for five years, and it is his source of income. He sells sugar, rice, beans, eggs and soft drinks etc.. 

He has not had many customers for some time, and that is why he decided to widen his assortment of goods. He is asking a loan of 2,000 USD. With the loan, he is going to buy dairy products, meats and cold cuts, as he wishes to satisfy the demands from his customers, and always keep his store well-stocked. 

His goal is to always keep his business brisk, as it is the source of income for his family.

loans.use: to buy dairy products, meats and cold cuts for his food market.

loans.name: Jumagul

texts.ru: Жумагул 34 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 1 ребенка. У Жумагул - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Жумагул занимается животноводством, стартовав 13 лет назад, с покупки скота на 3,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Жумагул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 1 лошадь. Ежемесячный доход составляет 4,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Жумагул обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Жумагул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Jumagul is 34, married, and raising one child together with her husband.  She has the equivalent of a high school education and raises livestock for a living, first starting 13 years ago with 3,000 som worth of animals. Thanks to her persistent efforts, her farm currently has 1 dairy cow and 1 horse, and her monthly income is about 4,000 som.  To further develop her farm, Jumagul is seeking a loan of 40,000 som from Bai Tushum and Partners to buy cattle.  She plans on reinvesting any extra money that the loan will allow her to make by buying more livestock, as well as setting some of it aside for home repairs.

loans.use: buy cattle

loans.name: Ut

texts.en:
Ut would like to take a further loan to continue her business of selling fruit and vegetables. Her previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. 

She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase sales.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables to increase her sales.

loans.name: Ruth Giovanna

texts.es: La Señora Giovanna de 28 años de edad vive con sus padres en Colomi zona Barrientos, es soltera con un hijo menor, la actividad económica que realiza es la agricultura y percibe ingresos por la venta de papa y haba, cultiva en 1 hectárea de terreno que fue herencia de sus padres y contrata personal eventual para la actividad agrícola, pero necesita un crédito de Bs. 5000 para comprar insumos agrícolas para la siembra de esta campaña, con el fin de garantizar la seguridad alimentaria, incrementar sus ingresos y ahorrar para comprar un lote para vivienda.
texts.en: Giovanna, 28, lives with her parents in Colomi, in the Barrientos area.  She is single and has a minor child.  She is a farmer who earns an income selling potatoes and beans.  She cultivates a hectare of land that she inherited from her parents.  She hires temporary workers to work on the farm, but she needs a loan of 5,000 Bolivian bolivianos to buy agricultural supplies for this season's plantings.  Her goal is to ensure her food security, increase her income, and save to buy a lot of land to build a house.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for this planting season

loans.name: Mame's Group

texts.fr:
Créer le 26 novembre 2003 le banc villageois est actuellement à son 20ème cycle dans le programme des bancs villageois. Il  regroupe en son sein des femmes qui vivent ensemble depuis plusieurs années et partageant ainsi un esprit très positif de la vie en communauté. Ce groupe est porté actuellement à 24 femmes qui sont animées d’une solidarité et entre aide mutuelle. Elles vivent toutes dans la même localité et pratiquent le petit commerce et diverses activités génératrices de revenu.
Madame Mame (debout à l’extrême droite), est l’emprunteuse vedette. Elle âgée de 45 ans, mariée et mère de deux  filles. Elle fait partie des personnes ressources du groupement, c’est une femme très dynamique. Elle s’active dans le petit commerce plus particulièrement dans la vente de sucre, thé, assaisonnements, bonbons et divers autres produits de consommation courante.
 Avec son nouveau prêt elle compte acheter divers produits  à savoir : une boîte d’allumette, un sac de sucre, deux à trois paquets de thé vert  et divers bonbons pour enfant.

Les  bénéfices issus  de cette activité lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et de participer à côté de son mari à la prise en charge des frais scolaires de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Created on November 26, 2003 this banc villageois is currently on its 20th loan cycle in the banc villageois program. It includes among its members women who have lived together for several years and who share a very positive spirit of community life. This group has expanded to include 24 women who are motivated by solidarity and mutual aid among themselves. They all live in the same local community and practice small businesses and various income generating enterprises.

Mame (shown in the photo standing on the far right) is the featured borrower for the group. She is 45 years of age, and married with two daughters. She is one of the key resource people of the group, and is a very dynamic woman. She runs a small business selling sugar, tea, seasonings, sweets and various other consumer products. With her new loan, she plans to buy various products, namely: a carton of matches, a bag of sugar, two to three packets of green tea and various sweets for children.

The income she earns from her business will enable her to improve the lives of her family and to participate alongside her husband in paying for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy various products, namely: a carton of matches, a bag of sugar, two to three packets of green tea and various sweets for children.

loans.name: Sreytouch

texts.en:
A mother of seven children, Sreytouch is 53 years old, and is a villager from Takeo province’s Trang district. To sustain her family, grows rice on two and half hectares of farmland. Her husband works a school teacher. From her current business, she is able to earn up to almost US$8 per day.

This is Sreytouch's first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is seeking a loan in order to support her daughter’s education costs. She hopes that her daughter can fulfill her dream of holding a bachelors degree majoring in finance and banking, and get a good job after she graduates.

loans.use: to support her daughter’s education costs.

loans.name: Bintou

texts.fr:
Madame Bintou,  est une jeune femme d’une détermination sans faille dans le développement de ses activités génératrice de revenu. C’est une des femmes  qui a connu une nette progression depuis la mise en place du banc villageois en Août 2011. Elle  mariée  et mère de 02 filles et 03 garçons du haut de ses 38 ans, elle tient une boutique au village où elle vend  à la fois des produits manufacturés et des produits de transformation locale. Elle pratique cette activité depuis plusieurs années. Elle s’approvisionne au marché central régional pour la revente par détail au village. 

Avec ce nouveau, elle compte renforcer son stock par l’achat d’une demi-tonne de riz à 120 000 Fr CFA et le reste pour différents produits de consommation.

Avec les bénéfices, elle désire renforcer sa capacité de financement via l’épargne d’une part  et d’autre part participé de manière significative à la prise en charge des besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Bintou is a young woman of strong determination in the development of her income generating small business. This is a women who has seen a marked increase in sales since the establishment of the banc villageois in August of 2011. At the ripe age of 38, she is married and has two girls and three boys, and runs a shop in the village where she sells both manufactured goods and locally processed products. She has been running her business for several years. Bintou purchases her merchandise at the central regional market and resells her goods at retail in the village.

With this new loan, Bintou plans to increase her stock by purchasing a half-ton of rice for 120,000 Francs CFA, and to purchase various consumer products. Bintou wants to use part of the income she earns to strengthen her financing capacity through savings, and she will use the rest of her income to participate in supporting the needs of her family.

loans.use: to increase her stock by purchasing a half-ton of rice for 120,000 Francs CFA, and to purchase various consumer products.

loans.name: Kosmira

texts.ru: Космире 28 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. У Космиры - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Космира занимается животноводством, стартовав 5 лет назад, с покупки скота на 1,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Космиры, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 дойные коровы, 2 лошади, 23 овцы. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Космира обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку кобылы для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Космира планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на покупку семейной автомашины.
texts.en: Kosmira is 28, married, and raising 2 kids together with her husband.  She has the equivalent of a high school education, and raises livestock for a living, first starting 5 years ago with 1,000 som worth of animals.  Thanks to her persistent efforts, she currently has 3 dairy cows, 2 horses, and 23 sheep on her farm, while her monthly income is nearly 15,000 som.  To further develop her farm, Kosmira is seeking a loan of 40,000 som from Bai Tushum and Partners to buy a mare.  She plans on using any extra money that the loan will allow her to make to continue buying more livestock for her farm, and hopes to set aside money for a new family car.

loans.use: to buy a mare

loans.name: Safiatou's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe, créé le 25 Août 2011 au jour d’inauguration est animé d’une très bonne entente, la solidarité est très forte dans ce banc villageois composé de 27 femmes qui sont issues du même village. Les membres ont comme activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame Safiétou (assise à l’extrême gauche) est l’emprunteuse vedette  du groupe. Elle est âgée de 49ans, elle est mariée et mère de 09 enfants dont 04 filles et 05 garçons. Elle est vendeuse de légumes et de divers produits agricoles suivants les saisons telles que les feuilles de bissap rouge, le pin de singe, les racines de gingembre ainsi que l’huile de palme qu’elle achète ou vend au marché international de la sous région et dans son village.

Ce nouveau  crédit lui permettra d’acheter deux bidons de 20 litres d’huile de palme, des sacs de 50 kilos de feuilles de bissap rouge et un lot de savon de fabrication traditionnelle.

Les bénéfices lui permettront  de contribuer considérablement à la prise en charge de la scolarisation et sanitaire des enfants.
texts.en:
This group, created on the inauguration day of August 25, 2011, is driven by a strong goodwill towards one another. Solidarity is very strong in this banc villageois composed of 27 women who come from the same village. The members' principal activities are small merchant businesses.

Safiétou (shown seated on the far left) is the featured borrower for the group. She is 49 years old, married, and the mother of nine children; four girls and five boys. She sells vegetables and various agricultural products according to the seasons, including red hibiscus leaves, Monkey Bread (fruit of the Baobab), ginger root, and palm oil that she buys and sells to the international market in the subregion and in her village.

The new loan will allow her to buy two 20-liter cans of palm oil, 50-kilo sacks of red hibiscus leaves, and a batch of traditionally fabricated soap. The income she earns will enable her to contribute significantly in support of the education and health of her children.

loans.use: to buy two 20-liter cans of palm oil, 50-kilo sacks of red hibiscus leaves, and a batch of traditionally fabricated soap.

loans.name: Express Group

texts.en:
Zurekha is the leader of this ten-member group. She is a widow in her mid-fifties who has five grown children. She also has two grandchildren, both of whom are in school.

For the past five years Zurekha has sold clothes and tie-dyed fabrics, among other things. She works from 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Zurekha’s second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to buy clothes to sell and tie-dye materials. She is doing great. She paid back her loan successfully and used her profits to pay for her grandchildren's school fees plus food and household needs.

Zurekha is now applying for a 3,320,000 TZS loan to be apportioned among those in her group. With her portion she plans to buy more clothes, fabric and fruits and vegetables to sell. She dreams of enlarging her tie-dye business and raising and selling poultry.

loans.use: to buy more clothese, fabrics and fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Ngan

texts.en:
Ngan, 27, is single and lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh. She earns money by running a general store in front of her house.

Ngan is applying for a new loan through CEP, this one for 15,000,000 VND, to buy a range of new products such as food and beverages to restock her shop. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She feels this loan will help her to continue bettering her ability to meet the needs of her customers.

Ngan hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing sales and the size of her store and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy food and beverages to stock her store.

loans.name: Jovenes Emprendedores Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado  Jovenes Alegres está en su 1er ciclo del programa de comité de jóvenes, todos tienen la emoción de su primer trabajo en equipo, son jóvenes que quieren ayudar a sus seres queridos.
Alexis es un joven emprendedor, está vendiendo helados, y por eso está ganándose un poco de ingresos para poder ayudar a su familia. Es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante y crecer. Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de helados y así seguir con su esfuerzo y ayudar a sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
The group called 'Jovenes Alegres' is in its first cycle of the youth committee program. The members of the group are all excited for their first work as a team; they are young people who want to help their loved ones.

Alexis is a young entrepreneur; he is selling ice creams and is therefore earning a bit of income to be able to help his family. He is someone who has a great desire to get ahead and to grow. He is asking for this loan to be able to invest in buying ice creams and thus continue with his efforts and help his loved ones.

loans.use: to buy ice creams to sell

loans.name: Maher

texts.en:
Maher is a 31-year-old single Syrian citizen who has been working as a tailor in Lebanon since 2007 to make a living. Maher is a hard worker who puts so much effort in attracting and pleasing new customers. 

Maher is acquiring his second loan cycle from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, to buy the needles, pins, buttons, and threads he needs in his business.
Maher's plan for the future is to buy new updated tailoring machines, necessary for improving and developing his quality of items produced.

loans.use: to buy necessary needles, pins, buttons, and threads.

loans.name: Yen

texts.en:
Yen would like to take a further loan to buy ingredients to make cakes to sell from her stall. Yen's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. 

She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers, and increase sales. She also hopes that through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make cakes to sell in her store.

loans.name: Khatuna

texts.en:
Khatuna, age 30, is from the Zugdidi district, west Georgia. She is married and lives with her husband, two children, and parents-in-law. Khatuna works as a teacher at the local kindergarten and gets a small monthly salary. Her mother-in-law is a cleaner and she earns income as well. Their earnings are modest and hardly enough for the family of six.
 
That is why she decided to start her own business and go to capital city fair market to purchase apparel and linens for resale. She will sell the items among her community members and co-workers. Khatuna will work on special orders, and give her clients the chance to pay later for their purchase. 

The increased profit will be reinvested in the same business, and Khatuna will be able to continue her activities. Khatuna believes in your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of apparel and linens for resale.

loans.name: Van

texts.en: Van, 35, lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with her family, including one son and her husband. She and her husband earn money through their business selling clothes. She would like to get a loan to buy a larger stock of clothes to meet her customers' needs. She also hopes her business will ensure that her family members, especially her child, will have a better education and a better future.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell at her store.

loans.name: Uyen

texts.en: Uyen is requesting a new loan to buy food and ingredients to make food to sell from her stall. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers, and increase her sales. She also hopes that through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy food and ingredients to make food to sell from her stall.

loans.name: Oanh

texts.en: Oanh would like to take a further loan to buy more soybeans to make food to sell from her stall. Her previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers, and increasing her sales. She also hopes that through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy soybeans to make food to sell from her stall.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en: Hoa, 57, is married and has four children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns an income as a driver for hire. Hoa started a food stall to sell fried rice 8 years ago. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying greater quantity of rice to restock, increase her sales, and better satisfy her customers. She hopes that her business runs smoothly and generates a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of rice to sell.

loans.name: Trang

texts.en:
Trang is 43 years old and married with three daughters. She and her husband has been running a store, selling gas and gas cookers for 6 years. She started this business to cover her expenses and generate income to raise her children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Trang is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying more kinds of gas tanks and gas cookers to resell at her shop. She hopes that this will enable her to attract more customers and increase the turnover of her business. She hopes that through the loan, she will be able to expand her business activities and have money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy gas tanks and gas cookers to resell at her store.

loans.name: Quoc

texts.en: Quoc would like to take a further loan to buy more candies to sell from his store. His previous loan enabled him to increase his sales and earn a higher income to support his family. He hopes that another loan will assist him in increasing the size of his business, attracting new customers and increasing sales. He also hopes that, through the loan, he can increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater quantity and better quality of candies to sell.

loans.name: Surayia

texts.en:
Surayia is a 52-year-old married woman who has been running a business selling milk with her husband for many years. She has two cows, which she uses to sell milk to the people of her locality. She also sells butter and cheese to generate extra profit. 

Surayia has become famous for providing good-quality milk and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently she is in her 6th loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 30,000 PKR. This will allow her to purchase one more cow. 

Surayia is hopeful that this loan will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Thu

texts.en:
Thu is 37 years old and married with three children. She and her husband has been running a general store for five years. She started this business to cover her expenses and generate income to raise her children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Thu is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying more kinds of products, such as food, noodles, cakes, and soft drinks, to resell at her store. She hopes that this will enable her to attract more customers and increase the turnover of her business. She hopes that through the loan, she will be able to expand her business activities and have money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy noodles, foods, cakes, and soft drinks to resell at her store.

loans.name: San Luis Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Luis está en su ciclo número 4 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Se trabaja con las señoras mediante capacitaciones donde todas participaron con mucho entusiasmo por aprender, también mediante los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa lograron aumentar sus ingresos y superar la linea de pobreza, mediante la aplicación de la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Juana quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel 3, es decir, con ingresos estables, pero que con su esfuerzo debe mantener. Ella se dedica a la venta de Comidas, como ser de empanadas mandiocas, milanesas, etc. también se debe destacar el trabajo de las asesoras, quienes hacen un seguimiento permanente de capacitaciones y verificaciones que de alguna manera exigen y al mismo tiempo incentivan a las mujeres a luchar. Juana es una persona que quiere mejorar su vida, es por eso que está luchando.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de las empanadas que ella compra toda hecha, mandiocas que ella cocina y luego las vende, con lo cual podrá seguir trabajando y luchando por seguir manteniendo sus buenos ingresos.
texts.en:
The group San Luis is in its 4th loan cycle in the women's committee program, where everyone works and helps each other to get ahead. It works with the women by means of trainings, where everyone participates with a lot of enthusiasm for learning. By demonstrating the conduct of successful women, they were able to increase their earnings and overcome the line of poverty through the use of the poverty elimination survey.

One of the members is Juana, who in her last survey showed a poverty level within level 3; that is to say, with a steady income, but she must use her efforts to maintain it. She works selling food, such as cassava empanadas and milanesas (a breaded meat filet), etc.

The assessors' work must also be emphasized; they do a permanent followup of trainings and inquiries that in a way are demanding, but also motivate the women to fight.

Juana is a person who wants to improve her life; it is for this reason that she is fighting.She is requesting this loan for the purchase of empanadas that she buys already made and cassava that she cooks and sells later, with which she will be able to continue working and fighting to keep maintaining her good income.

loans.use: to buy empanadas and cassava to sell.

loans.name: Thoa

texts.en:
Thoa, 30, lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with her family, including one son and her husband. Thoa and her husband earn money through their business selling rice and bread. 

Thoa would like to request a loan to buy a larger quantity of rice and bread to meet her customers' needs. She also hopes her business will ensure that her family members, especially her child, will have a better education and a better future.

loans.use: to buy rice and bread to sell.

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en: Nusrat, age 41, is a married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband for the past 5 years. By now, she has retained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. She is a mother of three children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing, and healthcare. She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of 20,000 PKR to buy packs of salt, biscuits, and beverages to meet increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future. She is in her 4th loan cycle with a good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Hieu

texts.en: Hieu is 40 years old and is married. He has two children and lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City. His wife is a sales lady. He has run a store selling glasses from his house for 10 years. He intends to use his loan to buy a variety of glasses to meet his customers' demands. He hopes his business runs smoothly, helps him to improve his family's living conditions, and helps him save money for his children's education.

loans.use: to buy glasses to sell.

loans.name: Ghulam  Fatima

texts.en: Ghulam Fatima is a 35-year-old married woman and a mother of three. She has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of funds she is unable to meet the daily demand of her customers. For this reason, she requested a loan of 20,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan to buy more spools of different colored thread along with packs of lace, zippers, and buttons to increase revenue so she may be able to generate more income. She is in her third loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy more spools of different colored thread along with packs of lace, zippers, and buttons.

loans.name: Nga

texts.en: Nga, 57, lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with her family. Nga earns money through running a food stall selling breakfast for people in her community. She would like to get a loan to buy better food to satisfy her customers' needs. She also hopes her business will ensure a better future for her family members.

loans.use: to buy better food to make breakfast to sell.

loans.name: Ghulam  Fatima

texts.en: Ghulam Fatima is a 50-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband from the corner by her house. Her husband assists her by purchasing stocks of goods from the market, since he has maintained many contacts throughout the years. Gulam Fatime is a mother of two children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing, and healthcare. She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of 25,000 PKR to buy packs of salt, biscuits, and beverages to meet increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits, and beverages.

loans.name: Mai

texts.en: Mai, 66, lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with her family including two sons, four daughters, and her husband. Her husband is retired. Mai has run a general store at her house for 23 years. She sells milk, beverages, stationary, confections and some household electrical goods. She intends to use her loan to buy a variety of products to sell such as eggs, sugar, and sanitation items. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions as well as save money for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy eggs, sugar, and sanitation items.

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy is 32 years old and lives in the town of Abaita Ababiri in the region west of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 3 children. Two of them are currently in school. For the past 5 years, Teddy has been working hard to manage her poultry farm and to sell chicken. 

To help expand her business, Teddy has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more birds, and will help Teddy to generate greater profits and increase her stock and income. Teddy hopes that in the future she will be able to to have a larger stock available for customer consumption. 

Teddy is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Teddy who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more birds

loans.name: Hien

texts.en: Hien, 50, lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with her family, including two daughters and her husband. She has run a general store from her house for 3 years. She sells milk, beverages, stationary, confections, and some household electrical goods. She intends to use her loan to buy many kinds of products to sell such as household and sanitation items. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions as well as save money for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy household and sanitation items to sell at her general store.

loans.name: Dragan

texts.en: Dragan is married and has 2 adult boys. One of them is married. They live all together in a small house in a minority community of Kosovo. He is working in a clinic as a technical assistant and his wife is a nurse. Both earn very low salaries. Dragan does not earn enough to provide for all of the needs of his family, even with his wife's salary. They have recently finished a new house, and still need to build a facade for it before the winter to improve insulation and retain heat inside. He requested a loan in order to buy material for the facade of his house. This loan will help Dragan and his family to improve their living conditions, keep them warm and healthy in the cold weather, and lower utility costs for heating. His goal is to be able to find a better paying job and offer his child a better life! Dragan and his family want to thank all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To buy material for the facade of his house

loans.name: Trang

texts.en: Trang, 36, lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with her family including two children and her husband. He is working for a construction company. Trang earns money through running a food stall selling banana cakes, and glue rice cakes for people in her community. She would like to get a loan to buy better ingredients and appliances to make better cakes to satisfy her customers' needs. She also hopes her business will ensure a better future for her family members.

loans.use: To buy ingredients and appliances to make cakes to sell.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en: Shazia is a 34-year-old married woman who works from home as a tailor. She has been in this line of work for eight years now and is proud to be contributing to her household income. When Shazia was not earning her family was going through severe financial crisis that compelled her to use her stitching skills in a productive manner. Her husband is a carpenter, but due to limited resources they couldn’t manage their household expenditures. Shazia felt it obligatory to change her family’s living standards and started working from home. Her hard work helped her establish a good clientele, but she is having difficulty in fulfilling large orders. Thus, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 20,000 PKR. It will help her to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of different colored thread.  She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine with some spools of different colored thread.

loans.name: Lan

texts.en: Lan, 47, lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with her family, including a daughter and her husband. Her husband supports his family by fitting water tubes. Lan earns money through her business selling water pipes and hoses. She would like to get a loan to buy more stock of pipes and hoses to meet her customers' needs. She also hopes her business will ensure that her family members will have a better education and a better future.

loans.use: To buy water pipes and hoses to sell.

loans.name: Hop

texts.en: Hop, 59, has two children. She lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with her family. Hop earns money through her business selling garments. She started this business 20 years ago. She would like to get a loan to buy a larger stock of garments to meet her customers' needs. She also hopes her business will ensure that her family members will have a better future.

loans.use: To buy a larger stock of garments to sell

loans.name: Valbona

texts.en: Valbona wants to buy 20 goats and she needs your help. She is a married mother of two children, ten and seven years old. They reside in a village in south-central Albania far from the nearby city and its farmers' market. She takes her dairy products such as cheese and butter to the market twice a week. “I would like to sell raw milk as well, because it’s less of a headaches, however, I have no means to travel to the city every day. So for the moment, what I have been doing works,” said Valbona. “However, adding some more goats to my existing herd, would give us the opportunity to make more dairy products. Thus, we will have to frequent the market every other day,” continued Valbona.

loans.use: to add 20 goats to her herd

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra, 41, lives in a minority community in Kosovo. She is married and has three children. Sandra and her husband have operated a food shop business for more than 3 years in their community. They started with a small food shop and they have now managed to expand it. In addition, to earn more income for their family, her husband also works in agriculture, planting different vegetables and selling them in a market. They are a very happy family and very satisfied with their business. 

Sandra is requesting a loan for the first time to purchase a showcase locker to store the food and to buy different foods for her market to better meet the needs of her customers from all communities. She hopes that the loan will assist her in increasing the size of her shop and improving her living conditions. Sandra's goal is to continue to expand her business. She is very happy for the financial support that KIVA lenders give her, because this way she is certain of making progress in her work.

loans.use: To purchase a showcase locker for her food store

loans.name: Bandia

texts.en: Bandia is a 27-year-old married woman and a mother of two children. She has been in the tailoring business for the last 5 years to support her husband. She accepted the fact that if her husband works alone for their family, they will not be able to cover their household expenses or the educational needs of their children. That is why she started tailoring at home to support her family. She, together with her husband, manage their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. Now she is requesting a loan of 20,000 PKR to purchase more reels of thread along with packs of buttons, lace, and ribbons. In this way, she will be able to meet her increasing demand. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Bandia hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all of her hard work.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of thread along with packs of buttons, lace, and ribbons.

loans.name: Noor

texts.en: Noor is a 35-year-old married woman who has been in the business of selling goats for many years. She buys baby goats at low prices, raises them, and sells them at higher prices in the market. At present, she has 3 goats. Her business is good enough to support a decent lifestyle. She has improved her business to meet day to day life expenses. She is the mother of three children, two of them are in school. She needs to earn much more to meet their everyday expenditures including food, clothing, and education. This is her 3rd year with Kashf Foundation. She is happily running her business with the the foundation's support. She has requested a loan of 25,000 PKR to purchase two more goats. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Loan

texts.en: Loan, 47, lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with her family, including one son and her husband. Loan and her husband have run a general store from their house for 15 years. She sells milk, beverages, stationary, confections, and some household electrical goods. She intends to use her loan to buy a variety of products to sell such as eggs, sugar, and sanitation items. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy eggs, sugar, and sanitation items to sell.

loans.name: Phu

texts.en: Phu, 59, lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with her family, including two children and her husband. Phu and her husband earn money through their business making clothes. She would like to get a loan to buy a larger stock of material to make clothes and increase her production to meet her customers' needs. She also hopes her business will ensure that her family members, and especially her children, will have a better education and a better future.

loans.use: To buy material to make clothes to sell.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en: Samina is a 35-year-old married woman. She has been in the business of selling fruit for many years with her husband. She is very enthusiastic about her business and manages to earn a reasonable amount of money to support her family. She is a loving mother of six children and is responsible for their food, health, and education. For the improvement of her business, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 20,000 PKR to buy sacks of apples, oranges, and guavas. This will help her to meet market demands consistently. This is her 6th year with Kashf Foundation and she has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy sacks of apples, oranges, and guavas.

loans.name: Mame Bousso

texts.fr:
Mame Bousso fait partie du Banc villageois qui a été créé le 12 décembre 2009. 
Âgée de 55 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 08 enfants dont 03 filles. Elle a ouvert une échoppe dans une grande ville de la place qu'elle a laissé à la gestion de son fils. Elle s'y approvisionne et y écoule ses marchandises. Elle compte acheter un stock de marchandises pour son échoppe soit 05 sacs de riz à 13 000 F l'unité, 05 bidons d'huile de 20 L à 17 000 F l'unité, 15 cartons de savons à 7500 F le cartons, 20 sachets de bonbons à 500 F le sachet, 03 sacs de sucre de 50 Kg à 28 000 F le sac, etc. C'est un stock qui est renouvelé 04 fois dans le cycle.
Les bénéfices générés servent à renforcer son épargne et aussi à venir en aide à ses enfants qui ont leur famille à charge et dont les moyens ne suivent pas.
texts.en:
Mame Bousso is part of a "Banc Villageois" loan association that was created 12 December 2009.

She is 55 years old, married and the mother of eight children including three girls. She opened a shop in a big regional city and has her son manage it. The city is where she both resupplies and sells her goods.

She plans to buy a stock of goods for her shop, that is five bags of rice at 13,000 francs each, five 20-liter cans of oil at 17,000 francs each, 15 boxes of soap at 7,500 francs each, 20 bags of candy at 500 francs each, three 50-kilo bags of sugar at 28,000 francs each, etc. This stock is replenished four times per season.

The profits generated are used to build up her savings and also help those of her children who have their own dependents and are unable to cope financially.

loans.use: Restock her shop with goods

loans.name: Ndoucou

texts.fr:
Madame Ndoucou, marié  et mère de 08 enfants, elle est  âgée de 49 ans  et demeure une  femme très dynamique, qui a intégré le banc villageois depuis sa création en 2003. Elle a au fil des cycles mettre sur place des  activités variétés  rentables et pérennes qui s’articulent dans la vente de produits cosmétiques et autres accessoires de beauté destinés à la femme. Pour se faire elle tient  une cantine au marché de la commune depuis plus sept ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans la plus part du temps à la capitale où dans les pays limitrophes.

Avec son nouveau crédit, elle compte renouveler son stock de marchandises par l’achat de carton de mèches (cheveux artificiels pour femme), divers produits cosmétiques  à savoir lait de corps, parfums et déodorants.

Avec les bénéfices, elle pense pouvoir soutenir son mari dans les charges familiales : nourriture, scolarité des enfants et prise en charge sanitaire.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ndoucou is married and the mother of eight children. She is 49 years old and is a very dynamic woman who joined the "banc villageois" loan association since its inception in 2003.

Over several loan cycles she was able to set up a variety of profitable and sustainable activities focusing on the sale of cosmetics and other beauty products for women.

To accomplish this she has been running a stall in the local market for the past seven years. Most of the time she resupplies in the capital, or in neighboring countries.

With the new loan she intends to renew her stock of goods by buying cartons of hair extensions (artificial hair for women), various cosmetic products, namely body lotions, perfumes and deodorants.

With the profits she thinks she can support her husband with family expenditures: food, children's schooling and health care.

loans.use: renew her stock of goods by buying cartons of hair extensions (artificial hair for women), various cosmetics namely body lotions, perfumes and deodorants.

loans.name: Mariama's Group

texts.fr:
Créé un 25 Août 2011 ce  groupement est composé de femmes qui  partagent des liens séculaires de solidarité, d’entre aide  et de partage. Elles sont désireuses de mener des activités commerciales malgré l’enclavement de leur localité, d’une détermination sans faille elles sont toutes dans le petit commerce et la vente de produits agricole en provenance de leur propre champ.

Madame (Mariama assise à l’extrême droite) est l’emprunteuse vedette de ce groupe. Elle est âgée 49 ans, elle est mariée et mère  de trois filles et de quatre garçons. Elle s’active dans la vente de patate douce, d’huile de palme, concernant la patate elle est la productrice. Cependant pour l’huile de palme elle s’approvisionne dans la sous région pour la revente au détail dans son village et les marchés hebdomadaires environnants de son village.

Son nouveau prêt lui permettra d’acheminer sa  production de patate douce par sac ou par panier et pour le reste d’acheter  des bidons de 20 litres d’huile de palme.

Les bénéfices lui permettront d’assurer la scolarité de ses enfants dans une des lycées de la commune vu que l’établissement est un peu éloigné du village en partie et le reste améliorer les conditions d’existence de la famille.
texts.en:
