Created August 25, 2011 this group is composed of women who share age-old ties of solidarity, mutual aid and sharing. They are eager to do business despite the isolation of their settlement, and possess an unwavering determination to do so. They are all involved in small retail commerce and the sale of agricultural products from their own fields.

Mrs. Mariama (sitting on the far right) is the featured member of this borrowing group. She is 49 years old , married and the mother of three girls and four boys. She is active in the sales of sweet potatoes -which she grows-  and palm oil. She gets her palm oil supplies from the sub-region for retail sales in her village and in the weekly markets of neighboring villages.

The new loan will enable her to deliver her production of sweet potatoes in bags or baskets and the rest will be used to buy 20-liter cans of palm oil.

The profits will enable her to ensure the education of her children in one of the local schools since it is located a bit far from the village. The rest will serve to improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: transport her production of sweet potatoes in bags or baskets and with the rest buy 20-liter cans of palm oil.

loans.name: Mariama's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupement est composé de femmes qui après cinq cycle dans le programme ont su développer des activités génératrices de revenu. Elles sont restées  très engagées dans leurs activités et cela  depuis la création de leur groupement en Août 2011. Elles sont d’une solidarité remarquable et s’activent principalement dans le petit commerce.

Madame (Mariama debout à l’extrême droite) est l’emprunteuse vedette de ce groupe. Elle est âgée 41 ans, elle est mariée et mère  d’une fille et de quatre garçons. Elle tient dans son village une table où elle vend divers produits alimentaires à savoir de l’ognon, divers assaisonnements, de la tomate concentrée et divers autres produits de consommation courante. Elle s’approvisionne au  marché central régional de la région en gros et demi gros pour la revente au détail dans le village.

Son nouveau prêt lui permettra d’acheter un sac d’ognon à 8 500 F CFA, 02 à 03 paquets de thé vert, un sac de sucre, un paquet de cube d’assaisonnement suivant les variétés disponibles et 20 litres d’huile raffiné à 17 000 F CFA.

En plus de renforcer son épargne afin de prétendre à un crédit beaucoup plus important dans le futur, elle compte avec les bénéfices améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille en prenant une partie des charges liées à la scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group is composed of women who after five cycles in the loan program have been able to develop income-generating activities. They remain very involved in their activities and that since their group was established in August 2011. They show remarkable solidarity and are mostly active in small retail commerce.

Mrs. Mariama (standing on the far right) is the featured borrower of this group. She is 41 years old , married and has one daughter and four sons.

In her village she displays various food products namely onions, various seasonings, tomato concentrate and other consumer products. She resupplies at the main regional market in the area at wholesale or semi-wholesale prices, for retail sales in the village.

The new loan will enable her to buy a bag of onions at 8,500 CFA francs, two-three packets of green tea, a bag of sugar, a packet of seasoning cubes depending on available varieties, and 20 liters of refined oil for 17,000 CFA francs.

In addition to strengthening her savings so she can request a much larger loan in the future, she intends to use the profits to improve her family's living conditions, by covering some of the costs related to her children's education.

loans.use: buy a bag of onions at 8,500 CFA francs, two or three packets of green tea, a bag of sugar, a packet of seasoning cubes depending on the available varieties, and 20 liters of refined oil at 17,000 CFA francs.

loans.name: Atsouvi

texts.fr: Atsouvi jeune homme de 23ans, pour subvenir à ses besoins revend des produits d'alimentation générale dans une boutique louée à cet effet. Il a démarré en 2012 et s'approvisionne généralement au Grand de Lomé. N'arrivant plus à satisfaire ses clients à cause du manque de marchandises, il sollicite son premier crédit pour augmenter son stock. Le profit qu'il réalisera lui permettra d'ouvrir une autre boutique et se marier plus tard.
texts.en:
Atsouvi is a young 23-year-old man. To meet his needs he retails general food products in a shop rented for this purpose. He started in 2012 and generally gets his supplies at the main market in Lome.

No longer able to satisfy his customers because of the lack of goods, he is requesting his first loan to increase his stock. The profits will enable him to open another shop and marry later.

loans.use: buy general food products

loans.name: Santos Alicia

texts.es:
Santos, es madre soltera y vive con su familia junto a sus dos hijos, ella generar ingresos de su hogar, decidió establecer un negocio de venta de ropa, el negocio fue inspirado a raíz del fallecimiento de su madre, no representa una actividad complicada para ella ya que está ubicada en su casa, de esta manera puede atender a su familia. El crédito lo utilizara para comprar ropa (diferentes tallas, colores, ambos sexos). Con esto ella estará preparada con un inventario muy surtido para la época navideña, tendrá mejores ingresos con los que apoyara a su familia y pagara sus cuotas
Su sueño es apoyar en los gastos de su casa, ampliar su negocio  y sobre todo darles educación de calidad a sus hijos que les permita llegar a ser profesionales.
texts.en:
Santos is a single mother and lives with her family and her two children.  In order to earn an income to support the household, Santos decided to start a business selling clothes.  Santos decided to do this when her mother died.  The work is not complicated for Santos. She runs the business out of her home and so can look after her family.  Santos will use this loan to buy clothes (of different sizes, colours, and for men and women).  With these clothes Santos will be ready for the Christmas season with higher stock levels.  Santos will have a higher income with which to support her family and to pay off her loan.

Santos' dream is to help pay the household bills, expand her business and, above all, give her children a good quality education which will allow them to become professionals.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Sandra Margarita

texts.es:
Sandra de 31 años de edad, es casada, madre de dos hijos de 2 y 7 años de edad respectivamente. Ella estudio hasta educación media. Ella se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. Junto a sus hijos y esposo a quienes enviá a la escuela, mientras ella se dedica actividades  comerciales y su esposo actividades de albañilería.

Específicamente Sandra,  se dedica al comercio de ropa para hombre y mujer, actividad que aprendió de su madre; la cuales vende en los alrededores de su residencia y en la ciudad.

El préstamo que esta solicitando es, para arreglar el techo de su vivienda, debido a que se filtra el agua lo que le daña sus muebles y mercadería.

Su sueño, es poseer  un vehículo para transportarse con más facilidad y poder abarcar mas lugares donde ofrecer sus productos.
texts.en:
Sandra is 31 years old and a mother to two children, aged two and seven years old.  Sandra completed up to middle school. She wakes up at 5am. Sandra sends her children out to school while she has a business and her husband works as a builder.

Sandra's business is selling clothes for men and women.  She learned this trade from her mother.  Sandra sells the clothes in the area around her home and in the city.

This loan will be used to fix the roof on her home as water is seeping through and damaging her furniture and merchandise.

Sandra's dream is to own a vehicle in order to get around more easily and to be able to head to more places to sell her products.

loans.use: to fix the roof on her home as water is seeping through and damaging her furniture and merchandise.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis nació en la ciudad de Latacunga, perteneciente a la República del Ecuador, tiene 57 años de edad, tiene su casa propia en la parroquia Mulaló perteneciente a la provincia de Cotopaxi  en una zona rural del sector, y  esta zona se caracteriza por sus habitantes que se dedican a la crianza y venta de animales menores y ganado de leche, a más de ser un sector netamente lácteo, Luis actualmente se encuentra divorciado vive solo ya que sus dos hijos están casados y tienen su hogar formado.
Ha sido para él muy satisfactorio sacar a sus hijos adelante, su esposa  es y ha sido un pilar fundamental en su vida y en su hogar ya que por la necesidad ha tenido que salir a trabajar además ella es quien en un inicio empezó con la crianza y venta de animales menores. Con el esfuerzo de sus padres pudo terminar la primaria, por la difícil situación económica  de su familia tuvo que trabajar desde muy pequeñoy así poder ser un apoyo para su familia.
Luis se dedica a la crianza y venta de pollos, aprendió de esta actividad ya que es muy común en la zona, por ser un sector rural, trabaja de 6 a 8 horas diarias en el cuidado de los animales. Las ventas las realiza en su casa ya que sus clientes por lo general son sus mismos vecinos. Por el momento solicita un crédito de para poder adquirir más pollos y cerdos e incrementar sus ingresos.
Luis quiere extender un sincero agradecimiento y felicitación a Fundación Alternativa en Ecuador y a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal.
texts.en:
Luis was born in the city of Latacunga in Ecuador. He is 57 years old and has his own house in the Mulaló parish, in the Cotopaxi province.  Luis lives in a rural area, known for its inhabitants who make a living raising and selling young animals, and with dairy cows.  The dairy industry is the biggest business here.  Luis is divorced and lives alone.  His children are married and have their own homes.

For Luis, helping his children to prosper has been very satisfying.  His wife is and has been an important part of Luis' life and in the home. She also needed to go out to work and it was her who started the business raising and selling young animals.  Through the effort of his parents, Luis was able to complete primary school. However, due to their financial situation, Luis had to work from a very young age so as to support his family.

Luis makes a living raising and selling chickens.  He learned this trade as it is very common in the rural area where he lives.  Luis works between six and eight hours per day looking after the animals.  He sells them from his home as his customers are mainly neighbours.  Luis is now applying for a loan in order to buy more chickens and pigs and to increase his income.

Luis extends his sincere thanks to "Fundación Alternativa" in Ecuador and to Kiva for making it possible for Luis to grow in his business and in his personal life.

loans.use: to buy chickens and pigs.

loans.name: Suhrob

texts.ru: Сухробу 19 лет. Он студент 3 курса. Сухроб учится в Национальном Университете Таджикистана. Он учится в факультете Экономика и управление. Сухроб учится отлично и активно участвует в общественной жизни университета. Его учителя гордятся Сухробом, и его однокурсники очень любят его. Он учится упорно для того, чтобы получить хорошее образование и в будущем стать высококвалифицированным специалистом. Он еще не женат и живет с родителями. Сухроб не в состоянии оплатить за учебный договор. С такой целью он обратился за займом. Он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Suhrob is nineteen years old. He is a third year student at the Tajikistan State University. He studies Economics and Government. Suhrob is an excellent student and actively participates in the social life of the university. His teachers are proud of him and his college mates love him very much. He studies hard so he can get a good education and become a highly skilled professional in the future. He is not married yet and lives with parents. Suhrob is not able to pay for his tuition. He has come for a loan with this purpose. Suhrob is asking for a loan to pay for the university tuition. He is waiting for your generosity and hopes for your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for tuition.

loans.name: Gloria Isabel

texts.es:
Gloria, está acompañada, vive con sus cinco hijos y su compañero de vida, hace mucho ella aprendió hacer pupusas junto a su madre, pero hoy en día ella es la encargada de administrarlo y su madre solo la apoya en las labores, Por el momento no se les ha presentado ninguna dificultad para realizar esta actividad.
 Invertirá en materia prima para su pupuseria, comprar  chicharrón, frijol, maíz,  quesillo, aderezos y mejorar  el local para servirle mejor a sus clientes,  así poder aumentar más el ingreso, atraer a más clientes cumplir con los compromisos de la deuda.
Su sueño es ayudarle a su esposo en los gastos de alimentación, educación de sus hijos, ampliar más el negocio y  seguir proporcionando una fuente de empleo a su madre.
texts.en:
Gloria has a partner and lives with him and their five children.  A long time ago, Gloria learned to make "pupusas" (a corn tortilla stuffed with cheese, meat and beans) from her mother.  However, Gloria is now in charge of the business and her mother just supports her with some of the work.  So far, Gloria has had no major problems in this work.

Gloria will invest this loan in buying supplies for her "pupusa" stall.  She will buy pork, corn, tortillas with cream cheese filling, and seasoning, and will improve her promises in order to offer better service to her customers.  With this she can increase her income, attract more customers, and pay off her debt.

Gloria's dream is to be able to help her husbands with the costs of feeding and educating their children.  She wants to expand her business and to continue to provide her mother with work.

loans.use: to buy pork, corn, tortillas with cream cheese filling, and seasoning, and to improve her premises.

loans.name: Hilda Antonia

texts.es:
Hilda, es una señora casada, vive con su esposo sus hijos ya son independientes, es la administradora y dueña de un comedor, que lo tiene ubicado en una zona muy transitada lo que le facilita atraer a nuevos clientes, es un oficio que aprendió de su madre, ella atiende su negocio de 6:00 a.m. a 8:00 p.m., por su experiencia no ha tenido problema para administrarlo.
 Necesita capital para invertirlo en la compra de carnes, pollo, pescado, verduras y otros ingredientes para tener bien surtido el inventario del comedor,  espera aumentar más el local para darle un mejor servicio a sus clientes generar más ingresos, apoyar a su esposo  en los gastos de la casa y pagar con buen record el préstamo .
Su sueño es mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su esposo e incrementar las ganancias.
texts.en:
Hilda is a married woman who lives with her husband. Her children are grown-up. She owns and runs a cafeteria which is located in a very busy area, which helps her to attract new customers. This is a role that she learned from her mother. She works from 6:00am until 8:00pm and has not had problems running her business. 
She needs capital to buy meats, chicken, fish, vegetables, and other ingredients to have her cafeteria well supplied. She hopes to expand her premises so that she can offer her customers a better service and generate more income to help her husband with the household expenses and to repay her loan promptly.
Her dream is to improve her quality of life and that of her husband and to increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy meat, chicken, fish, vegetables, and other things.

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es: El señor Estaban es casado y tiene hijos pequeños que aun dependen de él, vive en una comunidad muy alejada de la ciudad, trabajaba en la agricultura desde muy joven, pero al no poder transportar sus productos por la lejanía de su pueblo decidió dedicarse a la minería, a consecuencia de eso sufre un problema de salud que le impide continuar trabajando en ese rubro, razón por la que quiere volver a dedicarse a la agricultura, es por eso que solicita un crédito de  Bs. 10000 para comprar semillas y abonos, con el fin de tener una fuente de ingresos económicos y sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en: Estaban is married and has small children who are dependent on him. He lives in a community that is very far away from the city. He worked in agriculture from a very early age. But, he couldn't transport his produce because of the remoteness of his village. So, he decided to work as a miner instead. As a consequence of this, he suffered a health problem that meant he could no longer work in this role. This is why he wants to return to agriculture and why he is requesting a loan of $1,475 to buy seeds and fertilizer. His goal is to have a source of income and to bring up his family.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: José Raúl

texts.es:
José de 29 años de edad,  estudio hasta  3º grado, ya que sus padres se separaron, cuando el tenia aproximadamente 9 años, y su madre no lograba cubrir, los gastos del hogar. Así que decidió trabajar, para ayudar a su madre con dichos gastos, y así contribuir, para que ella terminara de ayudar a sus dos hijas menores.  Su esposa, tiene una pequeña tienda, han procreado 2 hijos quines asisten a la escuela. Ademas, vive con él sus suegros, pero no depende de él.


José  ha sido pescador toda su vida, puesto que nació cerca de una de las mejores playas de nuestro país. Y desde la edad de 10 años, inicio con la aventura, de adentrarse en el océano, junto a su tío, para realizar la pesca, y fue con él con quien aprendió esta actividad. Sin embargo, hay temporadas en la que la pesca, no es muy buena, y los ingresos para mantener a su familia, se ven reducidos en gran manera, y es así, que hace ocho meses, josé inicio con el negocio de criar pollos de engorde. La pequeña granja la tiene en el terreno de su casa y le dedica gran parte de su tiempo, en las horas que no esta  pescando.


El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para mejorar las instalaciones de la granja de pollos, para ofrecerles una estancia adecuada, para que no sufran de demasiado stress calorico. Ademas, comprara concentrados, vitaminas, vacunas, para brindarles un buen manejo profiláctico. Así también mejorar los comederos y bebederos.

Los sueños y metas que quisiera conseguir y lograr José son: primero tener un lugar propio donde vivir y a la vez, construir su casa, también desea ayudar a que sus hijos se preparen academicamente. El préstamo sera de mucha ayuda, porque así, no dependerá de la pesca, y los ingresos no solo dependerán de esa actividad, así mismo lograra, tener fuente de donde cancelar el crédito.
texts.en:
29 year old José only studied through the 3rd grade as his parents separated when he was about 9 years old and his mother wasn't able to cover the household expenses. So, he decided to work to help his mother with those expenses so that she could keep helping his two younger sisters. His wife has a small store and they have 2 children who are in school. His in-laws also live with him but aren't economically dependent on him. 
José has been a fisherman all his life as he was born close to one of the best beaches in our country. And, when he was 10 years old, he began the adventure of going out to sea with his uncle to fish. It was his uncle who taught him this job. However, there are seasons when the fishing isn't good and his income, which he needs to support his family, is greatly reduced. For this reason, 8 months ago, José began a business raising chickens. He has his small farm in the field by his house and he dedicates a large part of his time to it when he is not fishing. 
He will use the loan that he is requesting to improve the chicken coops so that they have adequate accommodation, and so that they don't suffer caloric stress. He will also buy concentrate, vitamins, and vaccines to provide good prophylactic management. He will also improve their food and drink bowls. 
The dream and goals that he would like to achieve are: firstly, to have his own place to live in and, at the same time, to build his house. He also wants to help his children to be academically prepared. The loan will be of great help because he won't be dependent on fishing and his income won't depend solely on this. Likewise, he will have a source of income to repay the loan.

loans.use: to improve his chicken coops; to buy concentrate, vitamins, and vaccines; to provide good prophylactic management. And to improve the food and water bowls.

loans.name: María Paula

texts.es:
María de 31 años de edad,  no tubo la oportunidad de estudiar, ya que sus padres fueron de escasos recursos económicos y vivían en medio de una pobreza que los golpeaba grandemente. Así que esa problema afecto a María y sus hermanos, a que no fueran a la escuela. Es madre soltera, su hijo tiene seis años y ya asiste a segundo grado. 


María conoce el trabajo de la agricultura, desde que tenia 12 años de edad, cuando junto con sus padres salia a trabajar, para así tener asegurado el maíz y los frijoles, para la temporada de verano. Ahora siembra 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y frijol. La cual esta a un kilómetro de su casa, y el camino lo recorre en bicicleta. Trabaja de 6 a 11 de la mañana, y recibe ayuda de sus hermanos.


El préstamo sera utilizado, para terminar de obtener el maíz, el cual es necesario que sea desgranado, para luego ser almacenado. Pero eso tiene un costo, y con el otorgamiento del préstamo María, podrá tener efectivo para cancelar los gastos del proceso de desgrane del producto.


María quisiera mejorar las condiciones de su casa, así podrá estar en un ambiente mas confortable. También, le gustaría tener una venta de granos básicos en el mercado. Ademas de eso, ayudara a que su hijo continué estudiando, y pueda prepararse academicamente.
texts.en:
María is 31 years old.  She did not have the opportunity to study as her parents had very little money and they lived in serious poverty.  This problem affected María and her siblings as they could not go to school.  María is a single mother.  Her son is six years old and in second grade.

María has been learning about farming since she was 12 years old when, alongside her parents, she went out to work.  This guaranteed that there would be a crop of corn and beans for the summer season.  Now, María sows beans and corn on 7000 square metres of land, to be found a kilometre from her home.  María arrives there by bicycle.  María works from 6am until 11am, and receives help from her brothers.

This loan will used to finish the corn growing process as it needs to be husked before being store.  This is not free but with this loan María will have the cash in order to cover the costs of husking the corn.

María would like to improve her home and make it more comfortable.  She would also like to have a stall selling basic grains in the market.  In addition to this María will continue to help her son to continue in school, so that he can have an academic education.

loans.use: to pay for the costs of husking corn.

loans.name: Maria Silvia

texts.es:
María, se decidió por otro préstamo porque necesita invertir en su granja comprando más pollos, concentrados y vitaminas para alimentarlos, ya que con el préstamo anterior obtuvo buenas ganancias, ofreció más productos a sus clientes y también cumplió con sus cuotas.
Su núcleo familiar sigue igual, todos se encuentran saludables y trabajando junto a ella para salir adelante, su negocio es más amplio,
texts.en:
Maria is requesting a new loan to further invest in her chicken farm. She will use it to buy more chickens and nutritionally balanced feed and vitamins for them. Maria says that she made a good profit with the previous loan, and that her business has grown. She was able to offer her customers more products and meet her loan payments too. 

Maria says that her family is the same. Everyone is healthy and continues to work with her to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy more chickens, nutritionally balanced feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Wilmer Fernando

texts.es:
Wilmer nació en la parroquia Toacazo de la provincia de Latacunga, perteneciente a la República del Ecuador, esta zona se caracteriza por sus habitantes que se dedican a la crianza y venta de animales menores y ganado de leche y de carne, Wilmer tiene24 años de edad,  es soltero, vive en casa propia con sus padres.
Wilmer se caracteriza por ser un joven, emprendedor y ha seguido los pasos de sus padres en la actividad de la agricultura y ganadería ya que él también se dedica a la crianza de ganado y venta de leche cruda, para él es muy satisfactorioy gratificante el poder ayudar en su casa con los gastos.
Con el esfuerzo de sus padres pudo terminar la secundaria, por la difícil situación económica  de su familia tuvo que trabajar desde muy pequeñoy así poder ser un gran apoyo para él y su familia. Aprendió de esta actividad ya que es muy común en la zona, por ser un sector rural, trabaja de 6 a 8 horas diarias en el cuidado de los animales.
Se le hace un poco difícil el transportar su ganado para las diferentes ferias ya que no cuenta con un transporte propio para ello, pero pese a esto no se ha hecho mayor problema, al contrario le ha motivado para salir adelante por el bien de él y el de su familia.
Por el momento solicita un crédito de para poder adquirir una vaca lechera, la misma que servirá para obtener más rentabilidad utilidad con la venta de la leche. En esta ocasión Wilmer y su familia quieren extender un sincero agradecimiento y felicitación a Fundación Alternativa en Ecuador y a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal.
texts.en:
Wlimer was born in the parish of Toacazo in the province of Latacugna, which belongs to the Republic of Ecuador. This area is characterized by it's people who work raising and selling small animals and milk and meat cows. Wilmer is 24 years old, single, and lives in his own home with his parents. 
Wilmer can be characterized as being young and enterprising, and he has followed in his parents' footsteps by going into agriculture as he works raising cows and selling the raw milk. It is very satisfying and gratifying to him that he can help with the household expenses. Thanks to his parents efforts, he was able to finish high school but, because of the family's difficult economic situation, he had to work from a very young age and be a support to his family. He learned this work which is very common in the area as it is a rural sector. He works 6-8 hours a day caring for the animals. 
It is a little difficult for him to transport his livestock to the different markets as he doesn't have his own transportation. But, despite this, he has not had any major problems. On the contrary, it has motivated him to succeed for his wellbeing and that of his family. 
For the moment, he is requesting a loan to buy a milk cow, and this will enable him to make more profit from selling milk. On this occasion, Wilmer and his family want to extent their sincere gratitude and good wishes to Fundación Alternative in Ecuador and to Kiva for making possible this growth in their work and personal lives.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria, ha optado por mas capital y ampliar el negocio de venta de ropa, comprara camisas, pantalones, faldas y sandalias de diferentes estilos, colores y tallas para cumplir con la demanda sus clientes, con esto ella aprovechara la época de fin de año para aumentar sus ventas, con el préstamo ella  aumento su inventario y pudo trabajar sin ningún problema, aumento sus ganancias y cancelo las deudas.
Su sueño es ampliar el negocio para que sea más rentable y apoyar mucho más en los gastos de su casa.
texts.en:
Gloria has opted for more capital and growing her business selling clothes. She will buy shirts, pants, skirts, and sandals in various styles, colors, and sizes to meet the demands of her customers. With this, she will take advantage of the new year period to increase her sales. With the loan, she could increase her inventory and work without any problems, and increase her profits and cancel her debts. 
Her dream is to grow her business so that it becomes more profitable and of greater help with the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy shirts, pants, skirts, and sandals.

loans.name: El Pilon Group

texts.es: Carlos, tiene 25 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposa con quien tiene dos hijos y reside en el municipio de Gracias Lempira. Desde muy pequeño ha trabajado en la agricultura junto a su padre. Hace 5 años decidió por tener su propia finca de café, esta producción la vende en el mercado local. Ha solicitado un préstamo en forma grupal, su solicitud es por 5,000 Lempiras y lo va invertir en limpieza y fertilizantes para darle buena asistencia a su finca de café. El grupo se llama El Pilon, esta formado por cinco miembros, que viven en la misma comunidad y se dedican a la agricultura. El préstamo grupal es por 15,000 Lempiras y lo invertirán en fertilizar y limpiar el cultivo de café. en la foto se identifican así: a la izquierda esta Carlos, le sigue María Alejandrina, María de los Ángeles, Nancy y Danilo a la derecha.
texts.en: Carlos is 25 years old. He is in a common law marriage and has two children. He lives in the town of Gracias Lempira. since he was very young, he has worked as a farmer with his father. Five years ago, he decided to have his own coffee farm. he sells his harvest in the local market. He has asked for a group loan of 5,000 Lempiras and he is going to invest in clearing and fertilizing to help his coffee farm. The group is called El Pilon. It is made up of five members who live in the same community and work as farmers. The group loan is for 15,000 Lempiras and they will invest in fertilizing and clearing the coffee crops. They are in the photo as follows: on the left is Carlos, then María Alejandrina, María de los Ángeles, Nancy and Danilo on the right.

loans.use: to pay for clearing and to buy fertilizers to help  his coffee farm.

loans.name: Gloria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Gloria, es madre soltera, tiene un hijo, vive junto a su hijo y sus padres, debido a la necesidad de generar ingresos para cumplir con la responsabilidad que implica tener un hijo, decidió poner en práctica el oficio que aprendió de su madre, pues le enseño hacer pupusas su horario de atención a los clientes es de 4:00pm  a 7:00pm.
Necesita capital para poder comprar plancha para pupusas, chicharrón, quesillo, maíz, aceite, aderezos, servilletas etc. Y así generar más ganancias y dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
Ella desea darle una buena alimentación, salud y educación a su hijo, aportar más dinero a su hogar.
texts.en:
Gloria is a single mother. She has a son and lives with him and her parents. Out of necessity to generate income to fulfill the responsibility of having a child, she decided to ply the trade she learned from her mother. She taught her to make pupusas. She serves customers from 4:00 p.m.  to 7:00 p.m. She needs capital to buy a press for pupusas, pork cracklings, cheese curds, corn, oil, seasonings, napkins, etc. in order to generate more income and provide a better service to her customers.  

She wants to give her son a good education and contribute more money to her home.

loans.use: to buy a press for pupusas, pork cracklings, cheese curd, corn, oil, seasonings, napkins, etc.

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es:
Ana, ha optado por más capital para la mejora de su negocio de lo que es el comedor  e invertir en maíz, gas, arroz, carnes, pollo, mariscos etc. Y ofrecerles a sus clientes un nuevo menú para que queden satisfechos y que la sigan visitando. Con el crédito anterior ella mejoro el servicio para sus clientes, pudo dar mejor variedad de productos.
Ella apoya a su hijo en el estudio y desea darle un mejor estilo de vida, generar mejores ganancias y hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Ana chose to request more capital in order to improve her cafe  business and to invest in corn, gas, rice, meats, chicken, seafood, etc. She will offer her customers a new menu so that they stay satisfied and continue to visit. With the previous loan, she improved the service for her customers. She was able to offer  better quality products. 
She supports her son in his studies. She wants to give him a better lifestyle, improve her profits and grow her business.

loans.use: invest in corn, gas, rice, meat, chicken, seafood, etc.

loans.name: Kanchan

texts.en:
Kanchan is a very courageous 40-year-old woman with many hopes. She is a housewife of Dhupguri town and the mother of three children. She has received primary education. Her children are pursuing their studies. Two of them are pursuing bachelor in arts degrees and the other is in standard X (grade 10). 

Kanchan’s husband is a farmer. He has an agricultural business. They have land where her husband cultivates different seasonal vegetables and sells them to the market. Kanchan gives assistance to her husband in this work. 

Now they want to add potatoes to the vegetables they grow. She is requesting this loan to buy potato seeds, fertilizers and pesticides to cultivate potatoes and to avoid contamination by insects and diseases. 

In the future with the profit of her business she hopes to buy a cycle van which is used to carry vegetables to the market. This will further help their cultivation business. She hopes Kiva and BJS will give her extensive support in near future and produce a more helpful environment for her.

loans.use: To buy potato seeds, fertilizers and pesticides to cultivate potatoes.

loans.name: Filadelfo

texts.es:
Filadelfo de 70 años de edad, es una persona que no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, empezó a trabajar desde muy pequeño. Èl ya no tiene hijos a cargo,  todos son ya personas adultas. Vive junto a su esposa quien es ama de casa.  Filadelfo, es una persona  muy conocida en la comunidad.

Él se dedica a comercializar con mariscos en su localidad, este negocio lo tiene hace más de 30 años y lo aprendió de sus familiares, quienes también se dedicaban a este oficio. También, conoce de reparación de lanchas y es otra fuente de ingreso que posee.


El préstamo que esta solicitando, se utilizara en su totalidad en capital de trabajo, ya que le venden  producto (mariscos) a bajo precio y no quiere perder la oportunidad de hacer un buen negocio. El negocio mejorara al tener mayores ingresos. El señor tiene la necesidad de vender más, por la demanda de clientes que posee.


Sus sueños o aspiraciones son dejar un legado a sus hijos, un negocio sólido y rentable que les permita tener las condiciones necesarias, para cubrir las necesidades básicas. La idea es que su negocio cresca, que sean más las personas a quienes les venda productos y poder dar a conocer la variedad de alimentos que da el mar.
texts.en:
Filadelfo is 70 years old. He is someone who didn't have the opportunity to have an education and he started to work when he was very young.  He is no longer raising any children, as they are all adults. He lives with his wife who is a housewife. Filadelfo is a well known person in the community. 

He works selling seafood in his community. he has had this business for more than 30 years and learned it from relatives who also did this work. He also knows how to repair boats and this is another source of income. 

The loan he is asking for will all be used for working capital because they are selling the product (seafood) to him at a low price and he doesn't want to lose the opportunity to make a good deal. The business will improve with more income. He needs to sell more due to his customers' demand. 

His dreams and aspirations are to leave a legacy for his children, a profitable and solid business that will give the necessary conditions to have the basic necessities. The idea is for the business to grow so he will sell to more people and let people know about the variety of food there is in the ocean.

loans.use: to buy more seafood.

loans.name: Shaminah

texts.en:
Shaminah is 18 years old and lives in the town of Namutumba in the  region of Uganda. She has no children. For the past 2 years, Shaminah has been working hard to manage her business of selling charcoal. 

To help expand her business, Shaminah has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more sacks of charcoal and will help Shaminah to generate greater profits and pay her rent. Shaminah hopes that in the future she will be able to open a business selling vegetables. 

Shaminah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.


"

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal,

loans.name: Fransisca

texts.es: La señora Francisca tiene 30 años de edad, es soltera y tiene una hija dependiente, vive con sus padres en la comunidad Liriuni, es una persona trabajadora y responsable, dedicada a su actividad principal de confección de pantaletas para mujeres, de esta forma ella mantiene a su hija y le paga sus estudios. Para su negocio requiere un crédito de Bs. 10200 para la compra de tela como capital de operación. De esta forma mejorara su actividad económica y tendrá mayores ingresos a futuro.
texts.en: Francisca is 30 years old. She is single and she has a daughter. She lives with her parents in the Liriuni community. She is hardworking and responsible. She makes pants for women. With this business, she can take care of her daughter and pay for her studies. For her business, she needs a loan of 10,200 Bs. to purchase fabric as operating capital. She will be able to improve her business and she will have bigger earnings in the future.

loans.use: purchase fabric as operating capital

loans.name: Basanti

texts.en:
Basanti, age 43 is a homemaker who stays with her husband, Harendranath, in a small town of Dhupguri in Jalpaiguri. She and her husband both have completed their secondary education (grade 10). They are raising their four children together. All of them go to school; they are in class XII (grade 12), class X (grade 10) class VII (grade 7) and class IV (grade 4). 

Her husband has a cultivation business. They have their own land, which is near their home. Due to lack of finances, Basanti and her husband couldn’t use their land, so she decided to take a loan for potato cultivation. Potatoes are in demand in West Bengal and also throughout India, and her husband also has knowledge about this business. She hopes it can be a profitable for them.

Basanti wants this loan to buy potato seeds and fertilizers and to cover labour cost.

In the future she hopes to purchase more land for her agricultural business, which will improve the financial condition of their family. She hopes her children receive a good education and do not suffer in the future and can live happily throughout their lives. She is very much thankful to BJS and Kiva for funding her loan.

loans.use: To buy potato seeds and fertilizers, and to cover labour costs for cultivating potatoes.

loans.name: Swapna

texts.en:
Swapna is 35 years old and her husband is 45 years old. Both Swapna and her husband have passed class VI (grade 6). Swapna is the mother of four children. Three are receiving education while the other one is too young to receive education. 

Swapna is a housewife and her husband is a farmer. Her husband, Bablu, cultivates different crops in the field, but the income is not enough. 

They decided to take a loan from BJS so that they can cultivate other crops in the field. The loan they have taken will be used for buying seeds and fertilizer for potato cultivation so that they can enhance their business and can cultivate potatoes. According to them, potato cultivation is a profitable business. They are thankful to BJS for the loan support.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer for potato cultivation.

loans.name: Santana

texts.en:
Santana is 40 years old and her husband is 44. Both are illiterate and just know how to sign their names. Santana and her husband have three children. Two of them receive education and the other one is working as a mason. Santana is a housewife and her husband is a farmer. Both the father and the son work and earn money but Santana wants to earn more on her own so that their family can run more smoothly. 

They have taken a loan from BJS to purchase a cow so that Santana can sell milk and milk products in the market and can earn more and can help the family. She is very much thankful to BJS for helping them. Santana hopes to shift to a pakka house (a house made of brick, cement, etc.) with the money they earn as profit from selling milk and milk products.

loans.use: To purchase a cow to sell milk and milk products in the market.

loans.name: Jarina

texts.en:
Jarina is a 40-year-old woman and the mother of three children. She lives with her husband and three children. Her husband, age 48, is a mason. Both of them are illiterate and just know how to sign their names. Only one of the children receives education in class VII (Grade 7). A second is engaged in agriculture and the other works as a daily worker outside of their hometown.

They live in Patkidaha village in the small town of Dhupguri. The house they live in is a kachha one (made of mud and straw) and is in very bad condition. Jarina has taken a loan to purchase a cow so she can sell milk and other milk products in the market. She wants to start a dairy business as it is profitable and has a great demand in the present market.

loans.use: To purchase a cow for selling dairy products.

loans.name: Immam

texts.en:
Immam is a 41-year-old married woman. She is a mother of four children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. 

She has been successfully running a small general store at the corner of her house. She has two years of experience in this field. Her son assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts in years.  

She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future. She is in her fourth loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Zenab

texts.en:
Zenab is a 53-year-old married woman who has been selling milk for many years. She is the mother of seven children; two of them are school-going. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food, and clothing.  She has two buffaloes and two cows in milk. She sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough for her to lead a decent life.

She has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life. It’s her fourth year with Kashf Foundation; she is happy. Now she has requested a loan of Rs 40,000 to purchase one more cow and feed for its calves. She hopes to increase the production capacity of the milk which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow and feed for its calves.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Rehana is a 44-year-old, married woman. She works from home as a tailor. She has been in this line of work for 8 months now and is proud to be contributing to her household income. When she was not earning, her family was going through a severe financial crisis that compelled her to use her stitching skills in a productive manner. Her husband was the sole bread winner of the family, and due to limited resources, none of their children was sent to school. 

Rehana's hard work helped her establish a good clientele, but she was having difficulty fulfilling large orders. That is when her sister advised her to borrow from Kashf Foundation. She is in her 6th loan cycle. Currently, she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase spools of thread along with packs of buttons, needles and laces. She dreams of expanding her business to provide a better standard of living for her family members.

loans.use: to purchase spools of thread along with packs of buttons, needles and laces.

loans.name: Hamida

texts.en:
Hamida is a 43-year-old, married woman and the mother of four children. She has been involved in the business of selling cloths for a period of about two years. She buys cloths of different fabrics in various colors and designs from the wholesale market and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. 

Hamida is requesting a 40,000 PKR loan from the Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of cloths in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and she plans to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family members. She is in her 6th loan cycle with a good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloths in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Kaneez

texts.en: Kaneez, 40, is a married woman who has sold milk for many years. She has two calves and one cow to milk. She sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough to give her a decent life. She is the mother of seven and is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing.  She has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life. Currently, she is requesting a loan of 20,000 PKR to purchase one more cow and buy feed for its calves. She hopes to increase her milk production capacity, which ultimately helps to generate more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow and buy feed for its calves.

loans.name: Asmat

texts.en: Asmat, 46, is a married woman and the mother of three children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all of her household's expenses, so she initiated her business selling milk. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing high-quality milk in her area. To improve her business, she requested a loan of 20,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo. This will help her to increase her sales, which will ultimately help to generate more income for her.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Elvin

texts.en:
Elvin is 27 year of age and single. He has raised vegetables like potatoes, carrots, and pumpkins in his garden for the last 2  years. He also breeds cattle for meat purposes. Both businesses bring him a stable income. However, a shortage of water resources for the animals and irrigation prevents his businesses from growing.

When Elvin heard about water loans, he was extremely excited and applied for a 2,000 AZN loan. He will use this loan to pay for special equipment like a tractor for making a water channel and for workers who will dig the land. Elvin awaits your support.

loans.use: to pay for special equipment like a tractor for making a water channel.

loans.name: G.w

texts.en:
G.w is 36 years old and lives in the town of Abaita Ababiri in the  region of Kampala West in Uganda. He is married and has 6 children, who are all currently in school. For the past 10 years, G.w has been working hard to manage his stone quarrying business, which sells building stones. 

To help expand his business, G.w has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more hardware items and will help G.w to generate greater profits and increase on stock and income. G.w hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his business. 

G.w is a member of BRAC Uganda's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs, like G.w, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more hardware items.

loans.name: Trinh

texts.en:
Trinh is 43 years old and is married. She has two sons and lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a painter.

She has run a general store at her house for 12 years. She sells milk, beverages, stationery, confectioneries and some household electrical goods. She intends to use her loan to buy many kinds of products to sell such as eggs, sugar and sanitation items.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and save money for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy eggs, sugar and sanitation items.

loans.name: Milton

texts.en:
Milton is 30 years old and lives in the town of Entebbe in the region of Kampala west in Uganda. He is married and has two children with neither of them currently in school. 

For the past three years, Milton has been working hard to manage his timber factory, which sells timber. To help expand his business, Milton has requested a loan of 2,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more stock, and it will help Milton to generate greater profits and complete his house and improve his standard of living. Milton hopes that in the future he will be able to increase sales and profits. 

Milton is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Milton who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.


"

loans.use: to buy more stock.

loans.name: Baxtiyar

texts.en:
Baxtiyar is 30 years old and married, the father of one daughter.

Baxtiyar has raised vegetables like potatoes, carrots, and pumpkins in his garden for the past two years. He also breeds cattle for meat purposes. Both businesses bring him a stable income of AZN 250. 

However, there is a problem that prevents him from growing his business: the shortage of water for animals and for irrigation.  There are still some utility problems with the water supply in his region. 

When Baxtiya heard about water loans, he was extremely excited and applied for an AZN 1,900 loan. He will use this loan to pay for special equipment, like a tractor, for making a water channel and for workers to dig the land.

loans.use: to pay for special equipment, like a tractor, and laborers for digging a water channel

loans.name: David Remberto

texts.es:
David, tuvo muy buenos cambios económicos con la inversión del crédito anterior, su producción fue mayor, sus granos son de mucha calidad. En esta oportunidad está solicitando capital para adquirir abono, pesticidas, plaguicidas, etc., son insumos necesarios para la siembra de maíz y frijol, pues de esa actividad dependen los ingresos necesarios para su hogar.
Su familia está en mejores condiciones, le dan el apoyo y los ánimos para salir adelante, sigue teniendo el mismo número de integrantes.
texts.en:
David had many good economic changes with the investment of the previous loan. His production was better, his seeds are good quality. With this opportunity, he is requesting capital to purchase fertilizer, pesticides, insecticides, etc. which are necessary supplies for planting corn and beans. The  earnings necessary for the household depend on this business. 
His family is in better conditions. They give him support and  encouragement to succeed. They still have the same number of members.

loans.use: purchase fertilizers, pesticides and insecticides

loans.name: Margaret's Group

texts.en:
ID-Ghana, a partner of Kiva in Accra, the coastal part of Ghana, is very pleased to present to you Felicia and Margaret. They are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to ID-Ghana to apply for a loan of GHS 1,700 for the group members to invest in their respective businesses. 

Margaret is the featured leader of this group. Margaret is 51 years old, married, and has two children. Her husband is a typist and both children are grown up and are on their own. 

Margaret has sold tomatoes, green peppers, beans and other vegetables for eight years now. With the help of this loan, Margaret will invest in her business by buying tomatoes, green peppers, beans, onions etc. in order to boost her business.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes, green peppers, beans, onions, etc. in order to boost her business.

loans.name: Lubna

texts.en:
Lubna is 39 years old and married, with six children. She is striving hard to meet their demands including food, clothing, and health. 

Her husband is also a tailor by profession, but his income is not sufficient to meet the daily expenditures of the family, so she also started her business of sewing clothes in her house to contribute in the family income. She is well familiar with the stitching techniques.  

To complete the orders of her customers on time she requested a loan of PKR 30,000 to buy a new sewing machine with a stock of threads and packs of buttons in various colors. So then she will be able to meet the demands of her customers without fail.  

She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business. She is in her third loan cycle with a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine with threads and packs of buttons in various colors.

loans.name: Rano

texts.en:
Rano is a kind woman. She is single. She is very hard-working and kind-natured. She has a lot of friends and all of them love her very much.
 
Rano has been farming for six years, producing wheat and potatoes. Her products are sold at the local market in the city. 


She lives with her parents and brother. Her brother has not any job. He is going to go to Russia for finding a job. 

Rano must to help him because he has no money to buy an air ticket. She is asking for a loan of  TJS 1,500 to buy an air ticket for her brother. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy an air ticket for her brother so he can go look for work in Russia

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 43 years old and lives in the town of Kajjansi in the region of Kampala west in Uganda. He is married and has three children, with two of them currently in school. For the past five years, David has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells household items and foodstuffs. 

To help expand his business, David has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to to buy more items, and will help David to generate greater profits and to provide better quality services. David hopes that, in the future, he will be able to provide high quality products and expand his business. 

David is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like David who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more items for his retail store.

loans.name: Azra

texts.en:
Azra has successfully built her business of a general store with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. 

She has become famous for selling good quality products in her community and makes enough to contribute to the family income. Previously, she took a loan to stock her store with the required things. Now, she has requested a loan of 30,000 PKR [Pakistani rupees] to purchase stock of grains, rice and sugar. It will help her to meet the demand of her customers without fail. 

She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend it on the betterment of her family members. She is in her third loan cycle with a good repayment history.

loans.use: to purchase stock of grains, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Nadeem

texts.en:
Nadeem is a 42-year-old married woman; she has been in the business of tailoring for a period of about of about five years to support her husband. She accepted the fact if her husband worked alone for their family, they would not be able to meet the expenses of the household. That is why she started tailoring at home to support her family well. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business. 

At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. Now, she has requested a loan of 15,000 PKR [Pakistani rupees] to purchase more reels of threads, along with packs of buttons and laces. In this way, she will be able to meet with the increasing demand. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. 

Nadeem hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of threads, along with packs of buttons and laces.

loans.name: Surriya

texts.en:
Surriya is 43 years old and a vigorous, married woman. She has had a business doing hand-embroidery for many years. She is passionate about her work, and client demand is strong. But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Her husband is employed as a salesperson in a grocery store, but he does not earn enough to support his family well. 

Surriya’s embroidery patterns are very popular on her street, and she is the best earning resource in her household. She is a mother of four children. 

She wants to grow her business. She requested a loan of 35,000 PKR [Pakistani rupees] to purchase more spools of threads, along with packs of sequins, pearls and glittering material to meet the increasing demand. She shared her dream of running a training center for girls of her village and is also interested in opening her own shop in the market to display her work.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of threads, along with packs of sequins, pearls and glittering material.

loans.name: María Milagro

texts.es:
María de 50 años de edad,  vive junto a su hijo, quien se dedica al comercio de mariscos (pescador); en cambio la señora labora en una maquila ubicada en la localidad.  María no termino la educación,  por falta de recursos económicos.

Ella posee más de 5 años de trabajar en la maquila y el hijo es pescador hace 7 años. La señora vive a 2 kilómetros del lugar de trabajo y se transporta en autobús. 

El crédito lo utilizara, para la compra de trasmallos (redes), para con ello mejorar el tipo de producto(mariscos). Al tener mejores herramientas sus capacidad de pesca,  será mayor y por consiguiente sus ingresos aumentaran. La necesidad a cubrir será tener un mejor equipo de pesca.


Sus aspiraciones  están centradas,  en ayudar a su hijo a salir adelante en la vida y que tenga las condiciones necesarias para hacerle frente a la vida. Con las ganancias,  pretende mejorar su vivienda y su apero para que su familia tenga las condiciones óptimas para vivir.
texts.en:
María is 50 years old. She lives with her son who is a fisherman. María works at a factory in town. She did not finish her education due to a lack of economic resources. 

She has worked for more than five years at the factory. Her son has been a fisherman for seven years. She lives two kilometers from her workplace and she travels there by bus. 

The loan will be utilized to purchase driftnets. With these nets, he can improve his products. With better tools, his fishing capacity will be bigger and his earnings will increase. The necessity to cover will mean better fishing equipment.

Her aspirations are concentrated on helping her son move forward in life and having the necessary conditions to cope with life. With the earnings, she hopes to improve her home and tools so that her family will have optimal conditions for living.

loans.use: purchase nets in order to improve the types of fish products

loans.name: Zoila Esperanza

texts.es:
Zoila, se dedica a vender tamales, es una madre que disfruta mucho estar con sus hijos, sobre sus hombros lleva  la responsabilidad de su hogar el ser madre soltera no ha sido impedimento para salir adelante. Su oficio lo aprendió de su madre, cuando ella tiene su venta preparada inicia el recorrido por su zona residencial hasta finalizarla. 
Solicita capital para comprar elotes, bolsas, aceite y algunas laminas, teniendo la materia prima necesaria podrá trabajar ella espera aumentar sus ventas y cancelar sin ningún problema su deuda.
Sueña con ser la dueña de su propio local para ofrecer más productos a sus clientes, su prioridad es tener los recursos necesarios para que sus hijos sean personas profesionales.
texts.en:
Zoila earns a living selling tamales. 

She is a mother who enjoys spending time with her children. She carries the responsibility of her family on her shoulders. Being a single mother has not impeded her ability to succeed. 

She learned her trade from her mother. Once she has prepared her products, she begins her tour of her neighbourhood until she sells out. 

She is requesting a loan to buy corn, bags, oil and some wrappers. Having the necessary raw materials, she will be able to work. She hopes to increase her sales and repay her debt without any problems. 

She dreams of owning her own shop to offer more products to her customers. Her priority is acquiring the necessary resources so that her children can become career professionals.

loans.use: to buy corn, bags, oil and some wrappers.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Miriam is 49 years old and lives in the town of Abaita Ababiri in the region of Kampala west in Uganda. She is married, with five children. 

For the past five years, Miriam has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells household items. 

To help expand her business, Miriam has requested a loan of UGX 2,500,000 from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to increase her inventory in the shop.  It will help Miriam to generate greater profits and to generate family income. 

Miriam hopes that in the future she will be able to to have a bigger shop. 

Miriam is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Miriam who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: To increase her inventory In her shop

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, who is 46 years old, lives in Caldwell with her husband and three children, who are in school and between the ages of 10 and 20. 

For the past ten years she has been selling rice, soft drinks, palm oil, and other items.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, palm oil, soft drinks, and other items for her business.

She hopes to build a new home for her children in the future to come.

loans.use: to buy more rice, palm oil, soft drinks, and other items for her business

loans.name: Jayanti

texts.en:
Jayanti is a 41-year-old housewife and lives in a small village, Magurmari, in Dhupguri with her husband Harishankar, 47 years old, and their five children.  Jayanti passed class VIII (grade 8) and Harishankar class XI  (Grade 11).  Her husband Harishankar is a farmer.

As a parent of five children, Jayanti works hard to support her family.  Three of the children are in school: class IV (Grade 4), class V (Grade 5) and Class XI (Grade 11).  The fourth is engaged in agriculture and the last one is a mason.  They own a 'kaccha' house, made of mud and straw.  

Jayanti has taken a loan to start cultivation of beans and wants to sell them in the local market.  Her future plan is to upgrade their standard of living with the profit earned from the business. She is very grateful to BJS and Kiva for giving her this opportunity.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers for cultivating beans

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 39-year -old  housewife.   Her husband Moniruddin is 50 years old.  She lives with her husband and three children in their town of Dhupguri in a 'kachha' house made of mud and straw.  Both Fatima and her husband are illiterate and can only sign their names. Her husband is engaged in agriculture. The earnings of her husband are not sufficient to cover their household expenses.

Fatima gives education to her three children with great difficulty. One of the children is in class VIII (Grade 8), the second one is in Class XII (Grade 12), and the third one is in college, so it is very difficult for Fatima to meet their educational and food expenses.  Fatima wants to earn money by herself and she decided to start a dairy business.  She has taken a loan to purchase a cow and sells milk in her local market. The demand for milk is very high in her locality. Her dream is to meet the educational expenses for her children from her profit.

loans.use: To purchase a cow for selling dairy products

loans.name: Sailya

texts.en:
Sailya is 35 years old and her husband is 45 years old. Sailya is illiterate, just knowing how to sign her name, and her husband has passed Madyamik (grade 10). Sailya is a housewife and her husband is a farmer. They have two children and both children are receiving an education. 

From the beginning both Sailya and her husband have faced lots of problems running the family, but still they have not lost their hope to survive. The income from their farming business is not too good. Due to lack of capital they couldn’t buy a variety of seeds for cultivation. They have taken out a loan to buy seeds for potatoes so that they can cultivate potatoes and earn money as this is a very profitable business. They hope that someday they will overcome all the odds and will be able to live a healthy life.

loans.use: To purchase seeds for potato cultivation

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is 30 years old and lives in the town of Abaita Ababiri in the region of Kampala West in Uganda. She is married and has 3 children who are all currently in school. 

For the past 4 years, Harriet has been working hard to manage her boutique business, which sells clothes. To help expand her business, Harriet has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more stock, and will help Harriet to generate greater profits for the business. Harriet hopes that in the future she will be able to expand on her business. 

Harriet is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Harriet who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more stock

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia is 39 years old, a vigorous, married lady; she has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet the daily demand of her customers. 

For this reason she requested a loan of Rs 30,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of thread in different colors with packs of laces, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenues so she may able to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her second loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors with packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Stella's Group

texts.en:
These members are from Teshie-Accra, a town in the coastal region of Ghana. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to ID-Ghana, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of 2,000 GHS as a total amount for the group. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. They are into flour, yam, towels and bed sheets. 

Stella is the featured leader of this group. The 55-year-old is married with one child. Stella has been a businesswoman for 8 years now. She sells bed sheets and towels. With her share of this loan, she will buy more bed sheets and towels, and sell to customers. This is the forth loan cycle with ID-Ghana and they repaid previous loans promptly without trouble.

loans.use: to buy more bed sheets and towels to sell to customers.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina is 37 years old and the married mother of two children. 

She has been working as a tailor since 17 years old.  In 2012, she started her current business to help her husband, who works in agriculture, in making a living and covering their expenses.

Georgina is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy tailoring needs, in addition to requested textiles. This loan will help her a lot in developing her business and replying to her customers' needs.

This is Georgina's second loan cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower.  Through her previous loan, she was capable of developing her business in a well-managed way.

Georgina is working hard to expand her business through buying extra tailoring machines and recruiting someone to help her in developing it.

loans.use: To buy tailoring needs, in addition to textiles

loans.name: Akkyz

texts.ru: Аккыз 54 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Аккыз - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Аккыз занимается животноводством, стартовав 22 года назад, с покупки скота на 6,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Аккыз, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы. Ежемесячный доход составляет 3,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Аккыз обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Аккыз планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на покупку мебели.
texts.en:
Akkyz is 54 years old, married, and she and her husband are raising 4 children.  Akkyz has a secondary level education, and her family's main source of income is the animal husbandry business that she started 22 years ago with the purchase of 6,000 somi (KGS) worth of cattle.   As a result of her hard work, today Akkyz has two milking cows and her monthly income is 3,000 somi (KGS).  

With an aim to further developing her business, Akkyz applied to the microfinance bank Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 30,000 somi (KGS) to increase the size of her herd.  Akkyz plans to use the profits from in loan to further increase the size of her herd and to save up to buy furniture.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Estela

texts.es: Estela, a sus 44 años de edad, siendo una afectada más del desempleo en la ciudad, decidió iniciar su propio negocio en sociedad con su madre, montó hace 1 semana un almacén de variedades, trabaja sola todos los días en un horario de 9:00 am a 7:00 pm; la idea surgió de la necesidad de generar ingresos para aportar a la economía de su hogar y velar por el bienestar de su familia que está conformada por su esposo y su único hijo. Su espíritu emprendedor, el empeño y las ganas de salir adelante la motivan para solicitar el apoyo del crédito, ya que quiere invertir en surtido al por mayor (gafas de sol, cosméticos, juguetería, productos de aseo personal, entre otros) para abastecer su negocio y tener más variedad de productos disponibles que satisfagan las necesidades de sus clientes, lo que le permitirá ampliar sus ventas y los ingresos que recibe por su labor. Estela desea hacer de su negocio una fuente de ingresos rentable para que le permita percibir los recursos económicos suficientes para dar a su hijo una excelente educación y apoyar a su esposo con la economía del hogar, además de disfrutar un mejor bienestar y condiciones de vida al lado de los que ama.
texts.en:
Estela, 44, has been affected by unemployment in the city so she decided to start her own business with her mother. One week ago, she opened a small shop with a variety of products. She works by herself every day from 9:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m. The idea came from the need to earn income to support her household and watch over her family's well-being. Her family consists of her husband and their only son.

Estela has an enterprising spirit. Her efforts and her desire to move forward motivated her to request this loan. She wants to invest in stocking wholesale products (sunglasses, cosmetics, toys, personal hygiene products, and more) to have a greater variety of products available to satisfy her customers' needs. This will allow her to increase sales and also the income she receives for her work.

Estela wants to make her business a successful source of income so she can continue to provide sufficient economic resources to give her son an excellent education and to support her husband with household expenses. She also hopes to enjoy a better quality of life along with those she loves.

loans.use: to invest in stocking wholesale products (sunglasses, cosmetics, toys, personal hygiene products, and more).

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary  is a single mother of four children, and three of her children go to school. She also takes care of an additional family member, a young brother. 

She has a business selling green bananas, and has been in this business for 10 years. She has applied for a loan of 1,500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas. She generates additional income from a pub. She works in a shop, and sells on a retail basis only for seven days out of every week.  Her major business challenges include thieves and seasonality. 

Her goals and aspirations include becoming a wholesaler and also buying a plot of land and building a house. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of low interest charged.  She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: Flavia

texts.en:
Flavia is a single mother of four children and all her children go to school.  She also takes care of additional family members (her younger brother). She has a retail shop and has been   in this business for 10 years. She has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more creates of soda, mineral water, boxes of packed juice and biscuits.  She works at the market six days out of every week. She generates additional income from selling used clothes.  

Flavia's major business challenges include seasonality and thieves.  She is aspiring of owning a fully stocked retail shop and also buying a plot of land and building a house.  She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of low interest charged. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water.  Her monthly expenses  includes school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more crates of soda, packed juice, boxes of mineral water and biscuits.

loans.name: Hala

texts.en:
This is Hala, who is 52 years old and a resident of Lebanon. She is married, and with her husband she manages the living costs. Hala works really hard to constantly provide income for their everyday expenses. 

She has operated a bakery since 2011, where she produces fresh, delicious pastries. Her store is adjacent to her house, and her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. 

To help her continue her operations, Hala is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to buy the baking tools she needs to increase her production. In the future, she is looking to further expand her business and increase its capital.

loans.use: to buy the baking tools she needs to increase production

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
José, se dedica a comprar café para luego tostarlo, molerlo y venderlo a sus clientes, es una actividad que realiza desde hace 10 años junto a su compañera de vida, trabajan a tiempo completo con el fin de salir con sus pedidos. Su familia está compuesta por su compañera de vida, sus tres hijos de 17, 14 años y una niña de tres meses de nacida.
Con el crédito comprara café en grano por mayor para luego someterlo al proceso adecuado y ofrecerlo a sus clientes, espera tener mucha materia prima para que sus ventas aumenten y le generen los ingresos que necesita para cancelar la deuda y mejorar su vida familiar.
Su prioridad es ofrecerles a sus hijos una carrera universitaria, ampliar su negocio y mejorar un más su vivienda.
texts.en:
José’s works buying coffee to roast, grind, and sell to his clients. He’s been in this business for 10 years along with his life partner. They work full time to complete their orders. His family is compromised of his life partner and their three children who are 17 years old, 14 years old, and a three-month old daughter. 

With this loan he’ll buy coffee beans in bulk to process and sell to his customers. He hopes to have a lot of ingredients so that his sales will grow and generate enough income to pay off his debts and help out his family.

His dream is to give his children a university education, grow his business, and improve his home.

loans.use: to buy coffee beans in bulk.

loans.name: Natividad De Jesus

texts.es:
Natividad, está decidido a invertir nuevamente en su negocio de cultivo de maíz y papas, con el crédito comprara abono, semilla, fertilizantes, plaguicidas, pagara mano de obra para preparar la tierra y sembrar a tiempo. Aumentará su producción y sus ingresos.
Con el préstamo anterior él consiguió una cosecha de mucha calidad, mejoro su economía, dio a su familia un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Natividad has decided to invest anew in his business of cultivating corn and potatoes. With the loan he will purchase manure, seeds, fertilizers, and plaguicides, and pay workers to prepare the soil and sow on time. This will increase his production and his income.
.
With his previous loan he raised a harvest of high quality, improved his economic situation and gave his family a better style of life.

loans.use: buy manure, seeds, fertilizers, plaguicides, and pay workers.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
María, está preparándose para las fiestas de fin de año y su negocio no está bien surtido como para poder satisfacer a sus clientes en esta temporada. Por lo que se ha decidido por otro crédito para comprar ropa para dama, ropa para niños, pantalones, variedad de colores estilos y tallas.
Con el crédito anterior su inventario mejoro y pudo satisfacer a sus clientes de una forma inmediata, genero ingresos que le han ayudado a ir cancelando sus cuotas, cubrir los gastos de su casa y sobre todo a comprar el medicamento que su hijo necesita por ser un niño de capacidades especiales.
texts.en:
María is preparing for the end of the year celebrations.  Her business is not stocked well enough to be able to satisfy her customers during this season.  Therefore, she has decided on another loan in order to buy women’s and children’s clothes and pants in a variety of colors, styles, and sizes.

With the previous loan her inventory improved and she was able to satisfy her customers immediately.  This generated income that has helped her to make her payments and cover the household expenses.  Above all, this helped her to buy medication that her son needs as he is a special needs child.

loans.use: to buy women's and children's clothes and pants.

loans.name: Onolbu
