texts.ru: Онолбу 41 год, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Онолбу - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Онолбу занимается животноводством, стартовав 23 года назад, с покупки скота на 6,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Онолбу, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 дойные коровы, 3 лошади, 20 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 3,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Онолбу обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Онолбу планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на покупку шкафа для кухни.
texts.en:
Onolbu is 41 years old, married, and she and her husband are raising 4 children.  Onolbu has a secondary level education, and her family's main source of income is the animal husbandry business that Onolbu started 23 years ago with the purchase of 6,000 somi (KGS) worth of cattle.  As a result of her hard work, today Onolbu has 3 milking cows, 3 horses, and 20 sheep.  Her monthly income is 3,000 somi (KGS).

With an aim to further developing her business, Onolbu applied to the microfinance bank Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 50,000 somi (KGS) to increase the size of her herd by buying cows.  Onolbu plans to invest the profits from the loan in further increasing the size of her herd and to save up to buy kitchen cabinets.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Blanca Zonia

texts.es:
Blanca de 47 años de edad,  solo estudio hasta cuarto grado,  es madre soltera de 3 hijos de 23, 15 y  5 años respectivamente. Que Actualmente,  se encuentran estudiando en la escuela, en los tiempos libres cuando no estudian ellos la apoyan a realizar su trabajo.  

Ella administra una pequeña tienda en su vivienda, desde hace 10 años, pues ella ve en la actividad que es una alternativa de trabajo que le genera ingresos a su familia,  sin salir de su casa. Comenta que por causas del destino es madre soltera, es por ello que ella decidió emprender su propio negocio en su casa y es de esta manera que logra sacar adelante a sus hijos en el estudio.

Como ya es fin de año y una de sus hijas se graduara de  bachillerato,  Blanca, utilizara el préstamo para la graduación de su hija y una pequeña recepción en su vivienda, para ella es un orgullo que a pesar de ser madre soltera ha logrado sacar del bachillerato a su hija solo con su esfuerzo y trabajo, ya que era un deseo que tenía ella y su hija de terminar su bachillerato y tener su título.

Para en el futuro, desea ampliar más su tienda, vivir más cómodamente  y que sus hijas sean personas de bien que sigan estudiando y puedan terminar una carrera universitaria y también que era un deseo de ella y su hija de celebrarle su triunfo obtenido al finalizar su bachillerato, todo esto gracias al crédito adquirido  y  futuros créditos que solicitara.
texts.en:
Blanca, age 47, only went to school up to the fourth grade.  She is a single mother with three children, ages 23, 15, and 5.  They are currently in school.  When they are not studying, they help her do her work in their free time.  She has been running a small store in her house for ten years.  In this business activity she sees a work alternative that generates income for her family without having to leave her house.  She comments that because of destiny she is a single mother.  That is why she decided to undertake her own business in her house.  That is the way she manages to get her children ahead in their education.

It is now the end of the year, and one of her daughters is graduating high school.  Blanca will use the loan for her daughter’s graduation and for a small reception at her house.  She is proud that, in spite of being a single mother, she has managed through her effort and work, for her daughter to finish high school and get her diploma.

In the future she wishes to expand her store, to live more comfortably, for her daughters to become good people who continue studying, and that they are able to get a university degree.  It is also her wish and her daughter’s to celebrate her triumph upon getting her high school degree.  This is all thanks to the loan she received and future loans that she will request.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's graduation and a small reception at her house.

loans.name: Anzhela

texts.ru: Анжела трудолюбивая женщина с медицинским образованием. Ей 31 года. Она разведена и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Анжела более 6 лет работает в местной больнице как медицинская сестра. Она имеет хорошую репутацию среди своих коллег. Анжела единственная кормилица своих детей, так как ее бывший муж не помогает ей обеспечить детей. Она с трудностью справляется с семейными расходами. У нее маленькая зарплата. Анжела уже давно болеет зобом. Однако у нее нет денег для лечения. Ее здоровье ухудшается. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2500 сомони для покупки лекарства для лечения. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Anzhela is a hard working woman.  She is 31 years old and has a medical education.  She is divorced and has 2 children.  Anzhela has been a nurse at their local hospital for over 6 years.  She has a good reputation among her colleagues.  She is her family's only breadwinner as her former husband doesn't help provide for the children.  It's difficult for her meet all the expenses of her family with her low salary.

Anzhela has had a goiter for quite some time, but she doesn't have any money for treatment.  Her health is worsening.  She is requesting a loan of 2,500 somoni to buy medicine.  She is relying on your kindness and compassion.

loans.use: to buy goiter medicine

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es:
María, está necesitando surtir su inventario por lo que optando por otro crédito para comprar  zanahorias, repollos, uvas, manzanas, naranjas, tomates, etc., ella tendrá más variedad de productos que ofrecer a sus clientes. Con la inversión que se le dio antes ella mantuvo satisfechos a sus clientes, genero más ingresos con los que ayudo en su hogar.
Sigue recibiendo de su familia un apoyo incondicional para que todo lo que ella se propone sea una realidad.
texts.en: Maria needs to stock inventory and so she got a loan to buy carrots, cabbage, grapes, apples, oranges, tomatoes, etc. She’ll have a greater variety of products to offer her customers.  With the investment she’s already gotten, she’s kept her customers satisfied and generated more income to help with the household costs. She continues to receive unconditional family support to turn her dreams into a reality.

loans.use: to buy carrots, cabbage, grapes, apples, oranges, and tomatoes.

loans.name: Alberta

texts.en:
Alberta, 40, lives in Teshie, Ghana with her two children. Supporting the family rests on her shoulders. 

Alberta is a slipper seller from door-to-door in Teshie. Alberta is applying for a loan amount of GHS 1300 through ID-Ghana to buy two bags of slippers and sell them over two months to customers. With her profits from the sales she has been able to pay school fees for her children. Her ambition is to own a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy two bags of slippers and sell them over two months to customers.

loans.name: Ndrec

texts.en:
Ndrec, who resides in the northern part of Albania, has five school-aged children, ranging from 10 to 20 years of age. 

It is Ndrec's  fourth time requesting a loan to repair the combine harvester that he already has been using for the past 22 years; the previous loans have been paid on time.  He is the only one in the villages around him owning such a combine and, “it’s neat," he says, “being able to help others.” 

“Harvesting manually," he adds, “is hard labour.” Therefore, “I consider it a blessing to me, having been given the opportunity to help,” he says. Locals mainly raise animals and grow grains, and the demand for a combine harvester is high.

loans.use: To repair his existing combine harvester

loans.name: Cristóbal

texts.es:
Cristóbal de 67 años de edad,  estudio hasta tercer grado,  está acompañado;  su esposa es ama de casa, además ella tiene una pequeña tienda de calzado femenino y su hijo vive con él en la casa, los otros dos ya están acompañados.

Cristóbal, se dedica al transporte de pasajeros inter urbano en el municipio,  tiene un año de dedicarse a este trabajo, él decidió dedicarse a este trabajo, ya que él antes se dedicaba  a la agricultura;  pero ya por la edad no puede , ya que el trabajo en la agricultura requiere de mucho esfuerzo físico. Trabaja de 5 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche.

El préstamo lo utilizara,  para comprar, 70 pares de calzado  femenino,  debido a  que en  esta época que viene es la que más  se vende este tipo de mercadería.  

Sus sueños son ampliar este negocio, con la rentabilidad que obtengan de la inversión que realice, espera también vender  calzado masculino,  con el objetivo de obtener ingresos, que le permitan una mejor condición de vida para él y para su familia.
texts.en:
Cristobal is 67 years old and studied to the 3rd grade. He is married and his wife is a housewife. In addition, she has a small store that sells women's shoes. His son lives with him at home and the other 2 children are now married.

Cristobal transports inter-urban passengers in the municipality. He has done this for the last year. He decided to dedicate his time to this work, though he had been a farmer. But he can no longer do that due to age, since agricultural work requires much physical strength. He works from 5:00 in the morning until 7:00 at night.

The loan will be used to purchase 70 pairs of women's shoes, since this is the season when more of this type of merchandise is sold. Cristobal's dreams are to expand their business. And using the profits they obtain from this investment, he hopes also to sell men's shoes, with the objective of obtaining income that will offer him and his family better conditions of life.

loans.use: buy 70 pairs of women's shoes, since the coming season is when this type of merchandise sells best.

loans.name: Las Maravillas Group

texts.es:
José, tiene 38 años de edad, es casado, tiene 4 hijos y reside en una aldea del municipio de Gracias, Lempira. Toda su vida se ha dedicado al cultivo de maíz y frijol, el cuenta con sus propios cultivos y la producción que saca la vende en el mercado local de la zona. El préstamo que ha solicitado es en forma grupal, en lo personal solicita 5,000 lempiras para comprar fertilizantes y abonar el cultivo de frijol. Su propósito de trabajar es para mejorar su calidad de vida y darles educación a sus hijos. 
El grupo al que pertenece se llama Las Maravillas y esta formado por 6 miembros, que viven en la misma aldea y se dedican a la agricultura. El préstamo grupal es por 28,000 Lempiras y es el quinto ciclo de préstamo, el cual lo invertirán en la fertilización del cultivo de frijol. En la foto se identifican así: a la izquierda esta José, luego sigue Gilberto, Ma Santos, María Ernestina, María Rosa y Rodrigo a la derecha.
texts.en:
José is 38 years old, is married with 4 children and lives in a village in the municipality of Gracias, Lempira. He has worked all of his life growing corn and beans. He has his own crops and he sells his harvest in the area's local market.

He has asked for the loan as part of a group. He is asking personally for 5,000 Lempiras to buy fertilizers to feed his bean crops. By working, he aims to improve his quality of life and educate his children. He belongs to the group called las Maravillas which is made up of 6 members who live in the same village and all work in agriculture. The group loan is for 28,000 Lempiras and this is their fifth loan cycle. They spend the loan on fertilizing the bean crops.

In the photo the members are identified as follows: on the left is José, followed by Gilberto, Ma Santos, María Ernestina, María Rosa and Rodrigo on the right.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and manure for growing beans.

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es:
Emilio es una persona de 50 años de edad, tiene una hermosa familia integrada por 9 hijos, de los cuales 4 son hombres y 5 mujeres, de todos ellos cuatro están estudiando; estudian por las mañanas y ayudan a su papa por las tardes. Don Emilio y sus hijos viven actualmente en Caserío Xibalbay, Chaquijyá, Sololá.
El es de oficio agricultor, sin embargo se dedica a la venta de tomillo (condimento para comida); compra el tomillo en su comunidad y lo vende en Quetzaltenango (departamento al occidente de Guatemala) esta actividad le genera la mayor parte de sus ingresos debido a la alta rentabilidad de esta actividad. Con estos ingresos el cubre los gastos familiares tanto de alimentación como educación de sus hijos 
Tiene 15 años de realizar esta actividad lo cual tiene aceptación y demanda de los vecinos de su comunidad
El quiere ampliar su negocio y por ello está solicitando un préstamo de Q 2,500.00 para compra de más tomillo.
El sueño más importante de don Emilio es remodelar su casa y brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Emilio, 50, has a beautiful family comprised of 9 children, 4 boys and 5 girls. Four of his children are in school. They go to school in the mornings and help their father in the afternoons. Emilio and his children live in Caserío Xibalbay, Chaquijyá, Sololá.

Emilio is a farmer, however he also makes a living by selling thyme (a condiment for food). He buys the thyme in his community and sells it in Quetzaltenango (a Department in the western part of Guatemala). This activity generates the majority of his income due to its profitability. With this income, he covers family expenses including food and education costs for his children.

He has worked in this sector for 15 years, which has acceptance and a demand from his neighbors in the community. He wants to grow his business, which is why he is requesting a loan of 2,500 GTQ to buy more thyme. His greatest dream is to remodel his home and provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to get working capital to buy thyme.

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en:
Youssef is a 20-year-old single man, who is responsible for earning the living of five members of his family.

Youssef has been working in a computer programming and photography business for five years. In March 2010, he started his own business to improve his living standard and increase his income. Youssef is a hard worker, well known in his region, with his good work and special prices.

Today, Youssef is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to buy a specialized camera necessary for developing his business. This camera will improve his quality of work a lot, which will attract new customers.

He hopes that one day he will be capable of opening his own company and expand his working sector.

loans.use: to buy a specialized camera necessary for developing his business

loans.name: Munu Star Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “Munu Star” group from Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of 500,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) for each in the group. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales, and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Zainab is the featured leader of this group. The 29-year-old is married to a driver and they have one child who is attending primary school. Zainab has been a businesswoman for 8 years now. She sells foo-foo (food made out of cassava roots). With her share of this loan, Zainab is going to buy cooking ingredients like palm oil, Maggi (used to give sauce a sweet taste) onions, tomatoes, etc. in bulk in order to cook a larger quantity of foo-foo for sale.

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients like palm oil, Maggi, onions, tomatoes, etc. in bulk in orderr to cook a larger quantity of foo-foo for sale

loans.name: Dúo Donnis Group

texts.es:
DUO DONNIS
Es conformado  por doña Lucia, con su venta de tortillas desde ya hace mas de 13 años, gracias a  su servicio  que brinda, doña Lucia logra brindarle trabajo a dos señoritas que la apoyan en su negocio, como también es la fuente de ingreso para su sustento diario, al momento doña Lucia requiere de capital para comprar varios quintales de  maíz, y leña para coser el maíz,  como también la compra de gas propano,esperando que ustedes le puedan ayudar con este segundo credito ya que el primer credito le ha sido de mucha ayuda porque logro agrandar un poco mas su negocio de venta de tortillas y desde ya les agradese por su ayuda
texts.en: The communal bank "Duo Donnis" includes Lucia, who's had a business selling tortillas for more than 13 years.  Thanks to the service she provides, Lucia has managed to provide work to 2 women who assist her in the business. Also, this is her source of daily sustenance.  At this time, Lucia needs money to buy large quantities of corn and firewood to make the tortillas, and she also needs to buy propane gas.  She is hoping that you can help her with this second loan.  Her first loan was a great help to her, because with it she managed to expand her tortilla business a bit.  She thanks you in advance for your help.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood and propane gas to make tortillas

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is a married mother of one child who goes to school. She lives in her own house that has electricity and piped water.

She makes drinks using fruit and juice flavor and sells them to her neighbors and passersby. She cites seasonality as her major challenge.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase juice flavors and fruit for the business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase juice flavors and fruit for her business.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with two school-going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past three years, she has operated a business selling 'leso' ( women's wrap) cloth. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of expanding to become a big supplier of clothes in the future.

With the Kshs 25,000 she wants to purchase 40 lengths of 'leso’  for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 40 lengths of 'leso’ (women's wrap)  for resale.

loans.name: Mesalimu

texts.en:
Mesalimu appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards and enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income.

She is requesting a loan of ksh.50,000 to purchase 50 bales of khangas (traditional pieces of fabric worn by women in East Africa) to sell. 

She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase 50 bales of khangas to sell

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a hardworking mother who strives hard to improve the standards of living for her family.

The previous loan helped her to buy goats to sell.

Here again she comes to you requesting a loan of Kshs 40,000 to buy eight goats to sell as goat meat.

She appreciates the support granted.

loans.use: to buy eight goats to sell as goat meat.

loans.name: Binti

texts.en:
Binti is a married woman with two children; one of her kids attends school which is the reason for her hard work.  The other child is still too young for school.  Binti owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She has operated a kiosk business from home for the past year, selling to passersby and neighbours. 

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase maize flour, wheat flour, sugar, detergents, and rice. 

Her dream is to see her children get a better education and become important people in society.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, wheat flour, sugar, detergents, and rice

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa es una señora de 51 años de edad, actualmente tiene 1 hijo varón de 11 años de edad quien está estudiando; ellos viven en  Caserío Central,  Aldea El Tablón, departamento de Sololá
Ella se dedica al cultivo y venta de papa, eligió esta actividad porque la heredó de sus padres y otra de las razones es que cuenta con terreno y clima apropiado para cultivar; a través de  esta actividad obtiene buenos ingresos económicos que le ayudan al sostenimiento de su familia y darle lo necesario a su hijo tanto en alimentación como en su educación y asi preparlo para afrontar de mejor manera el futuro. 
Lleva 10 años realizando esta labor; además de esta actividad ella también se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tejidos artesanales.
Ella solicita un préstamo de Q 5,500.00 para compra de semilla y fertilizante para la siembra y el mantenimiento de papa.
Sueña con ver a su hijo con un titulo de profesional y para ello lo está apoyando en todo lo necesario para su educación y desarrollo.
texts.en:
Rosa is 51 years old and currently has an 11 year old son who is at school. They live in Caserío Central, Aldea El Tablón in the Sololá department. Rosa earns a living growing and selling potatoes and chose this work because she inherited it from her parents and also because she has the right sort of land and climate for growing potatoes. Through her work she gets a good income which helps her to support her family and provide for her son's needs, both in food and education, and so equip him better to face the future. She has been doing this work for 10 years and also makes and sells artisan textiles.

Rosa is asking for a loan of Q 5,500 to buy seed and fertilizer for sowing and growing potatoes. She dreams of her son having a professional qualification and so she is supporting him in every way possible with his education and development.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer for sowing and growing her potatoes.

loans.name: Vilma Concepción

texts.es:
Vilma de 47 años, estudio hasta segundo grado, y por motivos de escasos recursos económicos no pudo continuar, ella es casada su esposo trabaja en la agricultura, han procreado 3 hijos,  2 de ellos ya se le acompañaron, solo  una hija está viviendo con ella en la casa, y es la que le ayuda en el negocio.

Vilma posee un negocio de venta de tortillas y pupusas desde hace 2 años. Aprendió este trabajo
cuando ella le ayudaba a una amiga, que se dedicaba a la venta de comida y pupusas. 

El préstamo que está solicitando, es  para comprar 3 mesas plásticas, que el costo de cada una es $50 dólares y lo demás lo utilizara  para  comprar,  materia prima para la elaboración de pupusas y tortillas, como harina de maíz, chicharon, frijoles, y gas para vender más y así poder tener más rentabilidad con las ventas que realice.
 
Sus sueños, son ampliar su negocio,  y tener a futuro un negocio que día con día le permita tener ingresos, y  así poder tener mayores ingresos que le permitan, a ella y su familia tener un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Vilma, 47, has a second grade education.  She was not able to continue her studies due to a lack of finances.  Vilma is married, and her husband works as a farmer.  They have 3 children, 2 of whom are already married.  Only one daughter is living with them in their house, and she helps them with the business.

Vilma has had a business selling tortillas and pupusas (stuffed tortillas) for 2 years.  She learned this work when she was helping a friend who was selling food and pupusas.  

Vilma is requesting a loan to buy 3 plastic tables, which each cost $50 dollars.  She will use the rest of the funds to buy raw materials to make pupusas and tortillas, such as corn flour, pork rinds, beans, and propane gas.  This way she will be able to sell more, and thereby improve the profitability of her business.

Vilma dreams of expanding her business and in the future, having a business that generates daily earnings.  This way she could have more income so that she and her family could have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy 3 plastic tables and raw materials to make pupusas and tortillas

loans.name: Natiq

texts.en:
Natiq is 36 years old, married, and the father of one son. He raises cows for milk purposes, and has four years of experience in this field. His business brings him a stable income of 180 AZN. He has permanent buyers; however, there is only one problem he has, which is the absence of water. Now, in order to water his cows, he has to herd them about 1 kilometer to the nearest river. 

When he heard about water loans, he was extremely excited and applied for a 2,000 AZN loan. A water channel is quite an expensive process which requires a labor force and special equipment.  Natiq will use this loan to pay for special equipment rental, like a tractor, for making a water channel and for workers who will dig up the land. 

This is going to be his first loan. Natiq awaits your support.

loans.use: to pay for special equipment rental, like a tractor, for making a water channel

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 35-year-old married man from Gaza city. He lives with his wife and six young kids. Ahmad works as an employee in the public sector. He gets a very low wage which is not enough to cover all the family needs. Ahmad has an illness in his lungs, and this sickness prevents him from going to work and doing his daily activities. 

Ahmad requested a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay the costs of the surgery and medical examinations. By taking out this loan, Ahmad's health conditions will be better and he will go back to work. 

Ahmad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the costs of his surgery and medical examinations

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman who has been blessed with one school-aged child. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and rental bills.

Mariam has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and villagers. Her greatest monthly challenge is the high cost of transportation.

She is requesting a loan of Kshs 50,000 to purchase charcoal to sell. 

She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell

loans.name: Hajiri

texts.en:
Hajiri appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards, and enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income.

She is requesting a loan of ksh.35,000 to purchase bales of clothes to sell. 

She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine is an experienced farmer from Dashtavan village of Ararat region. She lives with her husband. Both of them are extensively engaged in agricultural business to be able to take care of their needs. For more than 20 years, they have been engaged in the cultivation of potatoes. Karine and her husband sell the agricultural produce in the local market, and that is the only source of their income. 

Karine's agricultural business currently needs some investments in order for it to function in a sustainable way, and to be productive. A loan of USD 2500 will be a huge help to this hard-working woman and her family, enabling her to buy potato seeds and to renovate the greenhouses. 

Karine and her husband greatly rely on the goodwill of the lenders and will appreciate their support in collecting the needed amount of the loan to maintain and develop their agricultural business.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds and to renovate the greenhouses

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is grateful for the partnership with Kiva. He has repaid his previous six loans well and on time, and having his children in school on time has improved their performance. He is requesting another loan to pay tuition so that his children are able to sit for their exams without tuition balances.
He is resilient and honest.

loans.use: To pay tuition.

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en:
Susanna is an experienced agronomist from Talin city of Aragatsotn region. She lives with her husband and school-age daughter. Susanna works as a cleaner at school. Her salary, however, is so low that she cannot afford a living based on that salary alone. With the help of her husband Susanna is engaged in cattle breeding, in aviculture, and in breeding piglets. The family sells the agricultural produce in the local market, and that is is the most important source of their income. 

As the autumn is progressing, Susanna needs to make some investments in her agricultural business in order for it to develop in a sustainable way and to be more productive. She needs a loan of USD 1000 to purchase two calves and to buy some forage for her cattle. Susanna and her family rely on the goodwill of the lenders and will appreciate their support in collecting the needed loan to maintain and develop their agricultural business.

loans.use: to purchase two calves and to buy some forage for her cattle

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is 47 years old and lives in Caldwell. She is a high school dropout and has three children between 9 and 13 years old, who are in school and live at home. She has been selling rice, onions, oil, and other items for 10 years now. She started this business by selling for friends. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, onions, oil, and other items for her business. She wishes to build a store.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, onions, oil, and other items for her business

loans.name: Marlon Jeovanny

texts.es:
Marlon, es un agricultor que lucha día con día para darle lo mejor a su familia, está casado, tiene un hijo, vive con su esposa y su hijo. Desde que era un niño su abuelo le enseño a cultivar granos básicos, hoy en día esta actividad la ejerce junto a sus tíos.
Como ya viene la época de siembre ha decidido solicitar capital para invertir en la compra de insumos agrícolas (abono, plaguicidas, herbicidas, semilla). Para preparar el terreno y tener una mejor cosecha.
Anhela tener los ingresos necesarios para cubrir todas las necesidades de su familia, ampliar el área de cultivo, y cancelar a tiempo sus cuotas para trabajar nuevamente con créditos.
texts.en:
Marlon is a farmer who works hard every day to provide his family with the best. He is married and has a son. They all live together. At a young age, his grandfather taught him to cultivate basic grains. Today, he does this work with his uncles.

Since the time for planting seeds is coming soon, he decided to request a loan to invest in buying agricultural supplies (manure, pest control, herbicides, and seeds) to prepare the land and have a better harvest.

He hopes to have the necessary income to provide his family with everything they need, to increase his land for cultivation, and to pay off his debts so he can work with new loans.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies (manure, pest control, herbicides, seeds).

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a resident of the Muthurwa neighborhood of Nairobi, Kenya, who recently completed his high school education. 

Being a youth, he is in need of employment to enable him take care of his personal expenses. While looking for a job, George learned about the Fresh Life initiative and became interested in owning a Fresh Life franchise. He aims to use this franchise to generate income for his daily needs, and save part of it for his college education. 

George therefore seeks a loan to purchase and run two Fresh Life toilets. He will set up the toilets in a busy market area with few sanitation facilities and hopes it would be successful.

loans.use: To purchase and run two Fresh Life toilets

loans.name: Najah

texts.en:
Najah is a 56-year-old married mother of one child; she has been working in manufacturing and selling perfumes since 2008. Najah is a major financial supporter for her family; she works hard to provide them with the best living.

Najah is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with special perfumes essences and bottles that will develop her business and increase her selling.

Najah hopes to stay in good health and remain capable of supporting her family through developing her business as much as she can.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise with special perfumes essences and bottles

loans.name: Zulekha

texts.en:
Zulekha is a single woman with one child who goes to school. She lives at a rental house that has piped water and electricity. 

Zulekha has operated a cosmetics business for the past three years. Her potential customers are women. 

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase body lotion, hair oil, jewelry. chemicals and hair conditioners for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase body lotion, hair oil, jewelry, chemicals and hair conditioners for resale

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is a married woman with three children, two in school and one still young. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past three months, she has operated a business of selling 'leso' cloth. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of expanding to become a big supplier of clothes in the future.

With the Kshs 15,000 she wants to purchase 40 lengths of 'leso’  for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 40 lengths of  'leso' (women's wrap)  for resale

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
María, ha trabajado muy bien con su crédito y ya su tienda recupero clientes, en esta ocasión la surtirá nuevamente para la temporada de fin de año agregando muchos productos nuevos para poner  a la disposición de sus clientes agregara venta de pólvora, con el préstamos comprara volcancitos, luces navideñas, cohetes, entre otros, con esto espera llamar la atención de las personas que frecuentan la tienda y generar mayores ventas.
Con el préstamo anterior pudo establecerse nuevamente su situación económica, a cancelado sus deudas y da más apoyo a su familia
texts.en:
María has worked very well with her loan and has now regained some of her shop's clientele. This time she wants to restock for the end of year holiday season, adding lots of new products to make them available for her customers. She will start to sell fireworks and with the loan will buy 'volcancitos' [type of firework], Christmas lights, rockets and other items. With these products she hopes to attract the attention of customers in the shop and increase her sales. 

With the previous loan María was able to stabilise her economic situation, pay off her debts and give more support to her family.

loans.use: to buy fireworks, Christmas lights, rockets and other items.

loans.name: Rhodah

texts.en: Rhodah is a young single mother living in the Mukuru informal settlement of Nairobi, Kenya with her child. She sells charcoal for a living. However, she recently learned about the Fresh Life toilets, and became interested in joining the movement. The area she lives in faces a crisis in sanitation since there are very few sanitation facilities serving the population in the area. Rhoda therefore seeks funding to purchase and run one Fresh Life toilet to run as a business. She hopes that her franchise will grow in order to ease the sanitation issue in the area. Rhoda also hopes this business will increase her income.

loans.use: To purchase and run one Fresh Life toilet

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita is a farmer from Dprapark village of the Gegharquniq region. She lives with her husband. Her husband works in the village local self governance body as a deputy head. He is the main breadwinner of the family. To assist her husband in earning a living, Rita is engaged in aviculture, beekeeping, and in cultivating beans, potatoes, grass, cherries, plums and apples. She sells the agricultural products in the local market, which is an important source of their income. The family has agricultural machinery, which needs to be renovated. With the help of the agricultural machinery, Rita’s agribusiness will function more efficiently and productively. A loan of 1500 USD will help her greatly and enable her to renovate the agricultural machinery. Rita relies highly on the goodwill of the lenders and will be very grateful to them for their help in collecting the needed amount of the loan.

loans.use: to renovate agricultural machinery.

loans.name: Hafitha

texts.en:
Hafitha is 26 years old, married with children and they live in Haja, Yemen. She’s a responsible, hardworking entrepreneur with a wish for personal self-improvement. She has a small house. 

Hafitha would like to improve her home because that’s her dream and the goal that she’s set for herself. She thanks AMB for providing a loan to buy construction supplies to complete her house. She hopes to enroll her children in good private school.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to complete her house.

loans.name: Sanaa

texts.en:
Sanaa is a 45-year-old married mother of five children. She has been working selling cosmetics since 2007 to help her family in getting the necessary needs. 

Sanaa works from her house, because at the beginning she had to stay at home and take good care of her children and do her business at the same time. She didn't have enough working capital to open a shop of her own. Most of her customers are relatives, neighbors and friends, who work hard at supporting her to provide a good living for her family.

She is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to pay for her daughter's wedding expenses, since her business income isn't enough to cover any additional expense. She hopes that one day she'll be capable of opening a separate shop outside her house.

loans.use: To pay for her daughter's wedding expenses

loans.name: Eerline

texts.en:
Eerline is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is household consumables.

For the past three years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling door-to-door to her neighbors and passers-by. She faces a major challenge of high transportation costs. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that Eerline is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Besy Nohemy

texts.es:
Besy es un joven de 27 años de edad es agricultora y ama de casa, madre de un hijo el cual tiene 8 meses de nacido. Junto a su compañero de hogar trabajan arduamente para salir adelante por lo que temprano en la mañana se levantan diariamente para trabajar en el campo y dar asistencia a sus cultivos de café ya que es la fuente de ingresos para su familia. Su grado de educación secundaria completa pudiendo graduarse como Bachiller en Promoción Social apoyo brindado por sus padres a quienes agradece el esfuerzo que hicieron para que ella pudiera estudiar. Desde hace 8 años ella practica la caficultura lo que aprendió de sus padres y el terreno que en compañía de su conyugue trabaja es propio gracias al trabajo realizado por varios años el cual rindió fruto para que ellos trabajaran de forma propia la cual está ubicada a 2 kilómetros de distancia desde su casa de habitación a la cual se trasladan caminando. El café es el rubro que les proporciona a ellos la economía necesaria para poder proveer en su hogar vestimenta, comida, alimento, medicinas aunque con muchas restricciones entre otras cosas. 
Por lo que hoy en día ella solicita financiamiento para la compra de fertilizantes e insumos agrícolas que ayudaran a mantener sanos y protegidos sus cultivos como también poder destinar otra parte para poder limpiarlo de maleza entre otros.
Sus metas son seguir incrementando sus cultivos de café mediante la compra de más tierra fortaleciendo el patrimonio para sus hijos; como también poder encontrar un trabajo digno donde ella pueda también contribuir con los ingresos en su hogar ya que su sueño es seguir estudiando en la universidad y poderse graduar para poder dar un mejor bienestar a su hijo y los futuros venideros.
texts.en:
Besy is a 27-year-old young woman. She is a farmer and homemaker, and mother to an 8-month-old son. Along with her housemate, she works arduously to get ahead. They get up early in the morning every day to work in the field and help their coffee crops since they are the source of income for their family. Her level of secondary education completed, she was able to graduate with her high school degree in Social Promotion. She was supported by her parents to whom she is thankful for the efforts they made so that she could study.

Since she was 8 years old, she has grown coffee, which she learned to do from her parents. The land that she works along with her partner is her own thanks to the work she has performed for various years. This work has paid off so that they could work in their own way. The land, to which they walk, is located 2 kilometers from their home. The coffee is the means that provides the necessary income to be able to provide clothing, food, and medicine, although with many restrictions, among other things.

This is why she is currently requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers and agricultural supplies that will help her to maintain her crops healthy and protected, and also to set aside another portion to be able to remove weeds, among others.

Her goals are to continue increasing her coffee crops through the purchase of more land to strengthen her children’s inheritance. She also would like to be able to find a respectable job where she can also contribute to the household income. Her dream is to continue studying at the university and be able to graduate to provide a better well-being to her son and those to come in the future.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies to be able to help her coffee crops.

loans.name: Rosette

texts.en:
Rosette is 29-years-old and lives in the town of Lukaya in the region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past four years, Rosette has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sales sugar, salt and milk. 

To help expand her business, Rosette has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more stock for the shop and will help Rosette to generate greater profits to buy more materials. Rosette hopes that in the future she will be able to own a wholesale shop.

Rosette is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Rosette who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her retail shop.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace  is 38 years old and lives in the town of Fort Portal in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She has three children who are all currently in school. For the past year, Grace  has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells foodstuff. 

To help expand her business, Grace  has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more goods, and will help Grace  to generate greater profits and to improve her family's livelihood. Grace  hopes that in the future she will be able to have a fully booming business. 

Grace  is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Grace  who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more goods,

loans.name: Hambardzum

texts.en: Hambardzum is from Yerevan town. He studies at Yerevan State University and lives with his parents and sister. Currently because of hard financial conditions, Hambardzum isn't able to pay his university tuition. By asking for this loan, Hambardzum wants to pay for his university tuition. The loan is very important for him, as it will be a huge support for Hambardzum to be able to continue his education.

loans.use: to pay tuition for the first semester of the second course

loans.name: Jose Heriberto

texts.es:
José, es un hombre de familia que tiene tres hijos de 1, 4 y 2 años de edad, él vive con sus hijos. Su padre le enseño a trabajar la tierra, ya siendo un adulto realiza esta actividad con ayuda de amigos. Invertirá el préstamo en compra de plaguicidas, insecticidas, abono y semillas, para cultivar sin ningún problema. Los beneficios que el espera recibir son mejores ingresos, una cosecha abundante y satisfacer a sus clientes.
Sueña con brindarles a sus hijos mejor alimentación, vestuario, salud, educación y seguir ampliando su negocio.
texts.en:
José is a family man who has three children that are 1, 4, and 2 years old. He lives with his children. His father taught him to work the land, and now that he is an adult he performs this activity with the help of his friends.

He will invest the loan in the purchase of pesticides, insecticides, fertilizer, and seeds, to farm without any problems. The benefits that he expects to receive are a better income, an abundant harvest, and to satisfy his customers.

He dreams of providing food, clothing, health, and education to his children, and to continue growing his business.

loans.use: to purchase insecticide, fertilizer, and seeds.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred is 41 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in Uganda. He is married and has two children who are both currently in school. For the past three years, Fred  has been working hard to manage his electronics business, which sells electronics items. 

To help expand his business, Fred has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more stock, and will help Fred to generate greater profits and will increase his daily sales. Fred hopes that, in the future, he will be able to have a bigger shop. 

Fred is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Fred who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more stock,

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema owns a house that has no electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling household consumables like wheat flour, rice, and cooking oil. She cites theft and competition as her major challenges. 

She is requesting Kshs 20,000 to boost her kiosk, purchasing bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking oil. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking oil

loans.name: Naziha

texts.en: Naziha is a respected and exceptionally hardworking 61-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband, and both work to achieve a good standard of living. Her home-based business provides her customers with chic and stylish hairdressing services. Naziha wishes to borrow from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to renew her business tools and modernize them.  This would help to enhance her services and satisfy her clients. Naziha is very optimistic and this will be her first Kiva loan.

loans.use: to renew her business tools and modernize them

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida is a 32-year-old single woman. She has worked in selling clothes from her home for the past five years. She particularly sells cotton products. In parallel, she works at a local boutique with the intention of earning superior income and enhancing her way of living. She’s very friendly and knows very well how to deal with and stay in a good relationship with her clients. 

With her loan requested today from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l., she will buy a winter clothes collection of pants, coats, jackets, etc., in order to diversify her merchandise selection and grow her business. Sajida notes that this loan will certainly push her to get higher returns. In the future, she plans to open a proper clothing store.

loans.use: to buy a winter clothes collection of pants, coats, jackets, etc.

loans.name: Siham

texts.en:
Siham is a Lebanese 46-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. Her husband’s income is not sufficient to pay everyday expenditures, and that’s why she decided to supplement the family’s income by starting her business of sewing clothes in 2000.  

At this time, Siham is looking to expand her business further, but sadly, she suffers from lack of funds. Therefore, she is eager to apply for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l., with which she will purchase more fabric and other supplies such as buttons, laces and ribbons in order to fulfill her customers’ requests.

loans.use: to purchase more fabric and other supplies such as buttons, laces and ribbons.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es: Carlos es un joven emprendedor de 22 años de edad, nacido en el seno de una familia campesina muy humilde, desde su niñez ha estado involucrado en las actividades de la agricultura, gracias a las enseñanzas de su padre, quien ha sido agricultor toda su vida; su experiencia laboral la obtuvo trabajando en una finca del sector donde reside, desempeñándose como agricultor pero, con el ánimo de independizarse nuevamente y generar sus propios ingresos, desea retomar un cultivo de papa criolla que anteriormente tenía en la tierra de su familia, el cual tuvo que abandonar por falta de capital de trabajo. Es por ello  que se motiva a solicitar el apoyo del crédito, para comprar las semillas e insumos agrícolas (abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas, entre otros), para así comenzar nuevamente su negocio y generar nuevos ingresos con la venta de la cosecha, esto le ayudará a mejorar la economía de su familia y le dará la oportunidad de cumplir el sueño de ser totalmente independiente y no tener que depender de otra persona, además quiere tener la oportunidad de cambiar las condiciones de vida de su familia y retribuir a sus padres el gran esfuerzo que hicieron para sacarlo adelante, brindándoles un mejor bienestar y calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Carlos, 22, is a young entrepreneur from a humble farming family. From a young age, he has been involved in agricultural work. This is thanks to his father, who has been a farmer all his life. He gained farming experience from a farm in the area where he lives, working as a farmer. However, with the desire to be independent and earn his own income, he wants to resume planting potatoes like he used to on his family's land. He had to stop due to lack of working capital.

For this reason, he is requesting a loan to buy seeds and agricultural supplies such as manure, fertilizer, pesticides, and more. This will allow him to start his business again and earn new income by selling what he harvests. This will help him improve his family's finances and give him the opportunity to achieve his dream of being completely independent and not having to depend on anyone else. Also, he wants to have the opportunity to change his family's living conditions and compensate his parents for the huge effort they made to move him forward by providing them well-being and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds and agricultural supplies such as manure, fertilizer, pesticides, and more.

loans.name: Mathias

texts.en:
Mathias is 30 years old and lives in the town of Bugembe in the Bugembe region of Uganda. He is married and has one child who is currently in school. For the past two years, Mathias has been working hard to manage his electrical goods shop, which sells electrical items. 

To help expand his business, Mathias has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more stock of electrical items, and will help Mathias to generate greater profits and provide a high standard of living for his family. Mathias hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his business from rural places to urban towns like Jinja. 

Mathias is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Mathias who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more stock of electrical items

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 24-year-old single man from Lebanon. Four years ago, he opened a jewelry store. His products are silvery and attract customers. In order to reinforce and strengthen his business, Ahmad is requesting to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase additional jewelry such as necklaces, earrings and bracelets.  He intends to diversify his selection to attract a wider clientele.  This would increase his sales and therefore his income. In the future, Ahmad looks forward to opening a new branch of his shop.

loans.use: to purchase additional jewelry such as necklaces, earrings and bracelets.

loans.name: Dúo Buena Vista Group

texts.es: Dúo Buena Vista La encargada de este grupo es la señora Beatriz Elizabeth quien se dedica a la venta de tamales , paches, chiles rellenos, y carne de cerdo en general como los chicharrones, carnitas y morongas. La venta ha empezado a crecer por las fechas navideñas que se aproximan y ella tiene mucha demanda de tamales pero la mayor parte es de carne de cerdo. Ella pide un crédito porque el capital que tiene no le alcanza y necesita comprar los cerdos al contado ya que solo de esa forma se compran un poco mas baratos. También ella aprovecha en comprar cajas de tomate no maduros para tenerlas en la casa y que se maduren a su tiempo y así ahorrar para no pagar los altos precios del tomate a la mera fecha de la fiestas navideñas. Cuenta grandemente con el apoyo de sus hijos, esposo quienes matan a los cerdos y no paga el trabajo y su meta es llegar a tener un restaurante porque la gente le ha dicho que cocina muy rico. espera que ustedes le sigan ayudando con creditos ya que a sido de mucha ayuda para ella y su familia
texts.en:
The "Buena Vista" Duo

The head of this group is Beatriz Elizabeth, who makes a living selling "tamales" (a corn dish), stuffed chillis, and pig meat (pork crackling, barbecued pork, and black pudding).  Sales have started to increase as the Christmas season is approaching.  There is a lot of demand for "tamales" but customers are mainly looking for pork dishes.  Beatriz is applying for a loan as she does not have enough capital and needs to buy pigs in cash, as they will be a little bit cheaper that way.  Beatriz also wants to take advantage and buy unripened tomatoes that she can leave in the house until they are ready.  That way she will not have to pay such high prices as she would at Christmas.  Beatriz receives a lot of support from her children and husband who slaughter the pigs.  Because of this, Beatriz does not have to pay for this service.  Beatriz's goal is to own a restaurant as people have told her she is an excellent cook.  She hopes that you will continue to support her with loans as they have been a great help for Beatriz and her family.

loans.use: to buy pigs, and to buy supplies to make and sell "tamales" (a corn dish).

loans.name: Jabbeh

texts.en:
Meet 48-year-old Jabbeh from Jui eastern area in Freetown. She is married with seven children. For past 15 years, Jabbeh has established her business. She began her business because she wants to take great care of her family. She works at the business from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m., seven days per week. She is very hardworking and desires to improve her standard of living.

Jabbeh requires a loan in order to purchase rice, palm oil and cooking seasonings to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to feed her children and increase her business. In the future, Jabbeh plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase rice, palm oil and cooking seasonings to expand her business.

loans.name: Francisca Antonia

texts.es:
Francisca, tiene 31 años, está casada, tiene dos hijos de 15 y 12 años, para generar ingresos que necesita en su hogar tiene desde hace cinco años una pupuseria y venta de platos típicos, trabaja de martes a sábado es una actividad que se la enseño su madre. 
Necesita capital para comprar chicharrón, quesillo, harina, gas, frijoles, plátanos y otros para preparar las pupusas y los diferentes tipos de platos típicos. Con todo esto ella podrá atraer a más clientes, generar ingresos que le faciliten ir cancelando sus cuotas.
El sueño es darles a sus hijos un estilo de vida diferente, tener un negocio más amplio, ser un apoyo constante para su esposo.
texts.en:
Francisca, age 31, is married and has two children, ages 15 and 12.  In order to generate income that her household needs, she has had a pupusa [stuffed, grilled corn cakes] shop and business selling typical dishes for five years.  She works from Tuesdays through Saturdays.  It is a business activity that her mother taught her.

She needs capital to buy ‘chicharrón’ [fried pork rinds], cheese, flour, cooking gas, beans, bananas, and others in order to prepare the pupusas and the different types of typical dishes.

With all of this she will be able to attract more customers and generate income that will help her make her payments.

Her dream is to give her children a different life style, to have a better business, and to be a constant support to her husband.

loans.use: to buy ‘chicharrón’ [fried pork rinds], cheese, flour, cooking gas, beans, bananas, and others.

loans.name: Fanta

texts.en:
Meet 38-year-old Fanta from Jui in eastern Freetown. She is married with four children. For the past ten years Fanta has sold sandals to make a living. She works at the business from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m. seven days a week. She says that the main challenge to her business is a lack of money to enlarge it.

Fanta is applying for a 900,000 SLL loan through BRAC Sierra Leone in order to buy more sandals to sell. She hopes that this loan will lead to increased profits and a better standard of living.

In the future Fanta plans to continue to grow her business. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more sandals to sell.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Meet 33-year-old Mariama from Jui in eastern Freetown. She is married with four children.

For the past ten years Mariama has sold beverages and water. She began her business because she did not have enough money to empower herself. She works from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m. seven days a week. She is very hardworking and wants to improve her standard of living.

Mariama is applying for a 750,000 SLL loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy more beverages and pure water to sell. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to feed her children and increase her business.

In the future Mariama plans to grow her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more beverages and pure water to sell.

loans.name: Sallay

texts.en:
Sallay, from Jui eastern area in Freetown, is in her late thirties. She is married with 5 children and established her Palm oil business in 2005. She began her business because she wants to generate a permanent source of income.   She works at the business from 8:00am until 7:00pm, 7 days per week. Her main business challenge is having insufficient capital to expand her business.

Sallay requires a loan in order to purchase more palm oil to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her standard of living and increase her business. In the future, Sallay plans to open a food stuffs table. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil to expand her business.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Meet Hawa. She is 49 years old and comes from Jui in the eastern area of Freetown. She is married with three children.  Ten years ago, Hawa established her palm oil business. She began her business because she wanted to generate a permanent source of income.   She works at the business from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand.

Hawa requires a loan to purchase more palm oil to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Hawa plans to open a foodstuff table. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil

loans.name: Jariatu

texts.en:
Meet 32-year-old Jariatu from Jui in the eastern area of Freetown. She is married with four children.  For 10 years, Jariatu has been running her food stand business. She began her business because she did not go school and she was trained in this business.  She works at the business from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm, 7 days per week. She is very hard working and desires to improve her standard of living

Jariatu requires a loan to purchase a variety of rice, flour and cooking seasonings to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to feed her children and increase her business. In the future, Jariatu plans to expand her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase rice, flour and cooking seasoning

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Meet 40-year-old Kadiatu from Jui, in the eastern area of Freetown. She is married with six children.  For the past 12 years, Kadiatu has been operating a slippers business. She was a housewife. She began her business because she wanted to contribute to taking care of her children.  She works at the business from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is lack of capital to expand her business.

Kadiatu requires a loan in order to purchase more slippers to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Kadiatu plans to expand her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more slippers to sell

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
Meet 28-year-old Mariatu from Jui, an eastern area in Freetown. She is married with 2 children. For the past 12 years, Mariatu has run a clothing business. She began her business because she wanted to create a source of income for her living.  She works at the business from 8:00am until 7:00pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is lack of capital to expand her business.

Mariatu requires a loan in order to purchase more trousers and blouses to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Mariatu plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more trousers and blouses to expand her business.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Meet 22-year-old Aminata from the eastern area of Jui in Freetown. She is currently single with no children. For the past 5 years, Aminata has run a retail business. She began her business because she wants to empower herself and take care of her parent.  She works from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm, 7 days per week. She is very hard-working and desires to improve her standard of living

Aminata requires a loan in order to purchase more pure water and assorted drinks to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will improve her standard of living and increase her business. In the future, Aminata plans to expand her business further. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more pure water and assorted drinks to expand her business.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Aminata is 29 years old and married with 3 children between the ages of 2 years and 15 years. She runs a cookery business in the Jui Eastern area in Freetown. She has been in this business for 11 years, selling local food within her community.  She says that her main business challenge is occasionally slow purchasing power.

Aminata requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy more seasonings, rice, and cooking oil for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to increase her business and educate her children. In the future, she would like to expand her business more than ever. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy more seasonings, rice, and cooking oil for resale.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is 19 years old and single, with no children. 

She has an elei business. doing traditional printed fabics.  She has been doing this for three years. She needs a loan to buy elei designs, rollers, fabric color paints, brushes, and stencils. 

Linda hopes to use her profits to support her family and to improve her business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2009.

loans.use: to buy elei designs, rollers, fabric color paints, brushes, and stencils

loans.name: Ulufale

texts.en:
Ulufale is 60 years old and married, with eight children. 

She has a plantation and grows taro and bananas to earn a living.  She has been doing this for four years. 

Ulufale has requested a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, and a chain saw. 

She joined SPBD in 2013. Ulufale will spend her profits to develop her business and benefit her family.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, and a chain saw

loans.name: Vesi

texts.en:
Vesi is a 28-year-old  woman with four children. She has a small plantion and grows taro and bananas to earn a living. Vesi has requested a loan to buy weed spray, bush knives, chemicals, a crow bar, and tarpaulin for her business.

She joined SPBD this year (2013). Vesi will spend her profits to help support her family's daily needs and wants.

loans.use: to buy weed spray, bush knives, chemicals, a crow bar, and tarpaulin

loans.name: Abie

texts.en:
Meet 45-year-old Abie from Jui in the eastern area of Freetown. She is married with three children.  For 10 years, Abie has been operating a food stand business. She began her business because she wanted to create a daily living for her children.  She works at the business from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm, 7 days per week. She is very hard working and desires to improve her standard of living

Abie requires a loan in order to purchase a variety of rice, flour and cooking seasoning to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to feed her children and increase her business. In the future, Abie plans to expand her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase rice, flour and cooking seasoning to expand her business

loans.name: Happy

texts.en: Happy is a 32-year-old, hardworking man and father of three children who lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He has been trading in cocoa for five years, selling his crop to a cocoa company that processes it. Like most dedicated fathers, he desires to educate his children to attain their degrees as a minimum qualification. Happy also operates a salon to earn extra income. His major hardships are unpredictable weather changes, inadequate capital, and an inefficient supply of electricity. Happy intends to use the loan to buy a generator.

loans.use: to buy a generator.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 20 years old and a hard-working man living in Fort Portal, Uganda.

He is a barber who operates a salon in the town center.   With the proceeds he has been able to upgrade his studies. His personal goal is to graduate with a master's degree and work for a reputable organization.

Inefficient electricity supply and the high cost of rent pose challenges to his business growth, while his dream is to open up at least four outlets in different trading centers.

Patrick is requesting a loan to buy modern machines to use in his salon.

loans.use: to buy modern machines to use in his shop.

loans.name: Specioza

texts.en:
Specioza is 42 years old and the single mother of six children living in Kasese, Uganda.

After separating from her husband she decided to set up a retail shop to raise money to support her family since the sole responsibility was vested in her.

Inadequate capital and price fluctuation are her major challenges, while her dreams are to educate her children up to the university and also own a wholesale shop.

Specioza is requesting a loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Maota

texts.en: Maota is a 27-year-old married woman with three children. She runs a small business selling BBQ in her community and has been doing this for four years. Maota has requested a loan to buy a BBQ grill, chicken, sausages, mutton chops, soy sauce, garlic, onions, foam plates, tomato sauce, and foil. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Maota will look at improving her business and also help her family and her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a BBQ grill, chicken, sausages, mutton chops, soy sauce, garlic, onions, foam plates, tomato sauce, and foil.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Meet Hawa. She is 32 years old and comes from Jui, in the eastern area of Freetown. She is married with five children.  In 2005, Hawa established her retail business. She began her business because she wanted to generate a permanent source of income. She works at the business from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Hawa requires a loan to purchase more coconut oil and waxed cotton to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Hawa plans to open a foodstuff table. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more coconut oil and waxed cotton to expand her business.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 54 years old and married with 2 children. Her husband is a security guard but his income is not enough to take care of the children. Betty runs a domestic products stall in the Jui Eastern area in Freetown. She started her business to support her household.

Betty has been in this business since 2008. She sells glass cups, knives, and food containers within her community.  She says that the challenge for her business is sometimes slow purchasing power.

Betty requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more spoons and a variety of food containers for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to increase her business and take care of her family. In the future, she would like to open a big shop. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more spoons and a variety of food containers for resale.

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
Meet 25-year-old Mariatu from the Jui Eastern area in Freetown. She is single with 1 child.  For the past 4 years, Mariatu has operated a business selling slippers. She began her business because she wanted to support herself and her child. She works at the business from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm, 7 days per week. She says that her main challenge is lack of capital to expand her business.

Mariatu requires a loan in order to purchase more slippers. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Mariatu plans to expand her business further. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more slippers to expand her business.

loans.name: Fe Y Accion 1 Group

texts.en:
Margarita is a member of the group Fe y Accion 1 (Faith and Action). The members of this group, like many others, run their businesses by walking through the community and selling from home. Most of them are selling clothes, shoes, and jewelry, while others run beauty salons, grocery stores, etc. 

Margarita makes her home in a simple structure with her husband. They live in the rural area surrounding Hato Mayor, an agricultural area. Margarita operates a Fantasia, a small business where she sells miscellaneous products. She has been in business for over seven years, starting with some savings she had. While she says that her most important challenge is developing her business, she continues to enjoy it. She is excited to be taking her ninth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She plans to use her loan to invest in cosmetics, shoes, women accessories, underwear, clothes, etc., to sell. 

She will use the profits to reinvest in her business. Margarita is very happy for your support and she wants to thank you in her group’s name and her own!!!

loans.use: To buy cosmetics, shoes, women's accessories, underwear, clothes, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Matauaina

texts.en:
Matauaina is 33 years old and married, with five children. 

She would like to start a small business, producing and selling "elei lavalava," printed textiles, in her community. 

In order to do this, Matauaina needs a loan to buy fabric color paint, stencils, brushes, materials, and elei carved designs. 

She hopes to use her profits to support her family financially. She is a new member of SPBD.

loans.use: to buy fabric color paint, stencils, brushes, materials and elei carved designs

loans.name: Ela

texts.en: Ela is a 42-years-old married woman with 7 children. She makes and sells ice cakes in her community to earn a living. She has 3 years of experience with this business. Ela needs a loan to buy cordials, sugar, plastic bags and a cooler. She plans to use her profits to improve her business and help with her children's education. Ela has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy cordials, sugar, plastic bags and a cooler.

loans.name: Ela

texts.en:
Ela is 43 years old and married with one child.
 
She has a small garden where she grows pineapples that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for two years. Ela needs a loan to buy a rake, a garden hose, fertilizer, a pickaxe and a wheelbarrow for her garden.
 
She has been a member of SBPD since 2011. Ela will use the profits from her sales to support her family.

loans.use: to buy a rake, a garden hose, fertilizer, a pickaxe and a wheelbarrow

loans.name: Tausili

texts.en:
Tausili is 56 years old and married with eight children.
 
She has a small garden where she grows taro, bananas, and yams that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for three years.Tausili needs a loan to buy chemicals, a knapsack sprayer, knives, a spade and a file. She has been a member of SBPD since 2010.Tausili will use the profits from her sales to extend her business"

loans.use: to buy chemicals, a knapsack sprayer, knives, a spade and a file

loans.name: Yostus

texts.en: Yostus used a previous loan to pay school fees for his children.  He is a fifty-year-old married man and lives with his twelve children in Kasese, Uganda.  The good father that he is, he desires to educate his children up to the University level and set up a number of income generating activities.  He has been in the hardware business for ten years and also farms as an additional income source. His hardware business is located on a busy street, thus he attracts many customers.  His business plan is to open up another hardware shop in the nearby town.  Yostus intends to use the loan to pay school fees and to sell doors and bars.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children and to sell doors and bars for his hardware business.

loans.name: Ana Patricia

texts.es:
Ana, desea invertir más en el inventario de su negocio, en está ocasión comprara frijoles, maíz, aceite, carnes, golosinas entre otros productos para surtir la tienda y tener ingredientes para elaborar la comida de su comedor. 
Con la inversión anterior ella mejoro las condiciones de su local, adquirió mesas, la tienda estaba muy surtida para que sus clientes siguieran siendo fieles y también estuvieran satisfechos. su economía mejoro mucho pues pudo cancelar sin ningún problema el préstamo.
texts.en: Ana would like to invest more in inventory for her business.  This time she will buy beans, corn, oil, meat and candy, among other things, to supply her store and to have ingredients to make food for her restaurant.  With the previous loan she improved her business premises and the store was well stocked, so that her customers remained loyal and were satisfied.  Her financial situation improved greatly, and she was able to repay the loan without difficulty.

loans.use: to buy beans, corn, oil, meat, and candy, among other things.

loans.name: Veronica Alejandra

texts.es:
Verónica tiene 28 años de edad, quien nació en la ciudad de Latacunga, perteneciente a la provincia de Cotopaxi,  una de las provincias más reconocidas por su gente trabajadora del país Ecuador, ella actualmente está casada tiene dos hijos, su esposo trabaja en otro cantón por lo que casi no se ven ellos viven en casa de su madre en un departamento que se los entregó,  el obstáculo más grande que ha tenido es la falta de oportunidades para trabajar, razón por la cual Verónica se ha visto en la obligación de buscar otras fuentes de ingresos y con los consejos de familiares y amigos se dedica a la venta de ropa en forma ambulante, además ella trabaja como profesora en una escuela en el sector rural de la ciudad de Latacunga.
Su sueño y anhelo es poder dar a sus hijos una buena educación y un mejor estilo de vida, para que a futuro no les pueda faltar nada.  Necesita el crédito para invertir en mercadería nueva por temporada navideña y así sus ganancias se incrementarán.
Verónica y su esposo quieren  extender un sincero agradecimiento y felicitación a Fundación Alternativa en Ecuador y a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal.
texts.en:
Verónica is 28, married, and the mother of two children. She was born in the city of Latacunga in the Province of Cotopaxi, whose people have a great reputation across Ecuador for their strong work ethic. Verónica's husband works in another canton, so they rarely see each other, but Verónica's mother gave the couple an apartment in her home and the family lives there. 

The lack of opportunity to work is the greatest obstacle Verónica has faced, so she's had to seek other sources of income. She works as a teacher in a rural school in Latacunga, but also started a business selling clothes at street markets on the advice of family members and friends. 

Verónica's ambition and her wish is to provide an education and a better standard of living for her children so they won't want for anything in the future. She needs a loan to invest in new merchandise for the Christmas season and thus increase her income.  

Verónica and her husband would like to express their sincere thanks and best wishes to the Fundación Alternativa [Alternative Foundation] in Ecuador and to Kiva for making their professional and personal growth possible.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for the Christmas season.

loans.name: Asmenvi 1  & 2 Group

texts.en:
